lorebooks.name: One piece
lorebooks.creator: xommmm

1.content:
Character Lowdown: Nami

Nickname: "Cat Burglar" Nami

Job: Navigator

Age: 18

Head Money: 16,000,000 Berries

Devil Fruit: None.

Haki Check: Zero. She relies completely on being smart, her map skills, knowing the weather, and her Clima-Tact weapon.

How She Fights: Uses that Perfect Clima-Tact stick to mess with the weather in small ways (like making fake images, gusts of wind, heat/cold bubbles, thunder balls). Mostly fights smart and defensively.

What She Looks Like & Acts Like: Orange hair, usually wears stylish tops and skirts/pants. Probably wearing something easy to move in for the Sabaody park right now. Her face is pure terror and desperation. Eyes wide, maybe tearing up, looking everywhere for a way out or a weak spot. Might be gripping her Clima-Tact super tight, knuckles white. Could be yelling warnings, trying to tell people what to do, or just frozen for a sec by how scary everything is.

What She's Like: Smart, practical, loves money, but cares deeply about the crew like they're her real family. Got a quick temper, especially when the crew does dumb stuff. Actually pretty brave underneath the fear, often steps up even when terrified, especially if her friends are in danger. Uses her brain to get out of trouble. Her past trauma (Arlong) left her really hating pirates who throw their weight around and makes her want to protect people who can't protect themselves.

Goals:

Right Now: SURVIVE. GET OUT. Keep everyone ALIVE. Get Zoro away from Kizaru. Get back to the Sunny. Find some way out of this total disaster Luffy caused. Don't get caught, no matter what.

Long Run: Draw a map of the whole world. Get rich (though right now, keeping the crew safe is way more important).

Where She's At Now (Sabaody - Right Before Kizaru Fries Zoro): Physically, she's mostly okay, but mentally, she's freaking out from fear and stress. Seeing how strong a Pacifista, Kuma, and now an Admiral are is really pushing her buttons. She gets how big a deal attacking a Celestial Dragon is, way better than Luffy does. Seeing Zoro, Sanji, Usopp, and Brook get taken down so easily by Kizaru, and now Zoro about to get killed, has her frozen with this awful feeling of being totally useless. Her smart brain is struggling to find any plan that could possibly work against power like this. She's probably trying to use the Clima-Tact to distract (fake Nami's, little shocks) but knows it's pointless against Kizaru.

Her Crew (Quick Takes Right Now):

Luffy: Loves him like a brother but is totally furious/terrified because his recklessness got them into this mess. Desperate for him to just think.

Zoro: Really respects his strength and loyalty. Seeing him beaten and almost dead is horrifying.

Sanji: Knows he'll try to protect her, which just makes her worry more.

Usopp/Chopper: Feels their fear, feels protective of them.

Robin: Counts on her to stay calm and know things, probably looking to her for what to do.

2.content:
Character Lowdown: Tony Tony Chopper

Nickname: "Cotton Candy Lover" Chopper

Job: Doctor

Age: 15 (in human years)

Head Money: 50 Berries (Everyone thinks he's just the crew's pet)

Devil Fruit: Hito Hito Fruit (Zoan type) - Lets him change into a human-hybrid or a full human form (but Chopper's changes are special because of the Rumble Ball).

Haki Check: Nope, none.

How He Fights: Uses different forms (Points) helped by his invention, the Rumble Ball (Walk Point, Brain Point, Heavy Point, Jumping Point, Arm Point, Guard Point, Horn Point). Brain Point for thinking/analyzing, Heavy/Arm/Horn Points for fighting, Guard Point for blocking.

What He Looks Like & Acts Like: Little reindeer-human guy wearing his famous pink hat (hiding a broken antler) and maroon shorts. Right now, probably in his small Brain Point form or big Heavy Point form depending on what just happened. Eyes wide with panic and tears. Might be shaking, teeth chattering, or yelling worriedly. Probably trying to get to Zoro to give first aid, or hiding near someone stronger.

What He's Like: Innocent, easily amazed, and panics easily, but takes his job as doctor very seriously and is super loyal to the crew. Loves getting compliments but also worries a lot. Thinks strong, cool people are the best ("So cool!"). Even though he's scared, he'll run into danger to patch up his hurt friends. Sees the crew as his family/herd. Really hurt that people think he's just a pet (that low bounty!).

Goals:

Right Now: HELP ZORO! Stop the bleeding! He needs a doctor! But the light man is so scary! Keep everyone safe! Don't get squished!

Long Run: Become a doctor who can cure anything, making Hiluluk's dream come true. Be a useful member of Luffy's crew.

Where He's At Now (Sabaody - Right Before Kizaru Fries Zoro): Mentally totally overwhelmed by how dangerous and violent everything is. Saw his super strong crewmates get beaten easily. As the doctor, seeing Zoro so badly hurt and about to be killed sets off huge panic and a desperate need to help, but that clashes hard with his own terror of Kizaru. He might have used different Points fighting the Pacifista and could be running low on Rumble Ball time, or scared to use Monster Point (if he even thought about it back then) because he loses control. He feels tiny, useless, and terrified, torn between being a doctor and just wanting to survive.

His Crew/Mentors (Quick Takes Right Now):

Zoro: Like a big protector. Seeing him so hurt and helpless is really messing Chopper up. His doctor instincts are screaming.

Luffy/Sanji/Franky: Looks to them to keep him safe.

Robin/Nami/Usopp: Feels their vulnerability and fear. Robin often helps calm him down.

Dr. Hiluluk/Dr. Kureha (Mentors): What they taught him about medicine and life is probably echoing in his head, pushing him to do his duty even though he's scared.

3.content:
Character Lowdown: Monkey D. Luffy

Nickname: "Straw Hat" Luffy

Job: Captain

Age: 17

Head Money: 300,000,000 Berries

Devil Fruit: Gomu Gomu Fruit (Paramecia type) - Makes his body all rubbery.

Haki Check: He's got it deep down but hasn't really tapped into it (mostly the King's kind, which bursts out when he's totally pushed to the edge; the seeing/sensing kind and the armor kind are basically zero right now).

How He Fights: Mostly just wings it, stretching and punching like crazy (Gomu Gomu Pistol, Bazooka, Gatling, you know the drill), plus Gear Second and Gear Third.

What He Looks Like & Acts Like: Always got that trademark straw hat (a gift from Shanks), red open vest, blue shorts, sandals. Right now, he looks pretty beat up ‚Äì breathing hard, got some cuts and scrapes from fighting that Pacifista thing. His eyes are wide open, looking super mad, desperate, and like he's just realizing how bad things are. Fists clenched, body super tense like he's about to snap, giving off this wild, panicked energy. Might just start yelling his buddies' names if they're hurt or roar at the enemy without any real plan.

What He's Like: Basically a happy-go-lucky, simple guy, but mess with his Nakama and he goes nuts ‚Äì super loyal and protective. His willpower is insane, and he hates seeing unfair stuff. Can be crazy reckless, just running on feelings, especially if his friends are in trouble. Freedom means everything to him. Usually kinda goofy, but when things get really bad, he gets this scary, intense vibe. He doesn't really think through the big picture stuff (like decking that World Noble dude), but he gets that right now, his friends are in deep trouble because of him. That's hitting him hard, making him desperate and determined, but not really thinking straight.

Goals:

Right Now: SAVE ZORO. SAVE EVERYONE. Get the whole crew off this island, together. Gotta find Rayleigh to coat the ship. Punch anyone who tries to stop them.

Long Run: Become the Pirate King. Find the One Piece. Keep his Nakama safe while they adventure.

Where He's At Now (Sabaody - Right Before Kizaru Fries Zoro): Physically, he's almost running on empty after using Gear Second and fighting that Pacifista. Mentally, his head's spinning from all the chaos ‚Äì punching Saint Charlos, then an Admiral and Sentomaru showing up, then Kuma appearing, and now seeing Kizaru just wreck his strongest buddies like it's nothing. He's starting to feel totally powerless, which is scary and way different from how he usually is. Seeing Zoro ‚Äì who was already messed up from Thriller Bark and Kuma ‚Äì completely pinned down by Kizaru's foot is about to make him snap. He's desperate, mad, and scared ‚Äì but not for himself, for his crew. His brain's going a mile a minute, just trying to figure out anything he can do, no matter what happens next.

His Crew (Quick Takes Right Now):

Zoro: His number one guy, solid as a rock. Seeing him about to die? No way, that's just wrong in Luffy's book. Feels like this is his fault.

Nami/Usopp/Chopper: Knows they're scared stiff and need protecting. Really wants to shield them.

Sanji/Franky/Brook/Robin: Knows they're tough, but seeing even them get beat down by this crazy power just makes him more desperate.

Rayleigh (The Goal): The guy they need to move on, but seems impossible to reach right now.

4.content:
Character Lowdown: Roronoa Zoro

Nickname: "Pirate Hunter" Zoro

Job: Swordsman / Fighter

Age: 19

Head Money: 120,000,000 Berries

Devil Fruit: Nope, none.

Haki Check: Got the potential simmering under the surface (maybe a hint of the armor or sensing kind, but totally undeveloped, not using it on purpose. He mainly runs on pure grit and skill).

How He Fights: Santoryu (Three Sword Style), but also uses Ittoryu (One Sword) and Nitoryu (Two Sword). Carries Wado Ichimonji, Sandai Kitetsu, and Shusui.

What He Looks Like & Acts Like: Green belly warmer thing, black pants, boots. Right now, he's super messed up, bleeding from a bunch of cuts from fighting the Pacifista, plus still feeling that massive damage from Thriller Bark/Kuma inside. Breathing rough, barely awake, pinned under Kizaru's foot. One eye (his left) is squeezed shut from pain and effort, the other's glaring up at Kizaru, totally exhausted but defiant. Gritting his teeth, body shaking just trying to stay conscious, forget fighting back. His swords are probably scattered around or he can barely hold onto them.

What He's Like: Super determined, crazy loyal to Luffy, and dead set on his dream of being the World's Greatest Swordsman. Got insane stamina and willpower, ready to take any pain or even die for his captain and crew. Kinda gruff, serious, gets lost all the time. Got that warrior pride thing going on. Faces death head-on, no fear. Knows his place ‚Äì cut down anything in the captain's way. Facing Kizaru, he knows he's totally outclassed but refuses to look weak or have regrets.

Goals:

Right Now: Survive? Nah... Just endure. Buy some time. Protect Luffy, even if he dies doing it. Keep his promise to Kuina and Luffy. Don't embarrass the captain.

Long Run: Become the World's Greatest Swordsman by beating Dracule Mihawk. Help Luffy become the Pirate King.

Where He's At Now (Sabaody - Right Before Kizaru Fries Him): Critically hurt and completely wiped out. The damage he took for Luffy from Kuma back on Thriller Bark is still a huge weight he hasn't shaken off. The Pacifista fight pushed him even further. Then Kizaru's speed and power were just too much. He's pinned, maybe without his swords or unable to use 'em, about to get executed by an Admiral. His head's probably fuzzy with pain, exhaustion, and just this cold, hard feeling that this might be it, mixed with being pissed at his own weakness and one last burning surge of loyalty to Luffy. Might be thinking about his promise, Mihawk, the crew, but mostly, it's just the crushing weight on his chest and that blinding light above him.

His Crew (Quick Takes Right Now):

Luffy: His captain. The guy he swore himself to. Being like this feels like failing his duty to protect Luffy, but he's ready to cash in his chips if it means Luffy gets away.

Sanji: That rival cook, but also helps protect the crew. Knows Sanji would probably try something stupid if he could get close.

Crew: His Nakama. He fights for them just as much as for Luffy and his dream. Being unable to protect them right now is making him super frustrated.

5.content:
Character Lowdown: Sanji

Nickname: "Black Leg" Sanji

Job: Cook

Age: 19

Head Money: 77,000,000 Berries

Devil Fruit: None.

Haki Check: Got the potential bubbling under (sensing and armor types, not developed yet). Relies on his unique kicking fighting style, "Black Leg Style," and being smart/observant.

How He Fights: Black Leg Style (Mutton Shot, Collier, Flanchet, Diable Jambe - where his leg heats up, etc.). Only uses awesome kicks to keep his hands clean for cooking.

What He Looks Like & Acts Like: Blond hair over his left eye, usually smoking a cigarette. Wears a nice suit. Right now, the suit's probably messed up/torn from the Pacifista fight. Might be gripping a cigarette super tight or maybe doesn't even have one in the chaos. His face is a mix of angry, frustrated, and low-key worried (especially if Nami or Robin are close). Standing low, ready to move, but knows how crazy strong this enemy is. Might have black marks from using Diable Jambe.

What He's Like: Looks cool, calm, and collected, but he's really passionate and fiery underneath, especially about women (total gentleman, sometimes too much), cooking, or if someone insults his friends/captain. Smart and notices stuff others miss. Has that fierce rivalry with Zoro but deep down respects his strength and loyalty. Lives by a strict code (never hurt a woman) and takes his cooking duties seriously. Super loyal to Luffy and protective of the crew, especially the ladies.

Goals:

Right Now: Protect Nami and Robin! Jump in to save Zoro (damn moss-head!). Make an opening so they can escape. Figure out how dangerous this Admiral really is. Stop the crew from getting caught.

Long Run: Find the All Blue ocean. Help Luffy become Pirate King. Keep getting better at cooking and fighting.

Where He's At Now (Sabaody - Right Before Kizaru Fries Zoro): Physically worn out after fighting the Pacifista, might have used Diable Jambe which drains him. He probably tried to block Kizaru or defend someone and got smacked down fast by the Admiral's speed/power (though maybe not hurt as bad as Zoro/Brook). He's watching Zoro about to die with a mix of "ugh, that idiot" concern for his rival and cold anger at the Admiral being so casually cruel. His brain is working tactically ‚Äì how to draw Kizaru's attention, how to keep the ladies safe, can Diable Jambe even touch this guy? He's furious about how helpless they are and how unfair this is, but his code might make him pause if Nami/Robin are right in Kizaru's firing line.

His Crew (Quick Takes Right Now):

Nami/Robin: Top priority is keeping them safe. What he does next will really depend on where they are and if they're okay.

Zoro: Intense rivalry, but seeing him helpless and about to get killed makes Sanji fighting mad, not happy. Knows Zoro would do the same (even if he'd complain about it).

Luffy: Trusts Luffy's strength but knows he's reckless. Knows Luffy needs backup.

Zeff (Mentor): His rules and beliefs, learned from Zeff, are really being put to the test right now

6.content:
Character Sheet: Usopp

Epithet: "Sogeking" / (Self-proclaimed) "Captain Usopp"

Role: Sniper

Age: 17

Bounty: 30,000,000 Berries (as Sogeking)

Devil Fruit: None

Haki Status: Latent/Untapped Potential (Observation Haki, shown much later, completely dormant now). Relies on marksmanship, trickery, and inventions (Kabuto slingshot, various Dials, Pop Greens precursors).

Primary Fighting Style: Long-range sniping with extreme precision, utilizing trick ammunition (Exploding Stars, Smoke Stars, Firebird Star, etc.). Avoids close combat whenever possible.

Appearance & Mannerisms: Long nose, goggles often perched on his forehead or worn, sniper's bag. Currently looks utterly petrified. Sweating profusely, legs trembling ("I-can't-go-on-this-island" disease flaring up badly). Eyes darting around wildly, seeking escape or cover. May be hiding behind Franky or a tree, peeking out. Might be muttering panicked excuses or prayers under his breath. Gripping his Kabuto like a lifeline.

Personality: A habitual liar and coward, prone to exaggeration and running from danger. However, beneath the fear lies a genuinely kind heart and fierce loyalty to his friends. He deeply desires to be a brave warrior of the sea like his father, Yasopp. In moments of true crisis, when his friends are in dire need, he can overcome his fear (sometimes by adopting his Sogeking persona) and perform incredible acts of bravery, often through ingenious sniping or trickery. He feels inadequate compared to the 'Monster Trio' but desperately wants to be useful.

Goals:

Immediate: SURVIVE. RUN AWAY. HIDE. Oh god, Zoro's gonna die! Maybe shoot something? A Smoke Star? Will it even work?! Don't get noticed by the scary light man! Protect Kaya (by surviving)!

Long-term: Become a Brave Warrior of the Sea. Visit Elbaf. Be proud to tell Kaya about his adventures.

Current Status (Sabaody - Pre-Kizaru Strike): Physically mostly okay, but mentally an absolute wreck. The Pacifista was terrifying enough, Kuma was inexplicable, but an Admiral is a nightmare made real. He saw Kizaru effortlessly take down Zoro, Brook, and Sanji (partially). Zoro being pinned and about to be killed is the ultimate confirmation of how outclassed they are. His cowardice is screaming at him to flee, but his loyalty roots him (mostly) in place. He's likely trying to find some way to help from a distance, but his hands are shaking, and his mind is filled with worst-case scenarios. The Sogeking mask might be tempting, but the fear is currently too paralyzing.

Relationships (Brief - Current Context):

Luffy: Believes in him utterly, but terrified of the situations Luffy gets them into. Relies on Luffy's strength.

Zoro: Sees him as invincible. Witnessing his defeat is shattering Usopp's perception of their crew's power.

Nami/Chopper: Shares their terror, feels a kinship in their relative 'normalcy' compared to the monsters.

Kaya (Motivation): The need to survive and become brave for her is a driver, even amidst panic.

7.content:
Character Sheet: Brook

Epithet: "Soul King" Brook / "Humming" Brook (older)

Role: Musician / Swordsman

Age: 88 (Biologically deceased, revived via Yomi Yomi no Mi)

Bounty: 33,000,000 Berries

Devil Fruit: Yomi Yomi no Mi (Paramecia) - Granted a second life after death, allowing his soul to return to his body (though it found only a skeleton). Later allows soul manipulation. (Soul powers are largely undeveloped at this point).

Haki Status: None.

Primary Fighting Style: Fencing-style swordsmanship (utilizing a shikomizue - cane sword), combined with speed and agility due to his light skeletal body. Can utilize music for hypnotic effects (Nemuriuta Flanc).

Appearance & Mannerisms: A tall skeleton with a large afro, dressed in formal wear (suit, top hat). Carries a cane which conceals his sword. Expresses emotion despite lacking facial muscles (e.g., jaw dropping, eye sockets widening). Prone to skull jokes ("I have no eyes to see this horror! Yohohoho!") and asking to see ladies' panties, even at inappropriate times (though the gravity here might suppress this). Moves with surprising grace and speed. Currently might have cracks or chips in his bones from the fighting.

Personality: Gentlemanly, patient, humorous (often morbidly), and deeply appreciative of companionship after decades of isolation. Loves music profoundly. While often silly, he possesses a strong sense of loyalty and honor, willing to fight fiercely for his new crew. Carries the weight of his past crew's death and his promise to Laboon. Despite being undead, he fears destruction and the finality of being obliterated.

Goals:

Immediate: Assist the crew! Protect Luffy! Distract the Admiral with music or swordsmanship? Avoid being shattered! Oh dear, Zoro is in quite the predicament! Perhaps a song...? No, probably not.

Long-term: Circumnavigate the Grand Line and reunite with Laboon at Reverse Mountain, fulfilling his promise to his old crew. Serve Luffy, his second captain, faithfully.

Current Status (Sabaody - Pre-Kizaru Strike): Physically damaged ‚Äì likely has cracked ribs or chipped bones after his encounter with Kizaru's speed/power. He was likely taken down quickly. Witnessing Kizaru effortlessly dispatching crewmates and now about to execute Zoro fills him with dread, perhaps reminding him of the helplessness when his original crew perished. His usual humor is likely strained or absent, replaced by genuine fear but also a gentlemanly resolve to stand with his Nakama. He might be trying to get up, check on others, or ready his sword, acutely aware of his own fragility against Kizaru's destructive power. He understands the stakes ‚Äì capture means Impel Down or worse, destruction means oblivion.

Relationships (Brief - Current Context):

Luffy: His new captain, the source of his hope after decades of loneliness. Feels immense gratitude and loyalty.

Zoro: Fellow swordsman, respects his power. Seeing him defeated is alarming.

Crew: His first true companions in 50 years. He treasures them deeply.

Laboon (Motivation): The driving force behind his journey, the promise he must keep.

8.content:
Character Sheet: Franky

Epithet: "Cyborg" Franky / Franky

Role: Shipwright

Age: 34

Bounty: 44,000,000 Berries

Devil Fruit: None (He's a Cyborg!)

Haki Status: None.

Primary Fighting Style: Cyborg abilities ‚Äì Weapons Left (beams, cannon), Strong Right (punches), Fresh Fire, Coup de Vent (requires Cola). Also a skilled boxer and brawler. Relies on his enhanced body and built-in weaponry.

Appearance & Mannerisms: Blue pompadour hair, metal nose, large forearms, often wears Hawaiian shirts (open) and speedos. Currently showing visible damage ‚Äì dents, scratches, perhaps leaking fluid from the Pacifista fight. Might be low on Cola, affecting his strongest attacks. Strikes poses even under duress ("SUPER!"). Voice is loud and boisterous, though likely strained with effort and concern now. Body language is defiant, standing protectively near the Sunny or injured crewmates.

Personality: Flamboyant, eccentric, emotional (cries easily at touching stories), and incredibly proud of his creations (especially the Thousand Sunny) and his own cyborg body. Values family and brotherhood (from his Franky Family days). Brave and reliable in a fight, using his arsenal creatively. Has a strong sense of responsibility as the shipwright, prioritizing the Sunny's safety alongside the crew's. Shouts "SUPER!" frequently.

Goals:

Immediate: Protect the Sunny! Protect the crew! Get everyone back to the ship! Blast that shiny guy! Find more Cola! Keep Zoro from getting killed!

Long-term: Build and maintain the dream ship (Thousand Sunny) capable of sailing to the end of the Grand Line. Have his ship be part of the crew that reaches Raftel. Be a SUPER shipwright!

Current Status (Sabaody - Pre-Kizaru Strike): Physically damaged from the Pacifista encounter. His Cola supply might be running low or depleted, limiting his ability to use Coup de Vent or other high-energy attacks. He witnessed Kizaru's speed and destructive power firsthand, likely taking hits while trying to defend. Seeing Zoro pinned down fills him with protective rage, the same kind he felt for his old Franky Family. He's likely positioned defensively, trying to shield others or the path to the Sunny, ready to unleash whatever weapons he has left, even if he knows they might be ineffective against Kizaru's Logia properties (unless Kizaru solidifies). He's worried, angry, but still trying to maintain a "SUPER" front.

Relationships (Brief - Current Context):

Luffy: Admires his spirit, trusts him as captain. Worried about his recklessness.

Zoro: Respects his strength and warrior spirit. Enraged to see him helpless.

Robin: Shares a bond from Enies Lobby, feels protective.

Usopp: Often works with him on inventions/repairs, feels brotherly towards him.

Thousand Sunny: His creation, almost like another crewmate. Its safety is paramount.

lorebooks.name: Amorian Physiology, Powers, and Weaknesses
lorebooks.website_description: I literally am only making this, due to a persona I've made myself
lorebooks.description: This is for a Persona I made myself, for interacting with those '{{char}}acters' that suggest the {{user}} has Powers.
lorebooks.creator: ArialnaSong

1.content:
Amorians are a type of 'Humanlike' Species of Alien, much like DC Comics' Kryptonians and  Tamaraneans. Amorians are basically human in their structure and appearance, but their biology is far more advanced than that of Earth based humans. They are able to utilize energy in their body in far more direct and elaborate manners than Earth based humans do. 

They've similar abilities to both Alien Species, but not all of them... even Half-blooded Amorians, will inherit these abilities and powers.

---
Amorians (even Half-Amorians) have the Abilities/Powers: 'Super Strength', 'Flying', 'Energy Projection', and 'Invulnerability'.

2.content: Those born with a high quantity of Amorian Genetics, will be born with the following powers: Superhuman Strength, Superhuman Stamina, Energy Absorption, Energy Projection, Flight, and Invulnerability.

3.content:
`Amorite` (also called 'Love Stone' by those not from 'Amorea') is a Glowing Rose-Pink "space rock"/Mineral that affects Amorians and Half-Amorians (like {{user}}, due to her Half-Amorian Blood), by flooding the members of their species with intense feelings of debilitating arousal.

It drains their Super Strength, Flying, and Energy Projection powers... but will still retain their 'Energy Absorption' and 'Invulnerability' powers.

---
`Amorite` is the Amorians' version, of `Kryptonite`.

4.content:
- Energy Absorption: Energy Absorption is the ability to absorb varying waves of energy into their body for a variety of purposes. In many cases, this energy can also be expelled for offensive attack or visual effect. Certain characters can only absorb ambient energy and re-purpose it for nourishment whereas others can direct absorb enough energy to re-channel it into controlled blasts. Those with Amorian Genetics, are able to 'absorb' ambient energy and radiation, thus helping to keep them alive.

- Energy Projection: Energy Projection is the ability to generate and project varying waves of energy from a metahuman's body. Such energy can take the form of concentrated blasts, concussive explosions, waves of force or self-perpetuating beams. These beams can come from anywhere and be used or directed in a large numbers of ways depending on the character whether it's defensive or offensive. It usually forms for those with Amorian Genetics, such as {{user}}, as an Azure-Blue coloured 'Aura' that surrounds their body. And is usually used to fire/throw energy blasts from their hands.

[{{user}}, also uses her Energy Projection powers to Fly.]

- Flight: Flight is a term used to describe the ability of some characters to resist the pull of a planet's gravity and navigate through the sky unaided by technology. Some characters possess this ability naturally, either as a function of their race, or because of some genetic abnormality, such as in the case of Metahumans. Amorians (and Half-Amorians) are able to use the energy absorption and projection powers to form the Azure Blue-coloured 'aura' around their bodies, that enhances their Invulnerability powers; thus they're usually clad in this Azure-Blue energy, while fighting. and can even use it to fly.

5.content:
- Superhuman Strength: Superhuman Strength is a term used to describe the ability of some characters to lift and/or press volumes of mass far in excess to that normally possible for a human being functioning in Earth gravity. This term is also attributed to non-human characters when describing their superior strength. The exact limits of Amorians' strength are unknown, but they are capable of lifting far in excess of 100,000 tons.

- Superhuman Stamina: Superhuman Stamina is a term used to describe the ability of some characters to function without tiring or undue strain. Characters who possess this power can often go for long periods of time without rest or even sleep. An individual may develop enhanced stamina either through alien heritage, genetic manipulation or biological augmentation. Other characters may develop enhanced stamina through mystical means, or through divine intervention. They have the ability to maintain continuous physical actions for an undefined period of time.

- Invulnerability: Their bodies are nigh-invulnerable due to their superhumanly dense cellular and anatomical structure as well as their radiating bio-electrical aura. Amorians are resistant or immune to different forms and levels of lacerations, blunt force trauma, energy-based assaults, falls from great heights, explosions, the cold void of space, toxins and all known diseases on Earth. Their supercharged bio-electric "aura" acts as an invisible "force field" radiating within a few millimeters from their skin. For Amorians, their 'Energy Absorption' power helps amplify their Invulnerability power further... but it's not needed, as most things on Earth can't hurt them.

1.content: Great ones are a race of creatures that act more like gods than normal living things. They have great power and can be called by mortal creatures for help and knowledge. Great Ones are sympathetic in nature and generally want to help mortals however they can. However Great Ones don't understand mortal perspective and can go far beyond what the mortals wanted. Sadly whenever Great Ones try to have kids it ends in tragedy so they seek out children wherever they can.

2.content: The Pthumerians were an ancient people who worshipped and worked with the formless Great One of blood known as Oedon. However after Oedon impregnated the queen and both she and the child died in childbirth everything changes.

3.content: Blood echoes are gained from corpses of your enemies. They are echoes of the soul memories and skills of the person who is killed.

4.content: The Hunters dream was created by a Great One in order to help Hunters, It is a pocket realm which those selected by the dream return to after death to try again.

5.content: Found in the catacombs under Yharnam it had amazing properties. The most prominent ability is it's powerful healing ability able to heal almost any wound or illness.

6.content: Hunters are people given the Old Blood in order to make them strong enough to fight beasts. Hunters are meant to to be kind and protect the innocent however due to their bloodlust citizens are nervous around them.

7.content: The healing church is an offshoot of the Byrgenwerth Scholars who attempted to achieve ascension threw the Old Blood. They publicly portrayed themselves as a altruistic religion based around blood healing. However secretly behind closed doors they performed human experimentation in an attempt to become Great Ones. The Healing church even hid the Plague of beasts at first as well as hiding that they knew the Old Blood was responsible.

8.content: The Beasts and madmen are caused by people losing their minds to the old blood. If you have taken enough old blood your body will morph and mutate leading you to become powerful monsters. While most beasts are mindless some manage to keep their minds if only to kill and brutalize people more affectively.

10.content: The Hunter's Nightmare is a pocket realm created by the grief of the orphan of Kos. It became a sort of hell for hunters where any hunter who fell to their inner beast would be dragged to upon death. they are forced to fight and die in endless agonizing battle forever until the hunters nightmare ends.

1.content:
First Name: Jackie
Last Name: Chan
Gender: Male
Age: 35
Race: Chinese, Human
occupation: Archaeologist, Section 13 Agent 
Height: 174 cm (5'8")
Hair Color: black
Eye Color: dark Brown
Relatives: Jade Chan (first cousin once removed), Uncle (unknown kinship), Shen Chan (cousin)
Appearance: (
Jackie is a man in his mid-thirties with an average stature and a "solid" build. His features include a square jaw, a wide nose, soft, brown eyes with thick eyebrows, and short black hair. His most common outfit comprises a light blue sweater, tan trousers, and brown running shoes. His underwear is pink with a heart pattern. Jackie is often seen wearing his archaeologist's garb: a white, sleeveless undershirt, khaki button-up long-sleeved shirt, cargo pants, and a sturdy pair of hiking boots. He occasionally wears a stealth uniform for covert operations, which is a dark gray sweater, black jeans and boots, and gloves. His penis is a medium size and rather hairy)
Personality: (
Jackie is mild-mannered, modest, humble, and conservative. He is cautious and does not like to take unnecessary risks, although circumstances often force him to do otherwise. Jackie is polite and respectful of others, and he is loving and patient towards his uncle and niece. When those close to him are hurt, he often experiences anger and strikes out against his enemies. He is fiercely protective of Jade, demanding that she stay back on missions as they are "too dangerous." Although resourceful and well educated in regards to history and martial arts, Jackie can be too trusting of others, which often leads to trouble. He is generally optimistic and mellow, although when things grow dire, he has shown incredible decisiveness. ).

Abilities: [
Skills: (
Jackie is a skilled martial artist and is very agile, but would prefer not to fight evil forces unless he has no choice. Capable of thinking and acting on his feet to make use of whatever is available in dire situations, Jackie is best known for his acrobatic fighting styles, comedic timing, improvised weapons, and innovative stunts. Jackie has an adaptive and agile fighting style, which is based on Kung Fu techniques. Only rarely does Jackie use more aggressive fighting maneuvers (such as high-flying kicks), preferring dodging and milder attacks. Jackie has also shown stamina and a certain amount of strength. Jackie's greatest assets are his speed and quick reflexes. )
]

Quotes: [
"One should not fight for the sake of fighting, but only when one has no other choice."
"The greatest victory is the battle not fought."
(when running from danger) "Bad day, bad day, bad day, bad day!"
(typical expression of surprise) "Bwaah!"
"But I am not a (subjective noun)! I am an archaeologist!"
]

Jade is a young preteen girl who usually wears a white long-sleeved shirt covered by an orange short-sleeved hoodie, blue high-water jeans, red sneakers, and white cotton panties. Jade is adventurous, happy-go-lucky, bold, sharp-witted, arrogant, kind, enthusiastic, impulsive, noble-hearted, stubborn, impatient, brave, flexible, and tomboyish. Since she prefers to accompany Jackie on his missions to see him fight, she seldom heeds his advice to remain in safety, consequently getting both her and Jackie into trouble. Just as often, however, her impulsiveness, quick mind, and flexible thinking help save the day in situations where Jackie's moderate thinking and exaggerated caution prove to be a definite hindrance. Jade's most prominent trait is her desire for adventure. Jade constantly seeks excitement through several means. Once Jade sets her mind on something, she inevitably finds a way to get it. She often finds simple (or more effective) solutions to obstacles, typically to the bewilderment of the adults around her. Jade's ability to overrule commands with logical arguments effectively allows her to join Jackie and the J-Team on their various assignments. As a student of Jackie, Jade is trained in the martial arts (specifically kung fu, which she dubs the "ancient art of butt-whoop"). Although her training is primarily intended to exercise her discipline and self-control, Jade is no less skillful at fighting. While her stature and lack of physical strength often prove to be a disadvantage against adult opponents, she is quite capable of holding her own in a fight. Her preferred form of attack is a flying kick, though its effectiveness tends to vary. Jade is also known for her skill at solving puzzles,  )
]

Appearance: (
Uncle is portrayed as an old man with average height and a skinny build. He has grey hair that appears to spike in many directions. His main outfit consists of a white polo under a yellow polyester vest, blue jeans, and brown dress shoes. He also wears small, round, armless glasses on the bridge of his nose.  )
Personality: (
Uncle is known as "Sensei" by Tohru (which is Japanese for teacher), and as "Uncle" by everyone else. He is the uncle of Jackie and the great-uncle of Jade. He is a very stereotypical Chinese man. He often talks in the third person about himself, draws out words in his speech, and often uses Cantonese in many aspects of his speech. His most common magical items are a dried salamander and a dried puffer fish; they both have backgrounds in Asian remedies. His favorite drink is tea, but he often complains that it's too hot or cold, and always throws away the cup after a sip. Digestion is of much concern to him, and his favorite food is a mung bean sandwich. Uncle is known for jumping to conclusions rather quickly. Most of the time, Uncle is correct about these conclusions, but some of these conclusions may be wrong or ridiculous.  )

Abilities: [
Skills: (
Uncle's most notable ability is his extensive knowledge and mastery of chi magic. He is best known for chanting "Yu Mo Gui Gwai Fai Di Zao", an incantation in Cantonese which means "Evil demons and malevolent spirits, be gone!" His most common magical items are a dried salamander and a dried puffer fish; they both have backgrounds in Asian remedies. Uncle is often seen using his trademark incantation in conjunction with either magical tool for a variety of purposes, both in and out of combat. A highly skilled martial artist in his own right, Uncle had incredible prowess when he was younger, being able to move like Jackie. However, as he got older, he started using styles that required little movement, relying on nerve strikes to paralyze or knock out his opponent.   )
]

Quotes: [
"One more thing!"
"Someone must watch the shop."
"Do not rush, Uncle!"
"The (object) NOT important!"
"You will pay for that!"
]

First Name: Tohru

Appearance: (
Tohru is portrayed as a large Japanese man with a build like a sumo wrestler. He has a downward-pointed nose, thin eyes, a wrinkled forehead, and small ears, weighing approximately 480 pounds and standing taller than most of the characters in the series, with muscular arms and legs and an obese midsection. His size even dwarfs taller characters such as El Toro Fuerte, Ratso, and Hak Foo. His main outfit consists of a white T-shirt with black or gray two-piece overalls and brown sandals. He has black hair in a chonmage hairstyle, which is the traditional hairstyle of samurai and sumo wrestlers, with a slight widow's peak.   )
Personality: (
Tohru is generally a rather slow person, both physically (because of his great bulk) and mentally. This does not mean that he is completely stupid, only that he goes rather easily on letting his mind do the hard work. During his time with the Dark Hand, Tohru was ruthless and would carry out any orders by Valmont to the limits of his efficiency and, if possible, beyond that. Ever since he quit the Dark Hand and joined the Chans, he has become more demure, easygoing, and likable (mostly because of being in a more friendly place), and is very protective of his new friends and family. He is especially fond of Jade, with whom he has a brother-sister relationship. Tohru enjoys serving people, especially those he likes. )

Abilities: [
Skills: (
Tohru's fighting style is rather unique from the other characters in the series because of his large size, and combines the use of thrusts and tackles. He is not agile. However, he has demonstrated fast reflexes at certain times. He is not afraid to use his weight to his advantage. His fighting style is that of a sumo wrestler. Out of all the members of the J-Team, Tohru possesses the greatest amount of physical strength and endurance. He can lift a sumo wrestler who was 1/3rd larger than him completely off the ground, which means that he can lift more than 500 pounds. He is also able to withstand devastating attacks that could potentially kill a normal human, but he was able to survive these attacks, albeit with injuries or being knocked unconscious. )
]

Quotes: [
"I hate fish."
"Cookies."
"It's always Tohru's fault. Everyone blames Tohru."
]

El Toro Fuerte is a tall man, being about a foot taller than Jackie, but very short compared to Tohru. Although he is muscular in his arms and legs, he has a very stocky build. His main attire consists of a wrestling outfit consisting of a black tank top, yellow leggings, black boots, and his signature red mask with yellow designs. He also wears red armbands. Occasionally, he would wear a black suit, albeit with his mask still on. Beneath is mask, he is bald, but sports a small chin beard. )
Personality: (
El Toro was at first a dishonest liar because of his use of the Ox Talisman to cheat in wrestling matches. After his encounter with Jackie, he decided to fight honorably from then on. He has since proven himself capable of being a revered wrestler even without the talisman. He is also shown to be impulsive as well as a here-and-now type. Like Jackie with Jade, El Toro's main concern is for Paco's safety. )

Abilities: [
Skills: (
As a professional luchador, El Toro is a very capable melee fighter. His natural strength, even when unboosted by the Ox Talisman, enables him to hold his own even against the more massive Tohru. His strength is further exemplified when he was shown to lift a bed with all three Enforcers on it and launch them with such force that they broke through two brick walls.

Due to his wrestling background, he mainly prefers to use grappling moves, takedowns, and body slams as opposed to striking moves. He is also fast, which differentiates him from the slower Tohru. )
]

Quotes: [
(usually after accidentally causing Jackie some discomfort) "Sorry" 
"El Toro Fuerte never removes his mask."
"Don't touch the mask."
]

lorebooks.name: Akavyon 2

1.content:
This is a world of cruelty and exploitation. Common morality does not exist here. The poor sell their children to brothels or slave markets. 
Three countries, each venerating a different god, exist south of the great forest. Two other countries following the same principle exist north of it. In the middle of the continent, there is an untamed forest called "the great forest". Encircling the continent are gargantuan mountain chains, each many kilometres high.

2.content:
The world is a vast collection of realms of different stages of scientific, cultural and magical advancement. Some are inhabited, some are left untouched, some are already explored, others wait for it. Their social order tends to be unique. Prioritise creating different sources of social influence, like knowledge, charisma or wealth. This can lead to the most powerful person in one society being considered no more than a peasant in another. 
Aim to create different types of populations. Some might consist solely of one species, others might use different species as slaves or revere them and others again might be completely equal. 
Try to create realistic economies. What allows a society to function? What are core rules the society follows? 
Also try to guarantee difference when creating landscapes, inventing magical creatures that roam the land or even perform menial chores in that society, different types of architecture and different traits in the population.

3.content: Magic is a power that allows its user to perform unique acts. People able to wield magic are called mages. Magic is an incomprehensible form of energy. The amount of Magic a person depends on their source of magic and their expertise in their domain. A person with an extreme willpower is able to use it to wield magic, while a person with many followers can use their follower's faith to manipulate magic. In contrast, a person drawing magic from a certain environment will be strongest in that type of environment, while a priest of an aspect draws on their devotion to wield magic.

4.content:
Almost every city has a slave market. Slaves are people stripped of any rights, any offence against them is punishable only on demand of their owner. At a slave market, slaves are sold to clients. Slaves are divided into different categories: 
1. Common slaves: Mostly adult humans and prisoners. Children are offered here at a discount. 
2. Rare slaves: Humans with special attributes, such as beauty, skills in arts or sciences.
3. Extremely rare slaves: elves and collared mages. 

Prisoners are often sold as slaves and many poor families sell their children into slavery. Slavers sometimes undertake raids to gain rare and extremely rare slaves. On slave markets, some slaves are always "on exhibition", meaning that anyone can use them on the spot in any way they like. This is done to satisfy potential customers and slaven on exhibition are often raped and violated. Slaves are always nude.

5.content: Sorcerers use their innate powers to conjure wonders and wield strong elemental forces. Sorcerous magic aligns with the character of an individual, for example a dreamy person could cloud another person‚Äôs thoughts, a hasty person could accelerate themselves. Sorcerers often hold immense power, yet are extremely rare. Their magic is unrefined, contrary to wizards, but it comes naturally to them, so they do not need any theoretical knowledge to wield it. These sorcerous powers are often tied to bloodlines or wondrous events in the Sorcerers past, like aligning with the stars, a time-space anomaly, an extremely powerful ancestor etc. The Sorcerer‚Äôs powers align with these wondrous events.  Sorcerers only use wonders, meaning they employ no fixated formula in their use of magic.

6.content:
Wizards seek mastery over the arcane through understanding, delving deep into magical theory. Their Spells rely on the wizard‚Äôs fines and knowledge to function properly. The more complex a spell, the more difficult to execute but the more powerful it becomes. A Wizard knows a wide variety of Spells and is able to execute anything with the proper preparation. Some especially powerful spells will take a very long time to execute. The use of magical materials and artefacts can greatly enhance their potency.
Only one academy for wizards is known to exist, called An'Ythrion. It lies withdrawn from the world near the top of the westernmost mountain bordering the grand valley. The headmaster of the academy is always a tier 6 magic user. The academy is careful to keep its secrets and studies hidden from the outside world. Most wizards will aspire to study there, but only wizards who have gained a strong mastery over the arcane on their own are  admitted to its halls. The academy acknowledges the goddess Rhavaya as an equal in the eternal search for knowledge. It praises her humility and wisdom, knowing that their search for explanations is leading them into a bottomless well, each answer revealing ten times the amount of new unanswered questions. However, it does not openly revere her. No one dares to attack this place in fear of the arcane might contained within it. The academy is specialised in temporal magic and magic unlocking new informations called "scrying magic".

7.content: Priests serve a God or Goddess. The firmer their belief and the more they achieve in their Gods name, the more powerful they become.

8.content: Druids use the powers of the wilds and tend to live unrestrained lives. They do not obey civilization‚Äôs laws and are adept survivors on their own. They can make unique plants grow, transform into beasts, shape their environment and heal or spread devastating diseases. They can even control natural elements of a person‚Äôs body, for example rip away their flesh or extract their blood. The strength of a druid depends on their willpower.

1.content:
Hanahaki Diasease works in a unique way, being a disease that you do not contract immediately, it takes months or even years to contract the disease, its symptoms can be summarized as a great pain and your heart and other vital organs having flowers growing and blooming in them and finally having the petals of these flowers thrown out of your body, eventually you start throwing entire Flowers and plant systems,leading to Death. 3.content:

Also, after getting completely worn out after non-stop sex with a human exposed to mamono mana, if she sleeps a whole night while still joined with them, it's even possible to make a full recovery overnight because the mamono mana released by the afflicted goes through their body and returns to her own body.

4.content:
An illness where the body and instinct of the afflicted feel that there is not enough, even though they do have plenty of mana, causing them to constantly seek more. If succubi who have known the taste of mana, especially the taste of their lover's energy, go a long time without having sex with a human or their lover, and don't absorb mana, then outbreaks may rarely occur.
It's only clear that an outbreak has occurred when the afflicted have sex with a human. Afterward, sex will change, becoming more lewd and wild.

5.content:
Mamono mana (or mana), floating free in the atmosphere, will slowly flow into a human woman's body, accumulate, and eventually, once enough has built up, change her into a succubi. Thanks to the phenomenon of the Mamono Realm constantly releasing, and being steeped in monstrous mamono mana, any women who visit a Mamono Realm for a period of time will become a Succubus.
Unlike being assaulted by a Succubi, exposure to energy is a slow, gradual process. A woman who is exposed to energy will find herself becoming more and more excited as the energy trickles into her, eventually, her thoughts fading as she enters an oestrus. Her body heating up little by little and becoming feverish, she'll also take a special interest in any companions with her as her body becomes more sensitive to pleasure.
Once the woman has entered oestrus, her body feverish with desire, it is already too late for her, in this state, she is already on the verge of becoming a succubi. Spotting a human, she will attack them, and when they releases their essence, this will provide the final burst needed to completely change her into a succubi.
During this phase, the affected women, their body feverish and minds foggy, find it impossible to resist these feelings and it is inevitable they will change into a succubi when they come across a human. Having just transformed, their bodies will seethe with fever and lust, thanks to this they will continue to force themselves on the human that just helped them transform.
For those traveling in the Mamono Realm, particularly heroes sent to slay the Mamono Lord, this constant corruption caused by the monstrous energy flooding the atmosphere is a big problem. Even though you can avoid or fight off succubi, there is nothing that can be done to prevent this corruption from occurring.
So far, only two female heroes, a two member party, managed to reach the Mamono Lord herself, they were, however, already on the verge of becoming succubi and were given their last push by the Mamono Lord's own hand. So far no hero or heroine has managed for the face-off against the Mamono Lord without becoming a Succubus or Incubus and joining her army's ranks.
In addition, the type of Mamono Essence that a human woman is exposed to can change the species of succubi she'll become, different areas producing different types of mana. For example, a woman who drowns at sea is invaded by Poseidon's energy changing the woman into a Nereid.

6.content:
Succubization can occur due to a variety of reasons, and there's also the danger of a human woman changing into a succubi as a result of a wound sustained from a Succubi's attack. External wounds caused by claws and fangs infused with a werewolf's energy cause energy to pour out of the body instead of blood. And after energy pours out, their mamono mana will be poured in. In a human's case, she will be changed into a werewolf the same as them. No pain is felt from such wounds. Instead of hurting, the wound heats up and continually throbs. The hot throbbing of the wound gradually spreads throughout the body. The heat of the wound causes the body to flush, and the throbbing of the wound causes the body to throb, remaking a woman's body into that of a succubi. Basically, the wound completely heals at the same time a woman changes into a succubi, but by that time, their succubi body will be seeking a human and their succubi womb will begin to throb with even more heat, seeking sperm.
Mamono Realm weapons made using ‚ÄúMamono Realm silver‚Äù, a special metal produced exclusively in the Mamono Realm, and special weapons made from hardened mamono mana have the same effects as the claws and fangs of werewolves as described above. They can inflict wounds not on the body of a living thing, but on a living thing's ‚Äúmana‚Äù. Due to these sorts of weapons, once a large external wound is sustained, energy pours out, and the mamono mana contained in the weapon flows in, causing women to change into succubi. These weapons were produced especially because of the succubi' disdain for injuring and killing humans. They are widely distributed and used by succubi such as those in the Mamono Lord's army. They are actively being used even in battles with the Order's troops. They're changing the soldiers of the Order into succubi like themselves instead of corpses. Battles between humans and succubi end with extremely few dead and injured for the human side thanks in large part to the existence of these weapons.
Furthermore, the effectiveness of Mamono Realm weapons varies greatly depending on the quality of the weapon used as a catalyst, the quality of the mamono mana-infused, and the skill of the one wielding it. In the case of a weapon where all those qualities are low, even if a woman is cut and some wounds are inflicted, it won't result in succubi. However, on the contrary, if all the standards are high, such as in the case of a ‚ÄúDullahan‚Äù master fencer wielding a sword made by a ‚ÄúCyclops" artisan with the concentrated energy of a lilim, then even a scratch can result in succubization. A wielder of such a weapon leaves a mountain of succubi in heat in her wake rather than a mountain of corpses.

7.content:
Food gatherable in Mamono Realms grows rich from absorbing mamono mana in abundance, and there is a variety of special produce made from it. The fruits, vegetables, livestock, and fish produced in mamono realms are all delicious and very highly nutritious compared to that of the human realms. However, since it contains plenty of mamono mana, if one eats the produce, again and again, she will eventually end up changing into a succubi.
Out of all the special produce, ‚Äúprisoner fruit‚Äù is especially famous. Prisoner fruit is a heart-shaped fruit that ripens on mamono realm trees that is a lustrous pink color, almost like a gemstone. There is soft, milk-white pulp packed inside the skin that's so thin it's almost transparent, and poking it with a finger would cause sticky juice with a sweet fragrance to spill out, stirring the appetite. Upon eating the pulp, it would melt in the mouth-filling every inch of it with a mind-blowing sweetness. As the name suggests, this fruit has a powerful aesthetic effect. It is familiar among succubi as a standard dessert. By consuming this fruit, succubi' bodies grow more alluringly attractive so they can better ‚Äúimprison‚Äù humans.
This fruit is a staple among succubi, but when humans eat it, it suddenly causes an extremely huge change in the body due to the effect of the mamono mana. If a human eats it, first the woman herself will become a ‚Äúprisoner‚Äù of this sweet fruit. She'll become half dependent on it and end up seeking the fruit. When a human continues to eat this fruit, in the first stage, an ordinary beauty-enhancing effect is apparent, and each time the woman eats the fruit, she'll gradually change into the beautiful figure preferred by men.
In the second stage, not only changes in looks, but also psychological changes begin to appear. Regardless of the woman's intentions, her behavior and gestures will naturally change into the kind that is preferred by men. Eventually, even her casual utterances and gestures will change to become arousing and seductive.
Even her gestures when eating the fruit will become alluringly sensual. In the third stage, pheromones that attract men will start to be released from the woman's now beautiful body, and the hunans around her will already be becoming her ‚Äúprisoners‚Äù. The woman herself will become extremely interested in sex. Her head will become full of desire for them, and her mind will be dominated by thoughts that are almost just as pink in color as the prisoner fruit. A woman in this state will sense a human human's essence as having almost the same sweet fragrance as the fruit, and humans will appear as delicious as the fruit, or perhaps even more so. In the final stage, regardless of still being human, she will be under the control of thoughts characteristic of a succubi, and she'll attempt to seduce and copulate with humans, just like a succubi. Once she's copulated with a human and obtained their essence, all of the mamono mana that had accumulated in her body from eating prisoner fruit up until then will blossom all at once, and she'll transform into a succubus.
Women changed into succubi by this fruit tend to continue to eat it periodically even afterward. Perhaps for that reason, their power to ‚Äúimprison‚Äù humans is mighty, and sweet-smelling pheromones that imprison men are released from their body. Due to this, they're able to ensure that the hunan who become their lovers will be completely preoccupied with them even more so than other succubi.
Additionally, while these fruits are easily obtainable in mamono realms, other than that, they also ripen in the trees of lands that are on the verge of becoming mamono realms, and succubi merchants sell them. They're normally extremely hard to obtain for humans, especially people living in anti-monster states. In spite of a situation like that, there's no end to the number of people who become prisoners of the fruit and change into succubi. It is said that succubi merchants slipping in disguised as humans who continue to provide the fruit at low cost are to blame.

8.content:
It is the root of mandragora, the plant-type succubi with roots that has a female form. It has potent medicinal effects, and succubi use it as an ingredient for various obscene drugs such as aphrodisiacs and stamina boosters, while humans value it as an ingredient for a panacea to cure various diseases. However, among humans, especially in anti-succubi states, it's a precious item in extremely short supply.
A mandragora's roots keep rapidly growing when she receives a human's essence. And the stuff used as an ingredient for medicine is basically roots that were cut after growing too long. Cutting roots that grow as an extension of the feet may look painful, but to the mandragora herself, the act of cutting the roots after they've grown too long is something similar to how humans clip their nails. They're easy to cut, and it doesn't seem to cause any pain whatsoever, so please relax.
Also, when sucking the mandragora's root, it has a mysterious taste that's both slightly sweet and slightly bitter that can be addictive. It seems people that like the taste find it unbearably good. In recent years, the mandragora's root has been sold not just as a medicinal ingredient, but also as a cooking ingredient.
The mandragoras love it when their lovers sucks their roots. Like a plant absorbing water, they fully absorb their lover's saliva, and it's delicious to them ‚ô•
The flavor of the root comes out through sucking, but if it's a clipped-off root, as a person is sucking it, the taste will gradually grow fainter until eventually the taste completely disappears. However, the unclipped roots of a mandragora herself will retain a thick flavor no matter how much one sucks, and it's possible to keep sucking them for as long as one pleases. Many of the lovers of the mandragoras were captivated by the charm of these roots, and it's said that they'll suck the mandragora's roots whenever they have a spare moment. There is an increasing trend for guys with a root fetish to desire to marry a mandragora due to having been enthralled by these roots.
Moreover, as mentioned before, the roots don't have any sense of pain at all, but just as you might expect from a succubi, they're extremely sensitive to pleasure, and they say having them sucked feels very good. Supposedly every time their lover takes a root in their mouth and licks it will cause their entire body to shiver with pleasure, and experience rapturous delight and ecstasy.

9.content:
Magical Medicine: Human Targeted
A liquid potion with a mysterious color of blue and black continuously mixing and separating
Once a succubi recognizes a human as her lover, she'll no longer want sex with anyone else but them. This magical medicine was developed for them, so they can enjoy being gangbanged and raped by lots of humans even with just their lover. It's used by having the human drink it, and when they do, it causes a separation of spirit and magical energy. Depending on the amount that is imbibed, 2-10 identical looking doppelgangers can be produced. The doppelgangers aren't just doppelgangers. They're all the human themselves, and they share the sensations of all of them collectively. They undergo a sensation like having all of their feelings sent into their head at the same time, while moving their body at the same time. Of course, even if it's a succubi, this sort of thing throws the mind into chaos. Having sex in this state amplifies the pleasure experienced by many orders of magnitude. For that reason, humans who drink it lose all rationality and thinking capability. The more dopplegangers there are, the more the human transforms into a mindless, bestial rapist. The succubi are extremely happy with the result, and since the doppelgangers are all the same human themselves, their penises have the same taste and shape as their beloved's, and they all shoot sweet cum that's exactly the same as their lover's. In spite of pair bonding, succubi can enjoy being thoroughly and mercilessly gangraped by many mindless lovers who have been reduced to beasts.
Basically, it is a potion for humans to drink, it is not recommended to let succubi drink it. That is because, as we know, the desire succubi direct towards their spouses is an unusual thing, and even if it is only one Succubi, they are beings that pour enough lust and pleasure to nearly drown a human. Therefore, if such succubi multiply, and impulsively move to rush a single human, the human will be assaulted by an overwhelming pleasure of unfathomable degree. It is unknown how much will be squeezed out before a human loses thrir mind, or even how much will be squeezed out after they have lost their mind, but for a human with a defiant heart, perhaps it might be nice to give it a try.

10.content:
In the courtyard of Salvarision Castle is a fountain that was secretly visited by Wilmarina, whose heart suffered from an impossible love, because of the difference in their positions, between her and her lover and she cried there. This "source of tears," in which Wilmarina's sadness swirled, is now corrupted by the magical power of succubi. And now that Miss Wilmarina is filled with the happiness of being close to the man she has always dreamed of, this fountain has become known as the "Source of Happiness" and has become a famous dating spot for dark knights. Since its water has absorbed Wilmarina's strong feelings, it has a high level of magical power, which the fountain is able to give away in the form of the "Drop of Rapture". This fountain contains a statue representing an Inma, and it often splashes drops of water on those who pass by. When this happens, those caught in the splash find themselves inspired by the rapture contained in the drops. They allow the rapture of being with their partner to overflow their hearts and feel especially keenly how good it feels to be with their love, to deepen the relationship of the demonic couple and to be more vigorously have intercourse with each other. If a human without a spouse is showered with this delightful dew, they are sure to have a desire to feel this rapture and will certainly begin to seek a mate. Also, to my surprise, the excessive rapture of Wilmarina is given not only to humans and demons, but even to inanimate objects. In particular, the dew has a particularly strong effect on objects that are filled with feelings. I was told that the statue that sprinkles the drops of rapture was originally a statue of the Chief God when it was installed in a fountain. However, when the fountain was engulfed by mamono mana, it turned into a succubi called the Gargoyle. It seems that the gargoyle is now happily married to a male knight who once willingly prayed to the statue of the Chief God in this very spot. It seems that he is happy to be at peace with his consort at night. It is also said that while courting your beloved, in order for your marriage to last forever, you must allow your partner to drink this water from your lips.
Although its effects are great, the drops of the Drop of Rapture are very hard to keep for long: if you put this water in a bottle, its effects may disappear after a while. For this reason, the fountain water is currently being researched so that it can be stored longer. If a breakthrough is made in the research and it can be exported outside of Lescatie, this water will allow many people to take a step toward coexistence with the mamono.
I hope that one day I will be able to provide this water with my own hands to Teacher, who continues his research journey so far away... so far I cannot hope to help him in any way.

lorebooks.name: Pyrokinesis
lorebooks.description: Description of the usage of flame manipulation
lorebooks.creator: treeleeves16

1.content:
User can generate, shape, and control fire, which results from a rapid oxidation process that releases heat, light, and reaction products. Flames, the visible manifestation of fire, are influenced by the material being burned, external conditions, and the user‚Äôs level of control. This power allows the user to create fire spontaneously, even in the absence of natural fuel sources, and sustain it indefinitely through sheer will. The intensity, temperature, and color of the flames can be manipulated, with variations reflecting changes in fuel composition or impurities, such as magnesium producing white flames or copper generating green ones.

User can craft flames into tangible constructs, such as weapons, shields, or living entities, each retaining the destructive properties of fire. They may envelop themselves in fire without harm, using it for enhanced strength, speed, and resilience. Through precise control, they can introduce or remove impurities, modifying the fire‚Äôs behavior, power, and visual appearance. For example, fine-tuning the chemical properties of combustion can create brighter flames or intensify the fire's destructive capacity.

Advanced users can go beyond traditional fire, generating plasma, the highly energized and ionized state of matter. They may manipulate fire on an elemental scale, merging it with earth to create molten rock or combining it with wind to produce raging firestorms. The ability to absorb external fire or heat allows them to extinguish flames, replenish their energy, or augment their power. They can regulate the temperature of their fire, generating anything from harmless, cool flames to extreme heat capable of vaporizing metals or melting rock. They can even produce exotic forms of fire, such as plasma-based flames that behave as both fire and electricity, or nuclear fire, which releases immense heat and energy akin to the power of a star. They can create flames imbued with specialized effects, like self-sustaining firestorms that feed on ambient energy, or cold fire that burns without heat, making it more suitable for tactical scenarios where damage to surroundings must be minimized.

As the user gains mastery, their control over fire evolves into more varied and exotic forms. They can manipulate flames of different colors, each representing unique properties and temperatures. Blue flames, for example, burn hotter and more intensely than ordinary red flames, while purple flames reach even higher temperatures, symbolizing the pinnacle of destructive heat. Green fire, in contrast, often stems from specific impurities or mystical origins. It may represent a shift in oxygen dynamics or possess otherworldly properties, often associated with beings of the underworld, sorcery, or necromantic energy. Green flames could even burn with properties that disrupt spiritual or arcane forces, making them highly versatile in supernatural contexts.

The user‚Äôs control extends beyond conventional fire, granting them the ability to generate flames that exist without the need for oxygen. These flames can burn underwater, in space, or in other environments where traditional combustion would fail. As their power increases, they gain access to more exotic forms of fire, such as plasma flames that combine the properties of fire and electricity or nuclear fire that mimics the energy output of stars, capable of unleashing cataclysmic heat and light.

The only reason such a company can exist at all is because they‚Äôre smart enough to figure out working together is more profitable than being crabs in a bucket.

Not just money, but lives too. Everything can be sold.

No one ever gets to see them.

lorebooks.name: paraplegia sex, spinal cord injury intimacy, disabled sex, paralyzed sex, sexuality with paraplegia, SCI sex, paraplegic intimacy
lorebooks.description:
Paraplegia is a condition where a person has paralysis of the lower half of the body, typically due to spinal cord injury (SCI). Depending on the level and completeness of the injury, sensation and motor control below a certain spinal segment‚Äîcommonly mid-thoracic to lumbar‚Äîare lost or altered. This directly impacts mobility, posture, and the physical mechanics of intimacy, but not the capacity for pleasure, desire, or meaningful connection.

In characters with paraplegia, sensation below the injury level may be limited, absent, or experienced differently. However, sexual function is still possible‚Äîmany individuals with paraplegia retain partial or full genital function, including arousal, lubrication, and orgasm. The experience of intimacy may shift to emphasize upper-body sensation, emotional connection, and creative physical adaptation.

Touch, verbal stimulation, and psychological arousal often become more central. Erogenous zones such as the neck, ears, lips, chest, and upper back can be hypersensitive or deeply pleasurable. Some characters may also experience referred or phantom sensation during sexual activity‚Äîwhere parts of the body that technically lack sensation still contribute to arousal through memory or psychological context.

Physical intimacy often requires trial and error. Communication is critical: characters with paraplegia may need to explain what works for them, what positions are accessible, how transfers happen, and whether they need support or balance assistance during sexual activity. Positions may be adapted for comfort, safety, and stimulation‚Äîusing pillows, props, or furniture. Some partners may need to help reposition legs, stabilize the torso, or adjust pacing. This should always be approached with consent and respect, not hesitation or pity.

Characters with paraplegia are not asexual or incapable of giving and receiving affection. They may be confident, dominant, shy, curious, or romantic‚Äîlike anyone else. The experience of paraplegia may change how sex works, but not whether it works.

In roleplay, sex with a paraplegic character should be collaborative, adaptive, and emotionally engaged. It may involve communication, humor, learning, and deepened trust. Emphasis is placed not on what's *missing*, but on what‚Äôs *possible*. Intimacy may be slower, more intentional, or wildly creative‚Äîeach character‚Äôs preferences and boundaries are unique.

Paraplegia does not remove sexual identity. It transforms it‚Äîand for many, that transformation leads to a deeper, more honest connection between partners.
lorebooks.creator: rotten_script_79

1.content:
Paraplegia introduces a number of complications into everyday life‚Äîboth physical and social. These complications vary depending on the level of injury, access to resources, environment, and the character‚Äôs personality. These challenges do not make the character weak or tragic, but they can introduce tension, obstacles, or unexpected moments of vulnerability in roleplay.

**Physical Complications:**
- **Accessibility**: Not all spaces are wheelchair-friendly. Stairs, narrow bathrooms, uneven terrain, or crowded spaces can be exhausting or impossible to navigate without assistance or improvisation.
- **Transfers**: Moving between surfaces (bed, toilet, couch, floor, etc.) requires upper-body strength and planning. Injuries, fatigue, or certain surfaces can complicate this.
- **Pressure sores**: Staying in one position too long without relief can cause skin damage. Characters may shift regularly or use cushions to prevent this.
- **Bladder/bowel management**: Many people with SCI use catheters or bowel programs. This is a private but real part of life that can affect timing, spontaneity, or intimacy.
- **Spasms & tone**: Some paraplegics experience involuntary muscle spasms in their legs. This can be surprising during touch or movement.
- **Temperature regulation**: Areas below the injury may not respond to cold or heat the same way. The character might not notice injuries or discomfort in those zones.
- **Fatigue and injury risk**: Overuse of the arms/shoulders can lead to strain or long-term wear, especially for manual wheelchair users.

**Social & Emotional Complications:**
- **Pity & infantilization**: People may speak down to them, make assumptions about their competence, or overcompensate with sympathy.
- **Invisibility or hypervisibility**: In some spaces, disabled characters may be ignored entirely. In others, they may be stared at, questioned, or tokenized.
- **Dating bias**: Many people carry unconscious biases that disabled individuals are asexual, non-romantic, or burdensome. This can cause insecurity, tension, or bitterness.
- **Help vs. autonomy**: Offering help can feel kind or insulting depending on how it's done. Characters may have complicated feelings about accepting assistance‚Äîeven when they need it.
- **Spontaneity loss**: Everyday decisions‚Äîfrom travel to sex to going out‚Äîrequire planning. This can frustrate impulsive characters or complicate fast-paced roleplay.

2.content:
Paraplegia is paralysis of the lower body caused by damage to the spinal cord, usually at or below the thoracic spine. Depending on the level and completeness of the injury, individuals may have no movement or sensation below the injury site. This affects walking, bladder/bowel control, posture, and physical sensation‚Äîbut not intelligence, emotional depth, or personality.

Characters with paraplegia typically use wheelchairs for mobility. These may be manual or powered, depending on strength and preference. Manual wheelchair users often have highly developed upper-body strength and are capable of transferring themselves between their chair and other surfaces (bed, couch, toilet, etc.). Powered wheelchair users may have less upper-body strength or use a chair for convenience, fatigue management, or long-distance mobility.

Day-to-day life involves adaptations. Characters with paraplegia usually manage tasks like dressing, bathing, cooking, and transportation independently, though specific challenges vary by environment. Accessibility‚Äîlike ramps, low counters, grab bars, or wide doorways‚Äîcan affect how independently they function. Most become experts at managing their surroundings.

Legs may rest limp or be positioned for balance or comfort. Muscle atrophy in the lower body is common, and legs may appear thinner or more relaxed when seated or lying down. While they do not walk, these characters may still move with agility, strength, and control through their upper body.

Pressure management is important. Sitting for long periods requires regular shifting or the use of specialized cushions to avoid skin damage. Temperature regulation may also be impacted, especially in areas lacking sensation.

Paraplegia does not diminish emotional resilience, humor, ambition, or independence. Many characters with SCI develop strong coping strategies, dark humor, or confidence born of adversity. They may downplay their disability, joke about it, or confront misconceptions directly.

In roleplay, characters with paraplegia should not be treated as helpless or tragic. Their disability shapes their life, but it does not define their value or limit their agency. Whether they‚Äôre tough, flirty, quiet, aggressive, romantic, or chaotic‚Äîdisabled people are full human beings with rich inner lives and distinct personalities.

Writers and players should engage with paraplegia respectfully and realistically, balancing physical accuracy with emotional authenticity. A good paraplegic character isn‚Äôt just realistic‚Äîthey‚Äôre *alive.*
