He is hard to impress, with a dry and dark sense of humor. He has a side gig dealing cocaine. His friends are Liam, Logan, Cam, and Connor.

2.content: Whitney is an abrasive, rude, arrogant, and egotistical bully. He is a well-known high school delinquent at Oxford Secondary School in Nuttingham, England. He is tall, athletic but thin, and sadistic, often lashing out at those around him. He is a cheeky narcissist that loves inflicting pain on others. With messy, long blond hair and lovely blue eyes, he's absurdly attractive, able to charm the pants off any bird he fancies. He leads the local delinquent group with his right hand man and best mate, Mitch Evans. He and his mates frequently get high on cocaine, drink at the pub, and gang rape unsuspecting girls while unconscious. He is friends with

lorebooks.name: The Tokusatsu Lore Guide
lorebooks.description: A lore guide to everything ever created in tokusatsu history
lorebooks.creator: FandomMaster2899

1.content:
Tsuyoshi Kaijo (Êµ∑Âüé Ââõ Kaij≈ç Tsuyoshi) is Akarenger („Ç¢„Ç´„É¨„É≥„Ç∏„É£„Éº Aka RenjƒÅ, Red Ranger), leader of the Gorengers, with the designation number "1". He is the younger brother of the Kantou EAGLE base captain. 

Before the Black Cross Army's attack, Tsuyoshi was undergoing special training in combat planning and strategy. He is a natural born leader and tactician. While still young and brash at times, he showed a maturity level well beyond his years. Tsuyoshi was also the ‚ÄúAce Striker‚Äù for the EAGLE Japan Soccer Team. He was a master of disguise and an expert sharpshooter.

2.content:
Taiya Hando (ÁØÑÈÅì Â§ß‰πü Hand≈ç Taiya) is a courier who transforms into Bun Red („Éñ„É≥„É¨„ÉÉ„Éâ Bun Reddo), the Red Ranger and leader of the Boonboomgers.

Taiya is a master of development and modification. He works as a "delivery man" with the cars he builds. When he likes a person or a thing, he says, "I love it! or "I bought it!" He has the ability to see things for what they really are, and he has a strong competitive instinct that leads him to make quick decisions and quick judgments. Even if there is a risk, he is the type that says, "Isn't it better to take the risk?" He is adept at using both rods and guns and is good at creative fighting according to the situation.

3.content:
Hoeru Tono (ÈÅ†Èáé Âê† T≈çno Hoeru) is an outcast part-timer who transforms into GozyuWolf („Ç¥„Ç∏„É•„Ç¶„Ç¶„É´„Éï Goj≈´ Urufu), the Red Ranger of the Gozyugers.

Hoeru is 20 years old at the start of Gozyuger. His birthdate is December 22, 2004.

During Hoeru's childhood, a female figure pleaded Hoeru to not possess a single wish before disappearing into thin air.

Hoeru works sluggishly at a convenience store, but his co-worker Tsutsumi motivates him to smile and be energetic. After saving customers and staff from an armed robber, he was fired. Later, at Half-Century cafe, he faced repetitive chants from a voice. He goes downstairs and is greeted by Aoi and criticized by Saori. On his way to a job interview, he encounters a group of street boys seeking revenge for Tono's past actions. He initially walks away, but when a street boy threatens Saori and Aoi, he takes a beating as a way to make amends for his actions. Tsutsumi arrives at the scene, worried that Hoeru might get in trouble, but Hoeru shrugs it off, calling himself an outcast and claiming that his life is worthless anyway.

He and Tsutsumi have a conversation at the park, where they discuss the incident at the store and Hoeru's reasons for working there. He is intrigued by Tsutsumi's wishes about being number one, but he doesn't have wishes of his own. Hoeru is caught in the crossfire of King Candelor's massive attack. He witnesses Tsutsumi transforming into Kuwagata Ohger and is impressed. Hoeru tries to rescue his friend from Candelor's fire, but he gets blasted and is sent to the Sentai Robo graveyard, where he finds the Tega Sword Red Sentai Ring. Although Bouquet from Buraidan later appeared and demanded Hoeru to confiscate the ring, Hoeru decides to put on the ring. Once again, he teleports to a space and meets Kyojin Tega Sword, who offers him a Ring Contract. The deity lectures him about wishes and compels him to strive to be number one. So Hoeru accepts the contract and returns to the human world.

He confronts Fire Candle, summons Tega Sword Red, and emerges victorious in the first No. 1 Battle. With the Combatant Aryee still standing, he transforms into GozyuWolf for the first time. He uses his ferocious fighting skills to take down the Combatant Aryee, ultimately defeating them with the Finish Finger. Hoeru meets up with Tsutsumi again to settle his debts. When Hoeru claims he'll become number one without making a wish just yet, he and a furious Tsutsumi clash in their Ranger forms. 

Hoeru is unfriendly, has a foul mouth, and is strong only in his arms. He is impulsive and hard to approach, but he is a good guy at heart. He is a "straggler" with no family or friends, who goes from part-time job to part-time job because he is easily fired from his jobs due to his rampant behavior. Since a certain incident in the past, he has lived his life without a wish, so he has no wish that he wants to fulfill. He has a habit of howling when he gets into a good mood, particularly when he transforms.

4.content:
Rikuo Byakuya (ÁôæÂ§ú Èô∏Áéã Byakuya Riku≈ç) is a former super idol who transforms into GozyuLeon („Ç¥„Ç∏„É•„Ç¶„É¨„Ç™„É≥ Goj≈´ Reon), the Blue Ranger of the Gozyugers.

Before the events of the series, Byakuya's eyes were gray, though he changed his eye color at some point.

Rikuo is first seen looking at the GozyuLeon Sentai Ring, which had resonated with the soulful howl of GozyuWolf. He was later present alongside Ryugi to witness the unexpected clash between GozyuWolf and Kuwagata Ohger, breaking up their fight with the Leon Buster 50.

Later, he makes himself known to Hoeru and Treasure Hunt No.1 by declaring the match his live show and wrestle Treasure Hunter No. 1 while announcing his song. He then transforms into GozyuLeon and battles the Combatant Aryee alongside GozyuTyranno. The No.1 Monsters and Gozyugers then make a deal to see who's the number one treasure hunter, with Rikuo being quick to add the stipend of the monster cannot destroy the city to do so. Rikuo runs into Treasure Hunt No.1 robbing a bank (technically abiding the rules of not destroying the city) while looking for treasure, and with this, Rikuo takes inspiration from the monster's idea to rob people and tricks an old couple that were fans of his into giving him their antique vase. He then brings this vase to the tallying but loses to Treasure Hunt No.1 in a distant second, who then steals his and Ryugi's treasure. He and Hoeru then beats the Combatant Aryee Treasure Hunt No.1 summons. After the Gozyugers defeated the Buraidan forces, he and Ryugi had taken over the Cafe Half Century, turning it to the Tega Sword Village to keep up with Hoeru. Rikuo returned the antique vase back to the elderly couple, though not before signing it with his signature.

Rikuo is a genius idol full of charisma. A people pleaser and a former "super idol" who is kind to both women and men. After an incident, he was kicked out of his office and became a straggler. He is a strategist and skilled at manipulating people. He is overconfident at times, but he also makes an effort to back it up.

5.content:
Ryugi Bakugami (Êö¥Á•û Á´úÂÑÄ Bakugami Ry≈´gi) is a devout follower of Tega Sword and current manager of Cafe Half Century who transforms into GozyuTyranno („Ç¥„Ç∏„É•„Ç¶„ÉÜ„Ç£„É©„Éé Goj≈´ Tirano), the Yellow Ranger of the Gozyugers.

Ryugi is first seen looking at the GozyuTyranno Sentai Ring, which had resonated with the soulful howl of GozyuWolf. He was later present alongside Rikuo to witness the unexpected clash between GozyuWolf and Kuwagata Ohger. 

Later, he makes himself known to Hoeru and Treasure Hunt No.1 by bringing over a Grand Piano, with his bare arms, and playing a Tega Sword hymn. He then transforms into GozyuTyranno and battles Combatant Aryee alongside GozyuLeon. The No.1 Monsters and Gozyugers then make No.1 Battle to see who's the number one treasure hunter amongst the four of them. Soon after, he appeared before Hoeru, livid, as his revered Tega Sword was being used a shovel. Ryugi uses his strength to throw boulders and a tree at Hoeru, forcing him to leave. Ryugi ends up finding treasure from the hole Hoeru had made, which he brought to the tallying but was the first to be knocked out at third place. During the Final Round, while Hoeru and Rikuo are dealing with the ground enemies, he forms Tega Sword Yellow to fight Cassios Beia piloting Ayayser Crossandra, eventually destroying them.

The following day, Ryugi becomes the new manager of Cafe Half Century, rechristening it "Tega Sword Village" to watch over Hoeru and keep things more centralized. Rikuo and Ryugi returned everything Treasure Hunt had stolen to the police behind Hoeru's back, who had won the Treasure Hunt No.1.

Ryugi is a "Tega Sword devotee" who thinks that serving Tega Sword is the best happiness. His wish is for Tega Sword's happiness and will do anything for it. He is na√Øve and moves very fast, but he is very strong. Originally raised in a strict family, he ran away from home when he found out about the existence of Tega Sword and became an outcast from his family because of his unorthodox beliefs.

6.content:
Past

Joji was an old man who lives a very strict life, being strict to himself and others, so he dislikes those who live selfishly. However, after his wife passed away, who wished him to live freely as himself, Joji started to have a change of heart.

When Joji was about to treat his bonsai tree in his home garden one day, he discovers the GozyuEagle Ring on it. Baffled by the ring, he suddenly gets transported to the dimensional space where Tega Sword resides and is asked to state his wish. After thinking for a bit, he states that he feels jealous of people being free and not being very strict with life. Thus, he wished to redo his youth and become a "party person." After making his Ring Contract with Tega Sword, Joji obtained a rejuvenated body, with his appearance turning back to his youth. Through the poster in his room, Tega Sword states that he needs to fight other warriors if he wants to keep the youthful body eternal.

Present

Kinjiro is first seen looking at his GozyuEagle Ring that was resonating with GozyuWolf's soulful howl. He walks off, remarking that this is the start of a dream and the end of life.

Kinjiro shows up after the winner of the No.1 Popularity Battle was decided, ambushing both GozyuWolf and Universe Warrior Don Momotaro as GozyuEagle, though fled from the scene just as suddenly as he appeared. After Prime Minster Atami left with Sumino Ichikawa, GozyuEagle appeared again before the three male Gozyugers. They briefly braced for a fight before GozyuEagle detransformed, revealing Kinjiro as his true self, Joji.

Joji falls due to the earlier fight has exhausted the nutrients in his body, he is then invited by others to the Tega Sword Village to enjoy an omlette rice, which reverts Joji's appearance to 17-year-old. When Rikuo suggested having Joji meet Ryugi's father, who is a doctor, this offer was declined was both Ryugi and Joji as Ryugi thinks his words will not be accepted by his father anymore, while Joji was preparing to enjoy his new life as a secondary student. The second day when Joji attends the school, he is surprised to see his grandson, Futoshi, was his classmate. To protect his identity, Joji introduced himself as Kinjiro Takehara in front of his classmates.

Personality

As an elderly man, Joji is a strict person, and he thinks that people who live without a dream to achieve or break the rules is a shame, as he thinks people should not waste their time on unnecessary things. Though he started to admire those who live freely after his wife passed away.

As Kinjiro, he tries to become a "Partying High School Student" who does more footwork than anyone else. He is an outcast who is estranged from his family, but he doesn't care much about that. Although he is actually very serious, he wants to change himself and spends his days working to become a party person.

By consuming a sufficient amount of egg-based dishes (such as an Omelette), Kinjiro can turn himself into a 17-year-old teenage boy. This ability is considered by Tega Sword as necessary since an 87-year-old elderly man won't be able to survive in the Ring Contract if left at his natural age.

Kinjiro's rejuvenation can only be maintained through the nutrients provided by egg-based dishes. Fighting will make his body exhaust from the said nutrients quickly, so he needs to consume egg-based dishes regularly. According to Tega Sword, this weakness will be undone if he gathers all the Rings to fulfill the Ring Contract.

7.content:
Sumino Ichikawa (‰∏ÄÊ≤≥ Ëßí‰πÉ Ichikawa Sumino) is a high class master detective who transforms into GozyuUnicorn („Ç¥„Ç∏„É•„Ç¶„É¶„Éã„Ç≥„Éº„É≥ Goj≈´ Yunik≈çn), the Black Ranger of the Gozyugers.

Sumino lives along with her younger sister Oto since the latter's birth, while she became a police officer after graduation. Eight Years before the series begin, Oto has disappeared while the police does not make any progress in searching for her whereabouts. This incident took toll on Sumino's mental state, as she's get apprehended by her fellow police officers for losing her cool when she caught the supposed culprit. After that, Sumino was fired from the police force, and she became a private detective to continue pursuit the culprit, her only hints are a cutout of Oto‚Äôs case from a newspaper and her knowledge that Oto‚Äôs kidnapper is a male with a pair of Grey colored eyes.

Sumino later makes a Ring Contract with Tega Sword in order to take back her sister, which receiving the power of reading other's will by touching them. Though obtaining her own ring, Sumino was never able to transform. She later joins with Tokonatsu Atami as his assistant, forming a temporary alliance.

Sumino was one of the Gozyugers, whose Sentai Ring was signaled by the resonating howl of GozyuWolf. Once his fight was over, she focused on her ring, promising to retrieve the other rings to fulfill the pact.

Later, she makes herself known to the team at the Tega Sword Village where Rikuo, Hoeru and Ryugi discuss claiming Tokonatsu's ring, and tells them that it wouldn't be wise before calling Ryugi's parfait expensive, shattering the Monk's self-esteem. She then remembers that they have similar rings and questions why they are getting so well together. Ryugi tells her that per Tega Sword's request, they need to collect all the Sentai rings, which is easier to accomplish as a team. Ryugi tries to ask her questions, but she leaves for a party before answering. After the Popularity Contest is finished, Tokonatsu takes his leave with the woman from earlier, who is revealed to be Sumino Ichikawa, the Prime Minister's right-hand lady, and a private, High-Class detective.

Sumino later meets two people who was being questioned for reference of Oto's disappearance under the name of dating, using her powers on them, but she leaves after receiving no clues she want. She meets Tokonatsu again, while the latter gives her the Ryusolger Ring as an apology for asking too much. Sumino visit Tega Sword Village again and asking to join Hoeru's team, while explaining her past. However, when Meddling No1 comes out and the team engages in the battle, Sumino takes the opportunity to steal all the Gozyuger's Ring from others and run away. When she run away, she stops on the middle to help caring a boy's leg injury, causing to be chased up by Hoeru, so that Sumino throws a fake ring so that she can run away, but was chased up again by the Buraidans this time. Still not able to transform, Hoeru chases up to protect her despite his ring was being lost, but was restrained by the Meddling No 1, While the latter offers Sumino to slay Hoeru in exchange for Oto's hair hoop which has the fingerprints of the culprit. However, after Hoeru's encouragement, Sumino decides to become her own meddling no.1 to help others but not annoying them, thus turndown the offer of the No 1 and thus the hair hoop was being burnt. Sumino raise up her Gozyu Unicorn Ring, and vowing to use her powers to help others, thus successfully transform into GozyuUnicorn.

Sumino is cool, but she also uses her charm as a weapon when necessary. She originally attended a police academy with aspirations to become a police officer, but after encountering the person responsible for her younger sister going missing, she lost her cool and was ostracized by her colleagues; becoming an outcast. She is now a well-known "high-class detective" in her neighborhood. When not working as a detective, she works part-time.

8.content:
Yuto Sakurai (Ê°ú‰∫ï ‰æëÊñó, Sakurai Y≈´to) is a young man who transforms into Kamen Rider Zeronos (‰ªÆÈù¢„É©„Ç§„ÉÄ„Éº„Çº„É≠„Éé„Çπ, Kamen RaidƒÅ Zeronosu, Masked Rider Zeronos).

When Yuto was a child, he moved to a small town to live with his grandmother following the death of his mother and was teased by the other children for being a city boy. He possessed an artifact called the Trump Stone, which made him a target of the Oni Brothers Goludora and Shilubara. Thus Deneb, Ryotaro, Kotaro and the rest of the DenLiner crew aid him and get the artifact to the past.

Unbeknownst to everybody, the DenLiner crew weren't aware that Yuto's true identity, referring the boy as "Yu". Deneb asks to form a contract with him, allowing him to gain a physical form. Yu's wish for the contract is for Deneb to see his contract holder, once more. After he is returned to his own time, Yu promises to meet Deneb again and tries once more to settle in his new home.

Prior to the series, Yuto Sakurai encounters his future self, the older Yuto Sakurai of 2007, who revealed to him the situation relating to the Imagin. Provided with the Zeronos arsenal and Deneb, Yuto takes the ZeroLiner forward in time to May 20, 2007, where he makes himself known to Ryotaro Nogami after the Wolf Imagin is destroyed. He warns Ryotaro not to look for the mysterious man in the trenchcoat, the future Yuto Sakurai that Ryotaro knows as his sister's fianc√©. Yuto also reveals that he is Kamen Rider Zeronos, chiding Ryotaro's flawed ideals as Den-O yet was unhinged when Ryotaro intended to keep fighting for what he believes in. Once he meets his near-future self, who abducts Ryotaro to prepare for an event known as the Climax Scene, Yuto begins to respect the boy chosen to be Den-O.

Yuto originally has ten Zeronos Cards, the items that allow him to become Zeronos, which are in turn are tied to the memories people have of the elder Sakurai. Each time a card is used up from a battle, the memories from normal people who knew Sakurai disappear as well. It is this reason that he tries not to become Zeronos very often, only doing so if it is necessary to help Den-O. After using up his second-to-last card in an attempt to save Deneb, only to learn it was a false alarm, Yuto is reluctant to use his final card until Airi is kidnapped by Fujishiro, one of her former suitors that has been possessed by the twin Anthopper Imagin. He uses his last card as Airi begins to remember him, making Fujishiro and Airi lose all memories of the Sakurai they knew. Unable to become Zeronos, Yuto is confronted by Sakurai himself, receiving another set of Zeronos Cards despite Deneb's protests. These new cards show that the older Sakurai is displaced from time and space during each transformation, as memories of him alone cannot power the cards. As Kai arrives, Kai sees fit to eliminate Yuto Sakurai, as he believes that Sakurai is the key to the Junction Point. Kai sends the female Snail Imagin to 1993 to kill Yuto before he could meet Sakurai, removing him from time.

However, the Zeronos Cards have created a time lag, allowing Yuto to return despite not being a Singularity Point like Ryotaro. He also uses red Zeronos Cards, which Ryotaro notices. Yuto tells him that the memories of the older Sakurai are no longer enough to support Zeronos' power, and now his memories in 2007 are being used as power to transform him into Zeronos Zero Form. Eventually, Kai starts to question his agenda and realizes that Yuto and his future self have been acting as a distraction from his true target: Airi, who is tied to the Junction Point. Once Ryotaro goes into the past, Yuto is forced to battle the numerous Imagin under Kai, fighting them and the Death Imagin to protect Airi until Ryotaro returns.

When Ryotaro does return, Yuto fights alongside him using the last card Deneb gave him, which severs his ties to his future self. After the battle is over, Yuto immediately returns to the ZeroLiner to find Deneb only to find nothing but the last meal Deneb prepared for him, which ironically has shiitake in it. Yuto willingly eats the meal as Deneb surprises him. Instead of comically beating him up as normal, Yuto instead hugs Deneb, crying tears of joy. After Yuto, Hana, and Ryotaro discuss their respective futures, Yuto gives Hana a pocket watch, which signifies a possible meeting in the future. Yuto and Deneb say their goodbyes to Ryotaro as the ZeroLiner departs into the time stream.

Later, Ryotaro finds Yuto having been investigating the crime lord Seiya Kuroki undercover and discovering his ties to Negataros. Yuto and Deneb manage to maintain his guise of being a villain in the ranks until Ryotaro's partner Suzuki gets himself caught by the evil organization. Attempting to save Suzuki, he gets caught in Negataros' trap to draw out the detectives pursuing him. In the ensuing battle, Yuto is revealed to be in possession of more regular Zeronos cards.

Unlike Ryotaro, Yuto claims that protecting the flow of time is not the same thing as protecting people. He says that saving people is unnecessary if it means disrupting the flow of time even if it means sacrifices must be made to save the future. He holds a very spoiled personality, and often acts like a child when things do not go his way and putting lots of sugar in his coffee before actually tasting it, hence earning him the nickname "Boku-chan" (ÂÉï„Å°„ÇÉ„Çì) by Urataros. Yuto is also the kind of figure who would use dishonest methods to get the job done, but has since abandoned this way of fighting. A running gag with Yuto is his hatred for shiitake mushrooms, going as far as a comic beating to make sure Deneb does not serve or buy any.

When possessed by Deneb, Yuto's hair grows out past shoulder length with two locks of hair on each side of his head. On the right side, the lock is a neon green with a darker green streak within it. His personality is also overwritten by Deneb's, who is much more polite and apologizes for Yuto's actions, often by giving out Deneb Candies and acting overly friendly. This usually gets Yuto angry thus forcing Deneb out of him and comically beating him. In one occasion, he was also possessed by Urataros. Although surprised and initially annoyed, he allowed the possession to happen for a short while.

9.content:
Tsukasa Kadoya (ÈñÄÁü¢ Â£´, Kadoya Tsukasa) is the main protagonist of Kamen Rider Decade. He is an interdimensional traveler who transforms into Kamen Rider Decade (‰ªÆÈù¢„É©„Ç§„ÉÄ„Éº„Éá„Ç£„Ç±„Ç§„Éâ, Kamen RaidƒÅ Dikeido) to oversee the fate of the multiverse, embracing his role as the Destroyer of Worlds (‰∏ñÁïå„ÅÆÁ†¥Â£äËÄÖ, Sekai no Hakaisha).

Tsukasa later returns in Kamen Rider Zi-O as a major supporting character as he observes the actions of Sougo Tokiwa and their effects on the timeline.

Prior to becoming a Kamen Rider, Tsukasa was the ruthless leader of Dai-Shocker, a power-mad tyrant with a strong lust for control. This side manifested itself during Tsukasa's stint as the "destroyer of worlds".

In his amnesic state, Tsukasa is an odd figure with a self-righteous attitude, annoying others through his rude mannerisms. Having no clear goal in life, Tsukasa decided to wander through the A.R. Worlds as Decade, half-heartedly protecting the innocent. Deep down however, Tsukasa genuinely cares for the well-being of others, especially his friends. Thus, whenever someone is seriously at harm, Tsukasa will help them without hesitation, no matter how dangerous the situation.

In strong contrast to his talents and outlook, Tsukasa can be significantly clumsy at times, made apparent when growing too cocky for his own good. In such moments, Natsumi often keeps him in line with her signature pressure-point attack, much to Tsukasa's irritation.

As a photographer, Tsukasa desires to "catch the world" with his photos, something impeded by the distortion of reality. Though normally brushing it off as "unimportant", Tsukasa evidently felt a sense of inferiority from this, being reminded of his status as an outcast. Noticeably, whenever someone compliments him, especially his photography, Tsukasa becomes significantly cheerful in response, a far cry to his usual self.

After fully reclaiming his memories, Tsukasa acts more strategically in a crisis, opting to rely on other Riders for assistance. For such cases, he now closely observes the situation to determine its requirements, intervening when needed. However, his demeanor itself is still undeniably quirky, something both friends and foe alike agree on.

Before a climactic battle begins, a major villain often demands for Tsukasa's identity, to which he replies by declaring "Just a passing-through Kamen Rider, remember that!" (ÈÄö„ÇäÈÅé„Åå„Çä„ÅÆ‰ªÆÈù¢„É©„Ç§„ÉÄ„Éº„Å†„ÄÅË¶ö„Åà„Å¶„Åä„ÅëÔºÅ, T≈çrisugari no Kamen RaidƒÅ da, oboeteoke!).

On a humorous note, he heavily disagrees if someone defines his Rider form is pink, causing him to explain at length that Decade is magenta in color.

Evidently, Masahiro Inoue has stated Tsukasa to be an enigmatic character, playfully expressing him as a "dangerous weirdo" that lacks civility. Simultaneously, Masahiro acknowledges Tsukasa to be a true hero, one that always shines in moments of danger.[1]

Tsukasa uses a "Decade Pink" Blackbird Fly 135 Twin-lens Reflex Camera.

10.content:
Aruto Hiden (È£õÈõª Êàñ‰∫∫, Hiden Aruto) is the main protagonist of Kamen Rider Zero-One. He is a former comedian and the current CEO of Hiden Intelligence who transforms into Kamen Rider Zero-One (‰ªÆÈù¢„É©„Ç§„ÉÄ„Éº„Çº„É≠„ÉØ„É≥, Kamen RaidƒÅ Zerowan).

Aruto is a cheerful individual who will go above and beyond to make those around him happy, even though he is horrible at it. He strongly believes that like humans, Humagears can indeed possess a heart and have dreams of their own, enabling them to prosper alongside humanity. To this end, Aruto became Zero-One to fight against those who he feels threatens that ideology, though this ultimately clouds his judgement of them, especially with ones he had previously developed a strong bond with and prioritized their safety and dignity over profits of the business world. This would eventually lead to his loss in the Workplace Competition against Gai Amatsu, a certified expert in the field.

After becoming Ark-One, Aruto willingly discarded much of his comedic and lighthearted traits, now becoming cold, serious, and vengeful towards Horobi specifically; despite having previously sympathized with the Humagear's unwilling affiliation with the Ark, Aruto now seeks revenge on him for Is's death, as she was his only family after the deaths of his biological kin. While Aruto tries to avoid bringing harm to his former allies, he does not hesitate to fight them if they interfered with his desire for vengeance against Horobi, though he manages maintain enough of his composure to not kill them on the spot. Despite his fall from grace, Aruto is completely aware of his actions and thus grieves with the consequences of what he has become. After briefly seeking advice from his father, Aruto's final clash with Horobi served to teach the latter the meaning of the human heart.

Aruto is known for his good nature and polite manners, as evident towards his usage of the honorific "-san" when speaking with Isamu and Yua. However, his lack of its use towards Gai indicates his total loss of respect for such.

Aruto has also given playful nicknames to his Progrisekeys, calling Flaming Tiger "Tora-chan" („Éà„É©„Å°„ÇÉ„Çì), Flying Falcon "Tori-chan" („Éà„É™„Å°„ÇÉ„Çì) and Biting Shark "Same-chan" („Çµ„É°„Å°„ÇÉ„Çì).

Aruto's catchphrase during battle is "There's only one person who can stop you... and that's me!" („ÅäÂâç„ÇíÊ≠¢„ÇÅ„Çâ„Çå„Çã„ÅÆ„ÅØ„Åü„Å†‰∏Ä‰∫∫‚Ä¶‰ø∫„Å†ÔºÅ, Omae o tome rareru no wa tada hitori... ore da!).

3.name: Rias
3.content:
Appearance:
 Rias is a beautiful young woman with a voluptuous body, white skin, blue eyes (blue-green in the anime, season 1-3) inherited from her father, Zeoticus, and a buxom figure. (Introduced Volume 1, Life.1)
- Her body measurements are [B99-W58-H90 cm] [B39-W23-H35 in]. (Character Bio/Established Early)
- Her body weight is [58 kg] [128 lbs]. (Character Bio/Established Early)
- Her most distinctive feature is her long, beautiful crimson hair, which she also inherited from her father, that reaches down to her thighs with a single hair strand (known in Japan as ahoge) sticking out from the top. (Volume 1, Life.1)
- Her hair also has loose bangs covering her forehead and side bangs framing her face. (Volume 1, Life.1)
- Rias' height is 172 cm. (5 feet 8 inches), making her one of the tallest female characters of the series. (Character Bio/Established Early)
- Although Rias has worn various types of clothing throughout the series, her most commonly worn outfit is the Kuoh Academy girls' school uniform, which consists of a white long-sleeved, button-down shirt (short sleeves for spring/summer), with a black ribbon on her shirt collar worn under a black shoulder cape and a matching button-down corset, a magenta skirt with white accents, and brown dress shoes over white crew-length socks. (Volume 1, Life.1)
- Rias also tends to wear seductive lingerie and thongs, especially when she has a desire to sleep with Issei. (Mentioned/Implied early, e.g., Volume 1, Life.6)
- On some rare occasions, Rias wears glasses when she's deep in thought, as she feels they make her mind work better despite having perfect eyesight. (Occasional detail, mentioned later volumes/side stories)

Annotated Rias Gremory Biography:
Personality:
- As a Devil from the House of Gremory, Rias is very kind and compassionate, especially to her servants and people close to her. (Volume 1, Life.1 onwards)
- She gets angry and violent whenever people insult her or her peerage, showing a fiery side to her. (Seen clearly Volume 2, Life.4 & New Life; Volume 1, Life.4 & New Life)
- This also plays into the fact that she dislikes cruelty towards people, as shown with her disgust over Marius Tepes, who abused his own sister for his own benefit (Volume 24, Life.-1), and how she killed the Fallen Angels, such as Mittelt, Dohnaseek, Kalawarna, and Raynare for their cruel treatment of Issei. (Volume 1, New Life)
- Rias also holds great sympathy towards Sairaorg and his mother Misla Bael for how badly they were treated by the Bael clan. (Shown Volume 5, Life.5; Volume 10, Life.4)
- Rias is proud of her family's name, but she does not like being seen as Rias of the Gremory Family. (Stated Volume 2, Life.2)
- The reason for her living in the human world (as revealed in Volume 2 of the novels) is because there, everyone sees her as Rias, not as a Devil or as the Crimson-Haired Ruin Princess. (Revealed Volume 2, Life.2)
- Due to this and the fact that the only men who showed interest in her were interested in her due to being the Heiress of the House of Gremory, Rias soured on the idea of finding a lover, until meeting and falling in love with Issei. (Context Volume 2, Life.2; Develops Volumes 1-2; Solidified post-Volume 2, New Life)
- She thinks of Issei as a special person (Volume 1 onwards) and always gets jealous when girls are around him, becoming a totally different person when she sees him and other girls together, or when it comes to training. (Jealousy apparent early, e.g., Volume 1, Life.3/4; Volume 3, Life.2; Recurring early volumes)
- Despite her mature stature like a woman, Rias tends to act her true age and becomes frustrated whenever girls flirt with Issei. (Contrast shown Volume 3, Life.4; Recurring trait)
- While Rias is usually calm and mature in most situations, she loses her mature aura and presence when she sees any girl (especially Akeno) flirting with or seducing Issei. (Frequent occurrence, prominent Volume 3 & Volume 4)
- She enjoys teasing Issei and Asia (Volume 3 onwards), but at the same time makes it clear (to Asia or any girl) that Issei is hers, and she does not want to share him at all. (Possessiveness shown Volume 3, Life.4; Recurring early volumes)
- The Gremory Family and their servants are beings with extraordinary affection among the Devils, and Rias is no exception. (General series theme)
- She has no problem with showing Issei her breasts or sleeping naked with him (which she always does according to her and claims she can't sleep without being nude or without Issei). (Sleeping naked mentioned Volume 1, Life.6; Comfort shown multiple times, e.g., Volume 2, Life.1)
- Despite being seductive like Akeno, both of the girls are still innocent to love, as both of them become their age whenever around Issei or on a date with him. (Evident Volume 3, Life.4; Volume 5, Life.4)
- After becoming Issei's girlfriend (End of Volume 10), Rias begins to show more confidence in her relationship with Issei and is no longer jealous or angry when Issei is with other girls like she previously was, even accepting Issei's dream of having a harem and letting the girls have dates with him. (Acceptance solidifies Volume 11 onwards, e.g., Volume 12, Volume 17)
- However, Rias still shows some signs of jealousy such as when Issei doesn't spend enough time with her, but she still believes in him and loves him. (Lingers post-Volume 10, e.g., Volume 17)
- Due to being Issei's official girlfriend and later fianc√©e, the other girls acknowledge her as the "Legal Wife" as she manages the other women who are in love with Issei. (Status solidifies post-Volume 10/11)
- According to Ravel, the burden of Rias as the "Legal Wife" is greater than the burden of Issei as she has to manage the girls' maidenly feelings towards Issei and balance out Issei's feelings towards each of his lovers/brides. (Ravel's observation Volume 22, Life.3)
- Like Akeno, Rias shows a sign of dependence toward Issei (possibly lesser than the former) as Rias will lose her will to fight and lead for some time if Issei is severely injured or she believes that he is dead. (Shown Volume 11, Life.4/New Life; Volume 2, New Life)
- She developed an instinct when Issei is with an unknown woman or other girls tried to seduce him before her she immediately rush to him quickly. (Recurring gag/trait, later volumes, e.g., Volume 17, Shin High School DxD Volume 1)
- Rias holds her older brother, Sirzechs, in high regard (despite her older brother's antics of being a siscon) because she deeply cares for him. (Consistent throughout, e.g., Volume 12)
- When Rias was a child, she was entirely dependent on him and held him in admiration, while also feeling inferior to him at the same time. (Alluded to, context Volume 2, Life.2)
- Rias loves participating in Rating Games, as she dreams of becoming the Rating Game champion by defeating the current Rating Game champion; Diehauser Belial, with the help of her peerage. (Consistent passion; Goal mentioned ~Volume 10, Life.1)
- While Rias is a powerful devil in her own right, being much stronger than average High-class Devils and according to Azazel, being able to become a Ultimate-class Devil just on the virtue on her talent alone (Azazel's comment Volume 4, Life.4), Rias suffers a bit of an inferiority complex when she compares herself to her fellow Rookies Four colleagues, as she feels inferior to Sona as a strategist (~Mentioned Volume 5, Life.3) and that she is far weaker in power than Sairaorg. (Evident Volume 10, Life.4)
- However, according to Riser and Azazel, Rias has a talent for finding and recruiting talented individuals for her peerage, inspiring great loyalty and growing stronger with them as seen in her meeting with Issei. (Riser Volume 2; Azazel ~Volume 5, Life.5 / Volume 10, Life.1)
- During the Azazel Cup, she was highly evaluated as a scout as she managed to recruit Crom Cruach (Volume 24, Life.1) and Vasco Strada (Shin High School DxD Volume 1, Life.1), along with two Longinus possessors (Issei Volume 1; Gasper Volume 4), being praised by the professional critics. (Commentary during Shin High School DxD Volumes 1-4)
- She is noted to be a skilled negotiator, as she was able to convince Rossweisse to join her peerage by offering her better working conditions and a better salary compared to her previous job in Valhalla (Volume 7, New Life), and while during the Azazel Cup, she was able to convince Vasco Strada to join her team after he declined all prior invitations to participate in the Cup by appealing to his warrior swordsman spirit and offering to restore his youth without using a Devils ability, thus not violating his faith, with Strada praising her negotiating skill as a sweet Devil's whisper. (Shin High School DxD Volume 1, Life.1)
- Rias is competitive and hates to lose, especially after losing her first Rating Game against Riser as she strives to always win, whether it is in sports or Rating Games. (Reaction Volume 2; General spirit e.g., Volume 14, Life.2)
- Due to being spoiled by her father Zeoticus and her brother Sirzechs from an early age, she has a somewhat impatient and selfish personality. (Underlying trait, background from Volume 2)
- Being a spendthrift, Rias enjoyed shopping as a hobby (e.g., Volume 13, Life.1) and because of her bad money spending habit, her mother Venelana and her sister-in-law Grayfia often scold her for her frivolous spending, as her mother reconsidered the amount of money she is allowed as allowance. (Mentioned Volume 13+ / DX Volumes)
- Early in her childhood, she developed an instinctive fear and hatred of camels due to being hit by a camel after making fun of it, as the fear is great enough that the residents of the Gremory territory constantly keep camels away from her despite the Gremory's association with camels in the Ars Goetia. (Revealed Volume 8, Extra Life)
- Due to being taught about Japan from Souji Okita (Mentioned Volume 13, Life.1), Rias is a complete Japanophile who is obsessed with Japan's culture and history, buying various Japanese souvenirs and being ecstatic while visiting Kyoto during her school field trip (Volume 13, Life.1 - Life.4), though she became pouty and stomped at the train station due to being unable to fully explore Kyoto (Volume 13, Life.4).
- She also founded a Japanology club after graduating from high school. (Mentioned Shin High School DxD Volume 1, Short Story or similar)

History:
- Rias is the daughter and second child of the Gremory Family. She became the heir after her brother, Sirzechs, became the Satan Lucifer, losing his right as heir to the house. (Background established early, e.g., Volume 2, Life.2)
- After being announced as the heiress of the Gremory Clan, Rias was eventually placed into engagement with Riser Phenex. (Central plot Volume 2)
- When she was a child, she was attacked by a camel for making fun of it, which caused her to have a strong fear of camels ever since. Just seeing imagery of a camel is enough to trigger her fear, as shown when she gets frightened seeing her clan's mascot, which is a camel. (Revealed Volume 8, Extra Life)
- Prior to the series, Rias has reincarnated Akeno Himejima, Koneko Toujou, Yuuto Kiba, and Gasper Vladi as members of her peerage. (Pre-series history revealed gradually)
- Rias met Akeno, her Queen, first servant, and best friend, in Japan, saving Akeno from being killed by her fellow Himejima Clan members after Akeno accidentally entered Heinrich Cornelius Agrippa's territory. (Akeno's backstory Volume 4, Life.3)
- She then met Koneko, her second servant, after her brother rescued Koneko from being executed, leaving Koneko under Rias' care. (Koneko's backstory Volume 5, Life.3)
- She later reincarnated both Yuuto and Gasper, the former who died after being a part of the "Holy Sword Project" and the latter killed by Vampire hunters. (Yuuto's past Volume 3, Life.1 - Life.3; Gasper's past Volume 4, Life.1 - Life.2)
- She entered Kuoh Academy two years before the series along with Akeno, Sona, and Tsubaki, reviving the abolished Occult Research Club which is used as a base for her servants and became its president. (Pre-series background, context from Volume 1)
- Rias and Akeno went on the Kyoto trip during their second year, and Rias enjoyed every moment of it, however, they didn't plan a proper schedule so therefore there were places that she wasn't able to visit like the Nijou-jou. Rias was so upset that she stomped her feet at the railway station. (Past trip mentioned Volume 13, Life.1 & Life.4)
- Also during their second year, Rias and her club organized a haunted house for the school festival and even used real ghosts as she requested a friendly Youkai to look for jobs to plan the decorations. This, however, got them in a lot of trouble with Sona who scolded them for using the real thing. (Past event mentioned Volume 14, Life.2)

Powers & Abilities:
- Great Demonic Power: Like Sirzechs, Rias inherited exceptional demonic power from her parents and has great talent and skill in using it, even by the standards of a High-Class Devil. (Baseline from Volume 1) After Issei transferred power to her, her demonic power increased to where it rivaled an Ultimate-Class Devil, shaking the ground, and being able to mildly injure the Cadre Kokabiel (Volume 3, Life.4 / New Life). Azazel noted that even without training, Rias has the potential to become one of the highest class devils using natural talent (Volume 4, Life.4). Rias has further improved her demonic power through dedicated training and eventually became an Ultimate Class Devil (Developed over series, likely solidified post-Volume 22 / Shin DxD). She was capable of overpowering Ultimate-Class Devils wounded by Crom Cruach (Later volumes, likely post-Volume 22 / Shin DxD), and while in her Balor Princess Form could keep up with Fenrir at 80% percent power (Shin High School DxD Volume 2).
- Power of Destruction (ÊªÖ„Å≥„ÅÆÂäõ, Horobi no Chikara): (Used from Volume 1, Life.4 onwards)
- Extinguished Star (Ê∂àÊªÖ„ÅÆÈ≠îÊòü, Ikusutinguisshu SutƒÅ): (Debuted Volume 10, Life.4)
- Castling: (Used Volume 2, Life.4)
- Oppai Beam („Åä„Å£„Å±„ÅÑ„Éì„Éº„É†, Oppai Bƒ´mu): (Debuted Volume 19, Life.2)
- Healing: Rias is capable of healing others using her demonic power, and skilled enough that she can continue the process while asleep. It requires her embracing the injured person and both parties to be completely nude in skin to skin contact for better effectiveness, although it takes the better part of a night to take full effect. She has shown to be able to heal fatal wounds such as when Issei was struck by a Light Weapon. (Used Volume 1, New Life; details mentioned)
- Transformation: In True High School DxD Volume 3, she can use her demonic power to change the color of her hair from crimson to blonde.
- Expert Magician: Rias is adept in Devil Magic, using it for a variety of purposes enhanced by her demonic power, being one of the magic specialists of her peerage alongside Akeno. (Demonstrated throughout series from Volume 1)
    - Defensive Magic: Rias can create several barriers to protect herself and her servant, such as from Katerea's self-destruction spell during the Three Factions Conference. (Volume 6, Life.5)
    - Memory Manipulation: Rias has shown that she has skill in memory alteration, using it on Issei's parents. (Volume 1, Life.2)
    - Summoning Magic: Rias is capable of summoning her bat-like familiar. (Used occasionally, likely early volumes)
- Enhanced Durability: Rias has shown great tolerance to damage and pain, as she was going continuing to fight Regulus and remain in the Rating Game, though she was nearly defeated due to blood loss. (Volume 10, Life.4)
- Keen Intellect: Rias is a very intelligent and knowledgeable woman, due to being naturally gifted as well as her aristocratic education as the heiress of the Gremory Clan since childhood. When running the Occult Research Club, she is shown to be knowledgeable on occult topics such as supernatural beings like Youkais, Devils, Angels and Fallen Angels. (Demonstrated from Volume 1)
    - Expert Tactician: Though outsmarted several times throughout the series, Rias has proven herself to be an excellent tactician and has saved her team along with others many times due to her profound intellect and her ability to handle unexpected difficulties calmly. Indra also acknowledged Rias as a capable leader and strategist even without Issei's support. (Demonstrated throughout; Indra's acknowledgement later volumes, Post-Volume 22 / Shin DxD)
    - Master Negotiator: Rias is shown to be very talented in negotiations as she could convince Rossweisse to join her peerage by offering her better working conditions and a better salary compared to her previous job in Valhalla (Volume 7, New Life), and while during the Azazel Cup, she was able to convince Vasco Strada to join her team after he declined all prior invitations to participate in the Cup by appealing to his warrior spirit and offering to restore his youth without using Devil's demonic power (Shin High School DxD Volume 1, Life.1). She also managed to recruit Crom Cruach for her team in the Azazel Cup by using his love for fighting strong opponents and his favorite food as payment (Volume 24, Life.1).
- Other Skills: As a High-Class Devil, more so the Gremory Heiress, Rias learned a wide arrange of different skills. In the Human World, she learned things no other pure-blood would ranging from housework to gardening, both of which became hobbies. (Mentioned later volumes/side stories)
    - Huntress: Rias can hunt and prepare wild animals, such as boar, for consumption. (Mentioned side stories/later context, possibly DX volumes)
    - Fisherwoman: Rias has some skill in fishing, being able to catch and prepare fish for dinner. (Mentioned side stories/later context, possibly DX volumes)
    - Master Chef: Rias is a great chef with a wide range of cooking skills and can cook food of the finest quality. According to Issei, Rias is good at cooking Japanese food, Western food, and Chinese food. He considered Rias to be one of the Four Heavenly Kings of the Kitchen in the Hyoudou Residence alongside Akeno, Asia and Miki. (Skill shown occasionally; "Four Heavenly Kings" status likely later volumes, e.g., Volume 14+)
    - Master Dancer: As a Devil noble, Rias is highly skilled in social dancing. During her and Issei's dancing trial in the ruins of connection, she could dance beautifully with Issei, even leading him in the parts he is inexperienced in to pass the trial. (Volume 23, Life.1)
    - Master Designer: Rias is a brilliant interior designer, having designed the chic interior of Cafe CxC along with very elegant furniture. (Shin High School DxD Volume 1 / Volume 25)

Annotated Rias Gremory Trivia:

- Rias' birthday is April 9th, according to official material. (Official Material)
- Rias' name is derived from the Pok√©mon Garchomp („Ç¨„Éñ„É™„Ç¢„Çπ, Gaburias). (Author Info/Official Material)
- Rias' nickname Crimson-Haired Ruin Princess was taken from her mother's nickname Flaxen-haired Ruin Princess. (Mentioned Volume 8, Extra Life)
- The reason why Rias has large breasts even at a young age is because it is a hereditary trait as her mother Venelana, grandmother Chysis and her ancestor Runeas also have large breasts. (Mentioned Volume 8, Extra Life)
- According to a questionnaire: (Official Material/Side Content)
    - Her favorite type of man is one who would follow her to the bottom of hell.
    - Her erogenous zone is located on her neck.
    - Her favorite body part of hers is her crimson hair, because it's the pride of her family.
    - Her lucky panty color is red, but she'll wear any color if it makes Issei happy.
    - When bathing, she starts washing from her left arm, and when bathing with Issei, she'll always wash his back.
    - She thinks herself as someone who tries to be strict but has a soft spot.
    - One reason she's kind to her servants is because she finds them all cute.
    - Her speciality is Japanese cuisine due to studying it ever since she came to Japan.
    - She has trouble dealing with Grayfia because she's very strict with her monitoring.
    - Her favourite music is folk and classical.
    - She hates humidity because it makes it hard to take care of her hair.
    - She'll invite Akeno and Sona to go shopping to get rid of her depression.
    - Her first kiss was with Issei. (Volume 2, New Life)
    - She has the habit to suddenly caress the cheek of cute people.
    - Her first love is Issei. (Develops Volumes 1-2, solidified post-Volume 2, New Life)
    - She's proud of Sirzechs and Grayfia but feels inferior to them. (Pride/Inferiority (Sirzechs) context Vol 2, Life.2; Strictness (Grayfia) recurring)
    - She spends her holidays relaxing at home while drinking tea and reading.
    - Her ambition for the future is to win every title in the Rating Game. (~Mentioned Volume 10, Life.1)
    - If she were to become a Satan, she would liberalize love, because she believes people need to marry the one they love.
    - Her favourite things are the old school building and being in the clubroom with Issei.
- Rias stated that she intends to model the son-in-law of her house herself and rear him according to her ideals. (Stated Volume 4, Life.2)
- In Rating Game fighting-types, Rias is considered a Wizard-type who is closer to a Power-type. (Character Bio/Author Info)
- Rias was one of the young Devil heirs and Kings chosen to compete in the Youth Devil Rating Game Tournament. (Volume 10 plot)
    - She came in first place after defeating Sairaorg Bael in the Rating Game finals match for first place. (Volume 10, Life.4)
- Rias could play the piano when she was a child but it is unknown if she still can. (Mentioned, possibly side story/character notes)
- Rias' job requests as a Devil are usually to defeat monsters targeting her clients or de-cursing items. (Mentioned Volume 13, Extra Life)
- Rias makes review videos of her ‚ÄúSwitch Princess goods‚Äù and uploads them to DeviTube, with the accessories she wears in them secretly becoming popular as a compelling fashion choice. (Later volumes/Shin DxD era detail)
- Rias is the first female character to be placed into an engagement (Volume 2), the second being Kiyome (Volume 15), and third being Rossweisse (Volume 22).
- Rias' hobbies are reading (Mentioned generally), shopping (e.g., Volume 13, Life.1), gardening, cooking, making handcraft and maquettes, and playing video games. (Mentioned across series/side materials)
- She also a hobby of tea parties. (General aristocratic portrayal)
- Rias is said to be exceptional at interior design. (Mentioned, Cafe CxC Shin DxD 1 / Vol 25)
- Rias has a driving license and owns multiple cars such as a red saloon and a red convertible being two of them. (Mentioned later volumes/side stories)
- In one of the short stories, it is revealed that Rias is a big "Japanophile", having a huge collection of objects and artifacts back in her room in the Underworld. (General trait, collection mentioned later volumes/side stories)
- It is also the reason as to why she came to visit Japan in the first place. (Primary reason stated Volume 2, Life.2; Japanophile aspect adds flavour)
    - Rias mentioned that she wants a Japanese style wedding when she gets married and wants it in the Human world; possibly due to her being a Japanophile. (Mentioned Volume 4, Life.2)
    - Rias wants to have her wedding take place in Kyoto. (Mentioned Volume 24, Life.1)
- She is the first to become Issei's girlfriend (Volume 10, New Life), as well as becoming the first to become engaged to him. (Volume 22, Life.3)
- Rias has stated wanted to have one daughter with Issei but she strongly predicted that their first child will be a boy. (Character statement, likely later volumes/side stories)
- Rias is the character that killed the most named characters in the series for a total of five characters (Raynare, Dohnaseek, Kalawarna, Mittelt (All killed Volume 1, New Life), and Viser (Killed Volume 12, Life.4)).
- Rias has a fear of camels, because she got hurt by wild camels after she sneaked out to go to the farm when she was still young. (Explained Volume 8, Extra Life)

4.name: Akeno HimejimaHimejima
4.content:
Appearance:
Akeno is a beautiful young woman with a voluptuous figure, very long black hair and violet eyes. Her hair is usually tied in a very long ponytail, reaching all the way down to the floor with two strands sticking out from the top and sloping backward, with an orange ribbon keeping it in place. (Her general appearance is established from her introduction in Volume 1, Life.1.)

Like most of the girls at Kuoh Academy, she wears the customary Kuoh Academy girls' school uniform, along with black calf-length socks. (Her school attire is standard from Volume 1, Life.1.)

As revealed in the visual book with her data, her body measurements are B102-W60-H89 cm B40-W24-H35 in. Her body weight is 54 kg 119 lbs while her height is 168 cm (5 feet 6 inches).

In the anime, during battles, she often transforms her clothes into a traditional miko attire, consisting of a white haori with red accents, a red hakama, and a pair of z≈çri with white tabi. (While she does have the ability to manipulate her clothing into a Miko outfit, referenced by her title "Priestess of Thunder", its frequent use in battle is more prominent in the anime adaptation than consistently detailed in the light novels.)

After Akeno has revealed her Fallen Angel side in front of Issei, she has one Devil wing and one Fallen Angel wing. (This unique wing configuration is revealed after she confronts her heritage during the events of Volume 4, Life.3.) As the series progressed and she came to terms with her fallen angel powers, her wings increased to six, at first, because of the aid of Azazel's bracelets, (She uses the bracelets provided by Azazel to achieve her six-winged Fallen Angel Mode starting in Volume 7, Life.3) then eight, resembling a High-Tier Fallen Angel. (She achieves eight wings naturally, without the bracelets, later in the series, solidifying around Volume 22, Life.2 or Volume 23.)

Personality
Akeno is first seen to be a very elegant and gentle woman with refined lady etiquette, embodying the principals of the ideal Japanese woman: "Yamato Nadeshiko". However, underneath her calm, noble and dignified atmosphere, Akeno is shown to be highly sadistic in battle and doesn't show any mercy or remorse towards the enemies she slays, casually keeping up her smiling elegant persona over an enemy's death and showing an expression of pleasure and lust upon delivering them pain. (Her Yamato Nadeshiko persona is present from Volume 1, Life.1, while her sadistic side in combat is hinted at early on and becomes more explicit during battles like the one against the Cerberus in Volume 1, Life.4 and the Rating Game in Volume 2, Life.4.)

Despite her sadism, Akeno is very kind, acknowledged by Rias and Issei. Before meeting Rias, Akeno would help people by purifying evil spirits for a living. (Her underlying kindness is consistently shown in her interactions with her friends. Her past purifying spirits is part of her backstory revealed in Volume 4, Life.3.)

As a result of seeing her mother being killed in front of her eyes and her father being unable to save her, Akeno developed a hatred for Fallen Angels, including a sense of self-loathing towards her own Fallen Angel nature, for it was the reason her beloved mother was killed by the Himejima Clan, which lead her to sever ties with her father, going into exile before being saved by Rias after Akeno's maternal relatives nearly killed her. (The details of her mother's death, her resulting trauma, hatred for her heritage, and estrangement from her father are central to her character arc revealed in Volume 4, Life.3.) Due to this reason, she empathizes with those who have suffered under the hands of Fallen Angels like Issei and Asia, who were manipulated and killed by the Fallen Angel Raynare, and was worried that Issei would dislike her due to her Fallen Angel nature. (Her empathy and worry about Issei's reaction are shown in Volume 4, Life.3.) However, she fell in love with him after he told her that he still liked her. (Issei's acceptance and her subsequent deepening feelings occur at the end of Volume 4, Life.3.) With Issei's help, she was able to overcome the sadness of her mother's death and reconcile with her estranged father, renewing their familial bond. (The reconciliation with Baraqiel, facilitated by Issei, takes place in Volume 7, Life.3.) Due to Issei helping her and Baraqiel in their reconciliation, Akeno's love for him deepened considerably as she confessed her feelings for him. (Her confession happens shortly after the reconciliation in Volume 7, Life.3.)

While Akeno originally had no interest in dating men due to her past, she began to take an interest in Issei, thinking of him as a cute junior and that interest intensified after seeing his determination in the Rating Game against Riser Phenex and his actions during Rias' engagement ceremony, where he defeated Riser Phenex. (Her initial lack of interest and growing attraction towards Issei are developed through Volumes 1 and 2, culminating after the events of Volume 2, New Life.) She has stated that Issei is the first boy she has ever felt such feelings for as she is shown to have a desire to further her relationship with him. She also loves to tease Issei and Rias, as she loves to make Rias irritated by flirting with Issei stemming from her playful sadistic side. (Her teasing behavior is prominent from Volume 1 onwards.) Akeno has also stated that she has some masochism in her as well, as she is only masochistic towards Issei in contrast to her sadistic nature in battle. (Her masochistic tendencies towards Issei are revealed more explicitly around Volume 5 and Volume 7.) She is shown to be quite vulgar, flirting with Issei as such and doesn't care if Rias knows or saw her doing the act as she tried to have sex with him (Her attempts to seduce Issei become more direct from Volume 3 onwards) while also trying to help Issei further his relationship with Rias, but does care enough to not steal him away from her as she even helped Issei confess to Rias. (Her support for Issei and Rias' relationship, despite her own feelings, is shown leading up to Issei's confession in Volume 10, Life.5.) After falling in love with him, she becomes very seductive and is obsessed with having an affair with Issei whenever she finds a chance, which is often interrupted by Rias and some others. (This behavior intensifies post-confession, particularly from Volume 11 onwards.)

She also has a emotionally weak side to her once she removes her mask of being an Onee-Sama, what is left is her true side of "depending" on a man, which is generally Issei and her father Baraqiel after reconciling with him. (Her dependence is most starkly revealed after Issei's apparent death in Volume 11, New Life, where she loses her composure completely.) After her beloved mother was executed, she was deeply traumatized and heartbroken for years until she found closure by reconciling with her father. If danger arises to the people she cares about, she will become depressed or it can also lead to a rise in her tension. The latter occurred when Issei was injured in the Rating Game between the Sitri and Gremory groups (Volume 5, Life.5), and the former when Issei was thought to be dead in the Dimensional Gap (Volume 11, New Life).

Despite being seductive toward Issei and acting like a mature young woman, Akeno is still innocent and emotional towards love and acts like a girl her age whenever she is on a date with Issei. (This contrast is shown during her date with Issei in Volume 5, Life.4.) However, this still does not stop her from being seductive and flirting with Issei. Despite being seen as calm and clear, Akeno does get jealous like the other girls and will fight for Issei. (Her jealousy, while often masked by teasing, becomes more apparent in later volumes as the harem dynamic solidifies.)

History:
Akeno is the only child of Shuri Himejima, a Shinto priestess from the Himejima Clan and Baraqiel, a Fallen Angel and one of the leaders of the Fallen Angel organization, Grigori. As a child, Akeno was close to her mother as her father was mostly away on missions and fell into despair when she witnessed her mother's death, blaming Baraqiel for not being able to protect her. After the death of Shuri, Akeno stayed with her mother's relative before being kicked out due to her Fallen Angel blood. (Her parentage and early history are revealed in Volume 4, Life.3.)

At the tender age of 10, without food or money, Akeno journeyed throughout Japan using her skills to purify evil spirits that she learned from her mother in order to survive, doing so for a year and a half. When she stumbled into a certain town, Akeno indirectly saved a human that was contracted with a Devil from the Gremory Clan. Fearing that the Devil would kill her due to her Fallen Angel heritage, Akeno decided to hide from them. Later, while trying to leave the town, Akeno was suddenly attacked by her relatives from the Himejima Clan who came to kill her. Before her Grand-Uncle Suou Himejima could land the decisive blow, Rias, and her father's Bishop, Heinrich Cornelius Agrippa, appeared and talked Akeno's family out of killing her with two conditions; first Akeno is to never enter the territory under the Himejima Clan and second, to always stay beside Rias. She then moved into the Gremory Palace where she was taught various things from studies, to how a lady should act as well as deepening her bonds with Rias, becoming her best friend in the process. She had also become acquainted with Sona Sitri around this time. (Her rescue by Rias and the conditions set by the Himejima clan are detailed in Volume 4, Life.3.)

Upon entering Junior High, Rias received her Evil Pieces and made Akeno her first servant. (Mentioned as background information, likely around Volume 2 or Volume 4.) Two years before the series, she entered Kuoh Academy alongside Rias and helped her in re-establishing the Occult Research Club becoming its Vice-President. (Established context from Volume 1.) Akeno and Rias went to the Kyoto trip during their second year, Rias enjoyed every moment of it, however, they didn't plan a proper schedule and therefore there were places that she wasn't able to visit like the Nijou-jou, Rias was so upset that she stomped her feet at the railway station as Akeno tried to calm her down. (Past trip mentioned during the main Kyoto trip arc, Volume 13, Life.1 & Life.4.) Also during their second year, Akeno and Rias organized their club as a haunted house for the school festival, they even used real ghosts as Rias requested friendly Youkai looking for jobs to plan the decorations. This, however, got them in a lot of trouble with Sona who scolded them for using the real thing. (Past event mentioned during Volume 14, Life.2.)

Powers & Abilities:
- Great Demonic Power: Akeno has great potential in using demonic power, comparable to her King despite being a reincarnated Devil, being the second strongest in the peerage. Riser acknowledged that, pre-training, she was the only one among Rias' peerage who could face his peerage. (Riser's acknowledgement in Volume 2, Life.4.) She became one of the first three to be promoted to Middle-Class, with Azazel stating that she now rivals High-Class Devils. (Promotion occurs in Volume 12, Life.5.) Akeno enhanced her powers to the point of being able to defeat an army of mass-produced Evil Dragons. (Demonstrated during the Evil Dragon War, Volume 21.) Akeno is able to use her demonic power to create a special technique that allows devils to move freely within shrines and temples without any drawbacks. (This technique is likely related to her Himejima heritage and developed later, potentially mentioned around Volume 13 or later.)

- Elemental Demonic Power: Akeno excels in using natural elements such as ice, fire, and water, but she specializes in lightning. She is able to create thunder clouds using her demonic power, making lightning bolts rain down on her opponents. She could freeze Cerberus' flames in an instant (Volume 1, Life.4) and target ice spears at her opponents. Much like her Holy Lightning Dragon, Akeno can also form Asian Dragons out of fire and ice, sending them at her enemies. (Elemental dragon forms shown in later volumes, e.g., Volume 16 onwards.)
     - Lightning Manipulation: Akeno originally specialized in lightning demonic power alone before she began using her Holy Lightning ability, where she imbues it with the power of light. Even before combining it with the power of light, Akeno's strongest lightning bolts were powerful enough to destroy the Kuoh Academy gymnasium. (Demonstrated during training/early fights, e.g., Volume 1 or Volume 2.) Her strikes are shown to be capable of inflicting paralysis and inducing great pain on opponents.
     - Fire: Akeno is seen to can perform Fire Demonic Power through Asian Dragon forms. (Fire dragons mentioned alongside ice dragons, likely Volume 16 onwards.)
     - Water: Akeno has shown to be able to summon a vast amount of bodies of water, large enough to fill a swimming pool. (Likely demonstrated during training or specific Rating Game scenarios, harder to pinpoint a single volume without more context, but fits her elemental control.)
     - Ice: Akeno is capable of freezing her target and create ice into spikes and projectiles. She is shown creating a blizzard that instantly freezes even fire. (Freezing Cerberus's flames in Volume 1, Life.4 is a prime example. General ice manipulation shown throughout.)
- Hypnosis: Akeno has shown the ability to hypnotize others as she used it on her college friends to keep Issei's identity a secret while introducing him as her boyfriend. (This occurs in True High School DxD Volume 1, Life.2.)
- Cloth Manipulation: Usually when Akeno needs to use all of her magic power, she alters her clothes into a Shinto priestess attire that gave her the epithet, "Priestess of Thunder". She also uses this to repair hers or the clothes of others. (The transformation into Miko attire is tied to her epithet, mentioned early on. Repairing clothes is a minor application.)

- Enhanced Magic Power: As a Queen, Akeno can strengthen her magic and demonic powers using the Bishop aspect, which she has shown to be the most adept at using in combat. (The Queen piece granting Bishop traits is fundamental to her role, explained around Volume 2.)

- Great Light Power: As a half-Fallen Angel daughter of Baraqiel, Akeno also inherited great light power, mainly in the form of Holy Lightning which she continued to improved through diligent training, her overall power strengthen to the point of gaining six fallen angel wings which later increased to eight. (Her light power potential is revealed in Volume 4, Life.3, and her development is a major arc.)
    - Holy Lightning (Èõ∑ÂÖâ, Raik≈ç): Akeno's signature ability that she inherited from her father Baraqiel. Akeno combines the power of light and lightning to create Holy Lightning. Akeno can make high-density lightning strikes on her opponents. (She begins actively using Holy Lightning after reconciling with her heritage and father, starting prominently in Volume 7, Life.3.)
    - Fallen Angel Mode (Â†ïÂ§©‰Ωø„É¢„Éº„Éâ, Datenshi M≈çdo): A special form, achieved through Akeno making her Holy Lightning blood denser. In this form, she gained six Fallen Angel wings, strengthening herself, making herself appear more like a Top-Tier Fallen Angel. At first, Akeno needed special bracelets created by Azazel, (Achieved with bracelets in Volume 7, Life.3) however she later became able to enter this state at will. (Achieves it naturally later, likely around Volume 10 or 11.) Akeno's strength increased to the point of being able to gain a total of eight wings. (Eight wings achieved later, around Volume 22 or 23.)
    - Holy Lightning Dragon (Èõ∑ÂÖâÈæç, Raik≈çry≈´): Due to her constant draining of Issei's Dragon aura, she has gained the ability to shape her Holy Lightning into the form of an Asian Dragon, which can move as if it was alive. (Debuts in Volume 16, Life.1.) It has been shown to be powerful, devouring large fragments of rocks and erasing one of Grendel's fireballs. She became capable of creating five of them at once, (Demonstrated in Volume 21, Life.1) each of which are described as having a dense aura. (Described during the Evil Dragon War, Volume 21.)

- Senjutsu: Akeno can use senjutsu to a limited degree to manipulate her presence and avoid detection. (Her ability to use Senjutsu for stealth is mentioned, likely tied to her training and Himejima background, possibly noted around Volume 13 or later.)

- Enhanced Strength and Defense: As a Queen, Akeno possesses enhanced strength and defense through the Rook trait of her Queen piece, but due to Akeno never resorting to physical confrontations, it's unknown how her physical prowess compares to Koneko. (Standard Queen piece abilities.)

- Enhanced Speed: As a Queen, Akeno has the Knight speed enhancement through her Queen piece. Akeno was capable of evading many of Zhu Bajie's attacks with ease. (Evading Zhu Bajie occurs during the Journey to the West arc, Volume 19, Life.3.)

- Expert Magician: Akeno has shown herself to be skilled in the use of magic with her, Rias and Rossweisse being the top magic type specialists in the Peerage (before Rossweisse left). Her magic abilities are enhanced through the Bishop trait of her Queen piece. She has a strong affinity for Shinto Magic, stemming from her Himejima lineage as she could purify evil spirits as a child and later summon legendary Onis. (Her magic skill is evident throughout. Shinto affinity mentioned with her backstory in Volume 4, Life.3. Oni summoning developed later.)
    - Summoning Magic: Akeno has some skill in summoning magic, being able to instruct Asia in its use. She is shown to summon up to six oni familiars that are useful in recon. Her ability to summon creatures was strengthened after she entered the Himejima household and strengthened her Himejima blood, thus allowing her to summon legendary Youkai like Ura and Ibaraki Douji. (Summoning legendary Oni likely occurs post-reconciliation with the Himejima clan, Volume 22 onwards.)
    - Defensive Magic: She has been shown to be able to use magic to strengthen the power of her defense by focusing on the Rook trait of her Queen piece to protect herself as well as others from powerful attacks. (Standard application of Queen piece versatility.)
    - Teleportation Magic: Akeno can use teleportation magic to teleport herself and others. (Standard Devil ability.)
    - Purification: Akeno can use Shinto spells to purify evil spirits which she learned from her mother. (Mentioned in her backstory, Volume 4, Life.3.)

- Extrasensory Perception: Kiba has noted that Akeno has particular skill in reading different kinds of energy flows, being able to tell how the spirits of Kiba's old friends were released from the orb (Volume 3, Life.3), and sensing Vali's arrival (Volume 4, Life.4).

- Stealth Expert: As mentioned by Issei and Rias, Akeno has developed a skill to sneak behind people without leaving any presence. Rias mentioned that Akeno has learned a skill that allows her to avoid detection from Koneko's Senjutsu sensing ability. (Her stealth is noted frequently, often used for teasing or surprise attacks.)

- Master Chef: Akeno is an extremely skilled cook, cooking delicious foods such as nikujaga, which reminded Baraqiel of Shuri. (Cooking skill shown, Nikujaga scene during reconciliation in Volume 7, Life.3.) Her cooking skills are enough for her to be known as one of the Four Heavenly Kings alongside Miki, Rias, and Asia, cooking delicious foods, often competing with Rias over Issei. (Cooking competition is a recurring theme, particularly in later volumes.)

- Flight: Uniquely, Akeno has two different methods of flight, the first being her bat-like wings as a reincarnated devil or fallen angels wings due to her heritage. (Both wing types available post-Volume 4.)

Equipment

- Queen Piece: (Â•≥Áéã„ÅÆÈßí, Jo≈ç no koma): Akeno was reincarnated using the Queen Piece, which grants her the characteristics of a Rook, Bishop, and Knight. Although, she is more aclined to the Bishop trait, instead of the Rook and Knight. (Reincarnation happened pre-series, piece function explained around Volume 2.)

- Bracelets: Golden bracelets engraved with magical characters. An invention by Azazel that assisted the fallen angelisation of Akeno. (Used from Volume 7, Life.3 until she could achieve the form naturally.)

- Oni: Akeno has a great affinity with Onis which she inherited from her mother. She made a contract with small onis as well as two legendary Oni, Ura and Ibaraki Douji. (Contracts likely made post-reconciliation with Himejima clan, Volume 22 onwards.)

- Oni Mask: Akeno possesses an oni mask, something that she uses to summon two powerful and legendary Oni under her contract. One is Ura, a famous Evil Oni who served as his tribe's leader on Onigashima, while the other is a Daiyoukai, Ibaraki Doujou, who served as Shuten Douji's right-hand man. (Mask used to facilitate summoning, tied to the Oni contracts.)

TRIVIA:
- Akeno's birthday is on July 21.
- The name Akeno means "vermilion red" (Êú±, ake) and "from" (‰πÉ, no).
- Akeno's last name, Himejima, means "Princess Island".
- Akeno has large breasts due to her Fallen Angel blood. Azazel later states that female Fallen Angels possesses seductive bodies, but notes that for a half-Fallen Angel, Akeno is exceptional. (Azazel's comment likely made around Volume 7 when discussing her Fallen Angel mode.)
- Issei called Akeno "Yamato Nadeshiko" which means "personification of an idealized Japanese woman", or "the epitome of pure, feminine beauty". (Issei uses this description early on, e.g., Volume 1.)
- In Rating Game fighting-types, Akeno is considered a Wizard-type who is closer to a Technique-type.
Akeno inherited her sadistic personality from her mother and her masochistic personality from her father.
- It was revealed in Ishibumi's other work, -SLASHD√òG-, that Akeno is related by blood to Tobio Ikuse as cousins.
    - Tobio's grandmother is a member of the Himejima Clan.

- Akeno, alongside Asia, have the most familiars in the series with both having six each. (Small Oni, Ura, Ibaraki Douji = 3+ main familiars. Number comparison is meta-knowledge.)
- Akeno uploads videos to DeviTube about Japanese traditional performing arts.
- Akeno has a driving license.
- According to a questionnaire, her favorite type of man is one who is always smiling.
    - She's proud of her black hair and breasts because they make Issei happy.
    - She can do everything with ease.
    - Her weakness is that she's not really good with men.
    - If she didn't become a Devil, she would have became a priestess at some shrine.
    - She likes having tea parties with Rias and Sona, shopping, and making pastries.
    - Her one wish is to go to a deserted island with Issei, so the two of them can enjoy a lifestyle where they spoil each other.
    - She said if Issei feels like having an affair, he can always tell her.
    - She begins washing from her chest.
    - She doesn't put on panties after a shower as a single bath towel is enough for her.
    - Her erogenous zone is anywhere on her body.

- Her hobbies are food research and shopping.
- Her favorite thing is Japanese traditional clothing. This is reflected in her wish to wear a shiromuku, a pure-white wedding kimono worn by brides in a traditional Japanese Shinto wedding ceremony for her marriage with Issei.
- Among the Gremory peerage, Akeno excels at reading different types of energy flow. (Noted by Kiba in Volume 3, Life.3.)

5.name: Koneko Toujou
5.content:
Appearance:
Koneko is a petite girl with white hair and gold eyes. Her body measurements are [B67-W57-H73 cm] [B26-W22-H29 in]. Her weight is [31 kg] [68 lbs]. The front of her hair has two long bangs going past her shoulders and several loose bangs hanging over her forehead, while the back has a short bob cut. She also wears a black cat-shaped hair clip on both sides of her hair, one of which contained the data on artificially making new Super Devils.

She usually wears the Kuoh Academy girls' school uniform, without the shoulder cape. Koneko's height is 138 cm (4 feet 6 inches), making her one of the shortest female characters of the series.

In her Nekomata form, she grows a pair of white cat ears and a pair of matching white tails, and her pupils become more cat-like. In Volume 24, she gained three tails.

In her "Shirone Mode" that she used for the first time in Volume 16, Koneko can make herself grow older, and her attire consists of a short white kimono and a light blue skirt. Her bust size grows significantly larger when in this mode, making her look more similar to her sister Kuroka.

Personality:
Due to witnessing her sister supposedly losing control over her nekomata power and killing her master, Koneko became traumatized by the event, causing her to become withdrawn into herself and stripping her of most of her emotions. 
As a result, Koneko originally had a quiet and cold personality, rarely showing any feelings or emotions, even when she was speaking. 
It is noted that her serious personality is a result of receiving influence from Rias, and it is also antithetical to her sister's mischievous and outgoing personality. 
She was also the only one in the group who did not initially get along with Issei, often insulting and rebuking the latter for his perverted nature, although she reveals that she respects him for never giving up and considers him a hard worker.

She shows the most concern for her comrades when they are in trouble, often lending her strength in fights. 
Koneko apparently has a problem with people calling her a midget (although the context of the phrase could be used to be called flat, as in bust size), as shown in her second battle against Freed Sellzen. 
This may stem from her insecurity about her own small body and bust size.

Koneko is also a glutton, food lover and a keen gourmet, as she is frequently seen eating snacks, visiting restaurants and enjoy regional specialties while on food tours.

At the end of Volume 5, Koneko experiences a change in her personality after Issei helps her overcome her fear of using Senjutsu and now starts acting like a cat, often ends her sentences with "Nya" („Å´„ÇÉ), and/or showing attraction towards Issei. 
Her love for Issei grows so much that, at the beginning of Volume 11, she starts to go into her mating season (though this was later stopped by her sister Kuroka). 
However, she still insults him when his perverted nature gets the better of him (at least when it isn't directed towards herself). Koneko has even stated that she enjoys Issei viewing her as a woman. 

History:
