Born as Shirone, Koneko is a young Nekomata who is part of a rare species among her kind, called the Nekoshou. 
She was born from the union between a human father and a Nekomata mother named Fujimai. 
Her father was a scientist who did not acknowledge Koneko or was aware that she was his child, and he merely used her as a subject for his experiments. 
Her parents eventually died in an experiment-related accident. 
However, her older sister Kuroka, omitted the truth and any other details about them from Koneko to protect her.

After losing her parents, she and her sister were later taken in by an unnamed Devil from the branch family of the House of Naberius, who reincarnated her sister as one of the members of his peerage. However, Kuroka's power as a Nekomata supposedly soon grew out of control, eventually causing her to kill her master and become a Stray Devil on the run from her pursuers. 
In actuality, he had planned to experiment on Koneko in his research about creating a Super Devil, causing Kuroka to kill him in order to protect her younger sister.

Following the incident and the failed manhunt that came after, Koneko was sentenced to death by the Devils in hopes of preventing another incident like Kuroka's from happening. 
However, Sirzechs Lucifer, one of the Four Great Satans, protected her and left her under his sister Rias' care. 
Due to the trauma, she experienced with her sister's betrayal and murder of her master, she fell into a deep depression, eventually robbing her of nearly all of her emotions until Rias helped her out of it. 
It was around that time Rias gave Koneko her name and made Koneko her servant. 

Powers & Abilities:
- Demonic Power: (Volume 1) As a reincarnated Devil, Koneko possesses the standard suite of demonic powers from her introduction. This includes enhanced physical abilities, extended lifespan, and the capacity to utilize demonic magic and spells, forming the foundation of her combat prowess alongside her unique racial traits.

- Senjutsu Expert: (Learned/Developed around Volume 5 onwards; Feat against Gandoma Balam in Volume 24, Life.4) Being a Nekoshou, a rare type of Nekomata, Koneko demonstrates a natural and high aptitude for Senjutsu. She begins to seriously refine these skills under her elder sister, Kuroka, around Volume 5 after confronting her past. Instruction from Magari likely comes later. By skillfully tapping into Senjutsu, Koneko gains precise control over the flow of ki. This allows her to significantly enhance the impact of her physical attacks. She demonstrated this capability by affecting others internally, notably breaking down the formidable magic resistance of Gandoma Balam (Volume 24, Life.4). Furthermore, Koneko can utilize Senjutsu as a sensory tool, allowing her to detect the presence and ki signatures of others (Developed progressively from Volume 5 onwards).

- Touki (Fighting Spirit): (Developed from Volume 5 onwards; Surpassed Kuroka mentioned in Volume 24, Life.5) A key application of her Senjutsu is the ability to envelop herself in an aura of pure ki, known as Touki. This dramatically boosts her inherent strength, defensive capabilities, and movement speed. Through dedicated training (starting Volume 5), she developed the capacity to generate a truly tremendous Touki aura, reaching a level where her raw physical power, when augmented this way, could even surpass that of her highly skilled older sister, Kuroka (Volume 24, Life.5).

- Healing: (Developed from Volume 5 onwards) Koneko can channel ki through Senjutsu for restorative purposes. This likely developed alongside her general Senjutsu mastery starting around Volume 5. This allows her to mend physical injuries, alleviate mental fatigue, replenish stamina, and even restore depleted life-force in others.

- Bouchujutsu (Bedroom Method): (Acknowledged capability, likely discussed Volume 16 onwards) A more specialized, potent, and rapid healing technique derived from Senjutsu principles. While Koneko has openly acknowledged her ability to perform this technique (likely discussed sometime after mastering Senjutsu and understanding its deeper applications, possibly Volume 16 or later when life-force issues for Issei are prominent), she has not yet actually performed Bouchujutsu.

- Kasha (Burning Chariot): (Debuted in Volume 16, Life.3) Tapping into her Nekomata heritage via Senjutsu, Koneko can manifest multiple large, ethereal wheels wreathed in potent white flames. This ability is prominently used while in her Shirone Mode (Debuted in Volume 16, Life.3).

- Sealing: (Learned and used in Volume 17, Fake Hero) Under Kuroka's guidance, Koneko learned a practical and vital application of Senjutsu specifically designed as a countermeasure against Evil Dragons. By utilizing a specialized jewel derived from Issei's Scale Mail armor, she can channel her Senjutsu to forcefully seal the souls of these powerful beings within the jewel. This technique was successfully employed to capture the soul of the Evil Dragon Grendel (Volume 17, Fake Hero).

- Presence Suppression: (Developed from Volume 5 onwards) Koneko has demonstrated the ability to apply her Senjutsu control to consciously suppress her own ki signature and physical presence, likely developed as part of her overall Senjutsu training (Volume 5 onwards).

- Youjutsu User: (Innate; Actively developed from Volume 5 onwards) As a Nekomata, Koneko possesses the innate ability to wield Youjutsu. She begins actively learning and honing these skills (around Volume 5 onwards), receiving instruction from both Kuroka and Magari. She often integrates Youjutsu techniques seamlessly with her Senjutsu applications.

- Immense Strength: (Volume 1 - Baseline Rook trait; Feat vs Viser in Volume 12, Life.4; Defeated Xuelan in Volume 2, Life.4; Amplified by Nekomata Lvl 2 post-Volume 5; Damage vs Gandoma in Volume 24, Life.4; Exceeded Kuroka with Touki in Volume 24, Life.5) Even before factoring in her Senjutsu, Koneko's power is heavily augmented by her assigned Evil Piece trait: Rook (Present from Volume 1). She has been consistently shown lifting and throwing opponents and objects significantly larger and heavier than herself. Notable feats include effortlessly lifting the large Devil Viser before forcefully knocking him a considerable distance (Volume 12, Life.4), and punching through durable materials. She proved her strength in combat by defeating Xuelan (Volume 2, Life.4). Upon achieving Nekomata Level 2 (Post-Volume 5 training), her strength was further amplified, enabling her to inflict significant damage upon Gandoma Balam (Volume 24, Life.4). When combining her Rook-enhanced strength with her potent Touki aura, her physical power is stated to exceed even Kuroka's (Volume 24, Life.5).

- Immense Durability: (Volume 1 - Baseline Rook trait) Complementing her immense strength, Koneko's Rook trait also provides her with extraordinary physical durability (Present from Volume 1). Most conventional attacks often have minimal effect.

- Immense Speed: (Volume 1 - Baseline Nekomata trait; Countered Xuelan in Volume 2, Life.4; Augmented by Touki/Lvl 2 post-Volume 5; Third tail boost in Volume 24, Life.5) While Rooks are typically known for strength and defense over speed, Koneko, being a Nekomata, naturally possesses enhanced agility and swiftness (Present from Volume 1). This inherent speed enabled her to effectively react to and counter the rapid kicks of the skilled martial artist Xuelan (Volume 2, Life.4). By further augmenting her speed with Touki or activating her Nekomata Mode Level 2 (Post-Volume 5 training), she can achieve bursts of velocity fast enough to surprise opponents. After awakening her third tail, her base speed increased to the point where she could move faster than Kuroka could track her presence (Volume 24, Life.5).

- Enhanced Senses: (Volume 1 - Baseline Nekomata trait; Smelled Fallen Angels in Volume 1, Life.3) As is characteristic of her Nekomata lineage, Koneko possesses naturally heightened senses (Present from Volume 1). This was demonstrated early on when she was able to accurately smell the presence of Fallen Angels hiding within a church (Volume 1, Life.3).

- Transformation: (Volume 1 - Basic ear/tail manifestation) Koneko can freely manifest or retract her Nekomata features at will (Volume 1). Manifesting these features grants her full access to her innate Nekomata abilities and Senjutsu potential.

- Nekomata Mode Level 2: (Achieved during training in Volume 5, Life.3) A powered-up state achieved through intense Senjutsu training. In this mode, Koneko grows a second tail and cloaks herself in a powerful Touki aura, granting a temporary but explosive surge in power.

- Shirone Mode: (Debuted in Volume 16, Life.3) An advanced transformation where Koneko utilizes ambient natural ki to temporarily mature her body into an adult form. This mode grants her complete access to her Nekomata powers, including Kasha, and embodies purification.

- Master Hand-to-Hand Combatant: (Volume 1 - Baseline skill; Defeated Xuelan in Volume 2, Life.4; Integrated Senjutsu post-Volume 5; Defeated Evil Dragons in Volume 16; Defeated Grendel clone in Volume 17, Fake Hero; Fought Kuroka e.g., Volume 5, Life.3 / Volume 11, Life.1) Koneko is an exceptionally skilled practitioner of close-quarters combat (Shown from Volume 1). She employs a versatile fighting style. Combined with her Rook-enhanced physicality, she proved capable of defeating trained opponents like Xuelan (Volume 2, Life.4). After embracing her Nekomata heritage and integrating Senjutsu into her combat style (Post-Volume 5 development), her physical attacks became even more dangerous. Continuous training allowed her to overcome formidable foes such as mass-produced Evil Dragons (Volume 16) and a powerful clone of the Evil Dragon Grendel (Volume 17, Fake Hero). She has also demonstrated the ability to fight on par with Kuroka (Various encounters, notably after accepting her power in Volume 5, Life.3 and later confrontations like Volume 11, Life.1).

- Flight: (Volume 1) As a standard ability for all Devils, Koneko can manifest Devil wings, allowing her to fly freely (Shown from Volume 1).

TRIVIA:
- Koneko's birthday is November 23, according to the Sodom Press Data File on her.
- Koneko's name translates to "Kitten" and "little cat", in reference to her being a Nekomata.
- Koneko's real name, Shirone, means "White Sound", in reference to her hair and tail color.
    - Koneko's last name, Toujou, means "Castle", in reference to her being a Rook (in chess, the rook piece is a castle's turret).
    - She has the same last name as Sae "Toujou" from Slash/Dog.
- In Rating Game fighting-types, Koneko is considered a Power-type.
- Koneko plays the mascot character, "Hellcat-chan", in Breast Dragon Emperor Oppai Dragon.
- Koneko has a broad range of interests which include anime, drama, music, and comedy shows.
- Koneko loves rap music and is a fan of Salamander Tomita, who is a kappa rapper.
- Koneko is one of the two servants of Rias who had been given a new name by the latter; the other one being Yuuto. (Koneko's renaming is part of her backstory revealed in Volume 5, Life.3. Yuuto's renaming is part of his backstory in Volume 3, Life.3.)
- Koneko's name, along with the fact that she wears gloves with cat paw prints and is quite agile, were all allusions to her being a Nekomata before the fact was revealed. (Her true nature is revealed in Volume 5, Life.3.)
- Koneko is the sixth to become engaged to Issei Hyoudou. (Engagement occurs in Volume 24, Life.5.)
- She calls herself "Daineko" in her gender-swapped form.
    - Daineko translates to "big cat" in reference to her being a large man when her gender was swapped in the short story "Stop! Yuuto-kun!"
- Koneko likes to enjoy watching food reviews and game videos on DeviTube, as well as live streaming games.
- Koneko's job requests as a Devil are mainly cosplay requests for photo shoots or playing games with her clients. (Mentioned in Volume 13, Extra Life.)
        - The nature of her contract requests coincide with that of Asia Argento. (Mentioned in Volume 13, Extra Life.)
        
- According to a questionnaire:
    - Koneko‚Äôs favorite type of man is one who is a very kind person.
    - She's proud of her ears and tail because people say they are cute.
    - Her special skill is eating a lot and not getting fat.
    - She's not good at doing naughty things.
    - If she didn't become a Devil, she would be living in an unpopular place somewhere.
    - She likes going to cake shops.
    - Her one wish is for her breasts to grow bigger. (A recurring desire mentioned humorously throughout the series, e.g., Volume 7 onwards.)
    - She said about Issei not to be too picky and to please be kind to her forever.
    - She starts bathing from her tail.
    - She has white panties with a hole in for her tail.
    - Her erogenous zone is her stomach.
    - Her hobbies are collecting cat accessories and trying food at various restaurants.
    - Her favorite thing is hot milk mugs.

- Kuroka and Koneko's father was a Buddhist. Hence, both of their parent's souls are in the afterlife associated with Buddhism, and are subject under Great King Enma. (Mentioned in Volume 24, Life.3.)
- In initial story draft, Koneko hated vampires, because one vampire from Khaos Brigade killed her family. Thus, Koneko had bad relations with Gasper. Issei had to reconcile them in Light Novel Volume 4.

6.name: Kiba
6.content:
Yuuto Kiba is a third-year high school student at Kuoh Academy in Class 3B and the school's "pretty boy" who is adored by many female students and hated by other male students. He is Rias' Knight piece.

Yuuto is a handsome young man with short blond hair, blue eyes and a mole underneath his left eye.

Yuuto is overall an upbeat person and cares deeply for his comrades. He's also a very polite and friendly individual, even considering other's initial dislike towards him. As a Knight, he has pride, chivalry, dignity, and honor befitting one, and is shown to enjoy fighting fellow swordsmen like Karlamine.

Yuuto has an immense hatred for Excalibur and other holy swords due to the trauma he experienced in his childhood.

Yuuto's requests usually come from older women and working women who consult their stress with him or by having Yuuto cook for them.

7.name: Asia Argento
7.content:
Appearance:
Asia is a beautiful young girl with long blonde hair and green eyes. Her body measurements are B83‚Üí85-W55-H81‚Üí83 cm; her height is 155 cm 5 feet 1 inch and her body weight is 44‚Üí45 kg 97‚Üí98 lbs. Her hair flows all the way down to her back, with split bangs over her forehead and a single strand sticking out from the top and sloping backward. (Her initial appearance is described upon her introduction in Volume 1, Life.3.)

Her former main attire consisted of a dark teal nun outfit with light blue accents, a white veil over her head with light blue accents, a brown satchel slung on her right hip (where she holds her Bible), and brown boots with black straps in an X-shaped pattern. (Her attire as a nun is described in Volume 1, Life.3.) She also wore a silver cross necklace around her neck (she was later forced to remove it after becoming a Devil). (The cross is mentioned in Volume 1, Life.3, and its removal upon reincarnation is implied/occurs off-screen before her reintroduction as a Devil in Volume 1, New Life.)

Upon transferring to Kuoh Academy, she wears the Kuoh Academy girls' uniform, albeit with a black sweater vest over her dress shirt in place of the cape and corset which has become her current main attire. (Her school uniform is first seen when she transfers in Volume 2, Life.1.)

Personality:
Asia is extremely shy, innocent and fairly inexperienced in things like socializing. (This is evident from her first interactions in Volume 1, Life.3 onwards.) As a former nun, Asia is a devout Christian, despite being reincarnated as a Devil, Asia still believes in God and follows his teachings such as praying to him and reading the Bible, which would usually result in her getting severe headaches. (Her continued faith and the resulting headaches are shown starting in Volume 2, Life.1.) Asia has a strong kindness, even when she was still a human, she harbored no hate towards Devils and treated everyone equally, regardless of what they were. (Her kindness towards Issei, a Devil at the time she met him, is shown in Volume 1, Life.3.) Azazel noted that her unconditionally kindhearted nature forces her Sacred Gear to heal even enemies, as she is incapable of turning a blind eye to the suffering of others. (Azazel comments on this aspect of her power, likely around Volume 4 or Volume 5 during discussions about Sacred Gears.) Asia was also in deep shock when she learned from Kokabiel that the God of the Bible was killed during the Great War. (Her reaction occurs during the Kokabiel incident in Volume 3, Life.4.)

While initially having difficulty adjusting to her new life as a Devil, she has stated that she has found more important things than her faith in God, those things being her new friends, comrades as well as Issei's parents and Issei himself. (Her adjustment and shifting priorities are a gradual process, clearly articulated by Volume 4.)

Asia is noted to be a very pure individual as people are drawn to her and that she is easily liked by others. (This trait is consistently demonstrated.) Her charm and purity is such as that she was able to tame Rassei, a Sprite Dragon despite being a Devil as normally Sprite Dragons aren't tamable by Devils and are only tamable by those with pure hearts. (Occurs during the Familiar arc in Volume 2, Life.3.) Azazel noted that she had outstanding talent for taming Dragons, as after receiving Ophis' blessing, she was able to form a contract with Fafnir, one of the Five Great Dragon Kings. (Ophis's blessing and the pact with Fafnir happen in Volume 12, Life.1.) After she managed to tame 4 mass-produced Evil Dragons, her name was spread in the world of Dragons due to the fact that only Evil Gods were able to tame Evil Dragons, as she became known as the Dragon Priestess (Èæç„ÅÆÂ∑´Â•≥, Ry≈´ no Miko) among Dragons. (Taming the Evil Dragons occurs in Volume 17, Life.4, her title spreads afterwards, noted in Volume 18, Life.2.)

Due to having to give away her panties each time she wants to summon Fafnir, she has become very embarrassed due to seeing Fafnir eat her panties to the point of escaping from reality, lamenting that she has become associated with panties. (The panty requirement and her reaction begin with the Fafnir pact in Volume 12, Life.1 and become a running gag.) However, after seeing Fafnir's resolve to protect her against Rizevim, she has become a bit less embarrassed by it and can put her shame aside during battle when Fafnir is fighting for her intensely. (Her change in attitude during the Rizevim conflict occurs in Volume 20, Life.3.)

Asia has a love of agricultural work as she often does gardening and planting. She has even stated that she would like to live with Issei in the country side of the Underworld and do cropping along with other kind of agricultural work.

Asia would become more "bold" in her relationship with Issei when she saw the other girls being more intimate with him and dislikes the idea of being left out. (Her increasing boldness is a gradual development, noticeable from Volume 3 onwards as she competes for Issei's attention.) Due to Issei initially viewing her as more of a sister due to his desire to protect her, he didn't ogle her like he did other women, causing her to be sad and develop a bit of a inferiority complex when it comes to comparing her looks to the likes of Rias. (Issei's initial view and her resulting sadness are themes in early volumes, particularly Volume 3 and Volume 4.) However, she will get jealous and pinch his cheeks whenever he lusts over other girls. (A recurring reaction seen often.) She is shown to desire to be treated as a woman by Issei and to have his erotic behavior directed at her, as she has even shown a desire bear his children, though she ultimately succeeds in this endeavor after the Sports Festival when she kisses him, as following that point, Issei began to view her more as a woman than a little sister. (Her desire is expressed, and the turning point kiss occurs during the sports festival in Volume 14, Life.2.) Asia thinks very highly of Issei and has stated a desire to stay with Issei forever, even being willing to become his servant. (Her devotion is clear from Volume 1, New Life onwards.) Despite being shy, she is shown to be protective of Issei as she will slap someone like Diodora when they insult Issei. (She slaps Diodora in Volume 6, Life.4.)

After becoming Issei's servant, she has begun to shown more courage and determination in battle, as demonstrated in the Rating Game against Team Rias Gremory, where Asia stayed behind to fight Crom Cruach alone to allow Xenovia and Irina to proceed ahead as well to preserve Issei stamina, with Crom Cruach admiring her courage and guts. (This occurs during the Azazel Cup in True High School DxD Volume 2, Middle Game.) During the fight, she even displayed the ability to use Magic offensively, in contrast to her past passive self, as she continued to fight Crom Cruach even after Fafnir was defeated, stating that as the servant and future wife of the Red Dragon Emperor, she would keep fighting until the end, which deeply impressed Crom Cruach as he praised her courage and spirit, stating that it was his honor to fight her and Fafnir. (Her actions and Crom Cruach's reaction in True High School DxD Volume 2, Middle Game.)

History:
In the past, Asia was abandoned by her parents in front of a church as an infant and was raised there. Sometime, during her childhood, she had awakened her Twilight Healing to heal an injured puppy she discovered, which was witnessed by one of the Catholic Church members causing her to become symbolized as the Holy Maiden. But, in all that time she didn't have either friends or people to talk to since most people viewed her as a monster who could heal wounds. (Her backstory is revealed in Volume 1, Life.3.)

At some point, Diodora Astaroth devised a plot to have Asia heal him, a Devil, and cause her banishment from the Church with people labeling her as a "witch". With no place to go, Asia had to rely on the Fallen Angels. (Diodora's involvement in her exile is revealed later, confirmed in Volume 6, Life.4.)

Powers & Abilities:
- Demonic Power: As a Devil, Asia has all the common skills and powers of one, including the power to cast spells. (Standard Devil abilities apply post-reincarnation in Volume 1, New Life.)

- Enhanced Magic Power: As a Bishop, Asia can strengthen her Magic and Demonic Powers, which she normally applies onto her Twilight Healing. (The function of the Bishop piece is explained around Volume 2.)

- Magic Talent: As a Bishop, Asia has shown great potential in using magic as she was put in charge of forming a barrier by Freed. (Occurs during the Kokabiel incident in Volume 3, Life.4.) Asia is studying under Rossweisse in order to learn summoning and transport magic to help defend herself and increase her combat strength, she can also use Dragon Gate magic circle. (Training under Rossweisse begins after Rossweisse joins in Volume 7, Dragon Gate usage shown later, e.g., Volume 12.) Using her Bishop trait she can enhance her healing abilities with Twilight Saint Affection along with Fafnir's golden aura. (Synergy with Fafnir starts post-pact in Volume 12, Balance Breaker synergy later.)

  - Summoning Magic: Asia is show to be very adept at summoning magic as she is capable of using it to summon various creatures to assist her and Dragon Gate magical circles to summon her guardian familiar; the Golden Dragon King Fafnir. (Summoning Fafnir begins Volume 12, Life.1.)
  - Elemental Magic: Asia is capable of using elemental magic; such as fire and wind magic as demonstrated in her fight against Crom Cruach. (Occurs in True High School DxD Volume 2, Middle Game.)

- Dragon Tamer: She's shown to have the talent of compatibility and outstanding luck with Dragons, as she made a pact with a baby Sprite Dragon, Rassei, whose race is notoriously untamable. (Occurs in Volume 2, Life.3.) After receiving Ophis' blessing, her compatibility increased, and she made a pact with one of the Five Dragon Kings; Fafnir. (Occurs in Volume 12, Life.1.) Asia was able to make a pact with four mass-produced Evil Dragons who were named Anselmus, Cyril, Gregorios and Simeon, which is an act that only Evil Gods were able to do before. (Occurs in Volume 17, Life.4.)

- Praying: Asia is one of the two Devils, the other being Xenovia, that can pray to God without receiving damage in the form of a headache after Issei made a request to Michael to allow them to pray to God. (Request made in Volume 3, Life.5, ability confirmed later, e.g., Volume 4.)

- Flight: Being a Devil, Asia can use her wings to fly. (Standard ability post-reincarnation.)

Equipment:
- Twilight Healing (ËÅñÊØç„ÅÆÂæÆÁ¨ë, Towairaito Hƒ´ringu): Asia's Sacred Gear and her main weapon of choice, she can heal Humans, Devils, Angels, and Fallen Angels alike. (Introduced and demonstrated in Volume 1, Life.3.) Since she has shown no actual combat skills, she relies on her healing abilities as a healer of her team. Asia learned how to expand the range of her healing field and send her healing powers as a projectile, although these are inferior to actual touch. (Range expansion likely developed during training arcs, e.g., between Volume 4-5.) In Volume 11, Azazel has said that she mastered her Twilight Healing more than other possessors in healing powers and time. (Azazel's comment in Volume 11.) She can also create a bow and arrow of healing power, and if the arrow is about to hit an enemy, it will disperse instead of healing them. (Healing arrow technique likely developed later, possibly around Volume 16 or later.)

    - Twilight Saint Affection (ËÅñÈæçÂß´„ÅåÊä±„ÅèÊÖàÊÑõ„ÅÆÂúí, Towairaito Seinto Afekushon): Asia's sub-species Balance Breaker. Asia's Balance Breaker takes the form of a Golden Dragon Armor with red jewels that cover her body and grants her a field of absolute defence and protection. For a limited time, Asia can cover a field with tremendous healing energy and can negate any damage from virtually any sources. It does not negate the attack but rather it negates the damage that the attack would inflict. As Fafnir's aura is included as well, it also boasts immense defence on top of the healing ability. Asia can also used it to heal numerous allies at once on a wide range, using it to heal the allied youkais during the Evil Dragon War. (Balance Breaker achieved and used during the Evil Dragon War, Volume 21, Life.3.)

- Bishop Piece (ÂÉß‰æ∂„ÅÆÈßí, S≈çryo no Koma): Asia was reincarnated using the Bishop Piece, which grants her enhanced magic power. (Reincarnation occurs off-screen between Volume 1, Life.4 and Volume 1, New Life.)

- Dragons: Asia had made a pact with Dragons. With the help of Ophis' blessing, Azazel, Rias, Rossweisse, and Akeno, she can make pacts with various classes of Dragons, even higher classes, especially Fafnir the Golden Dragon King. She uses Fafnir and the other four Evil Dragons (that she tamed using Fafnir's skills) to protect herself in order for her to heal her comrades. (Pacts made in Volume 2, Volume 12, Volume 17.)

TRIVIA:
- Asia's birthday is on May 11.
- Asia Argento is named after the famous Italian actress of the same name, daughter of horror director Dario Argento, who is known to have played a number of roles as a nun.
    - Asia's last name is also the Italian word for "Silver", in reference to the silver cross she once wore prior to being revived into a Devil. Silver crosses are common among the Catholic clergy, particularly exorcists.

- Asia's breasts have grown to be nearly the same size as Xenovia's and Irina's. According to Ravel, this is due to a combination of devil physiology, demonic power and Asia's own desires for Issei to see her as attractive. (Breast growth discussion occurs in Volume 23, Life.1.)
- Asia is the third girl to become engaged to Issei Hyoudou. (Engagement occurs in Volume 23, New Life.)
- Asia wants to have her wedding take place in Japan. (Mentioned in Volume 24, Life.1.)

- According to a questionnaire:
  - Her favorite type of man is Issei.
  - She's proud of her eyes because Issei says they're beautiful.
  - Her special skill is being able to recite the Bible and scriptures.
  - If she didn't become a Devil she would have continued being a Sister.
  - She likes to go to home improvement stores and 100 yen stores with everyone and she never gets tired of all the products she finds unusual.
  - Her one wish, is to travel to various places in Japan, because she wants to learn more about it.
  - She's thankful to the Occult Research Club members for always being so friendly with her.
  - She loves Issei and will always be there for him.
  - She begins bathing from her hands.
  - She has pink, transparent underwear gifted from Kiryuu.
  - Her erogenous zone is around her collarbone.
  - Her hobbies are praying and collecting shoujo manga.
  - Her favorite thing is having a matching umbrella with Issei.

- Asia has stated to want five children.
- Asia has a hobby for farming and one of her dreams for the future is to engage in agricultural work with Issei in the Underworld.
  - She also harbours a dream to live in a countryside in the Underworld at a point. (Mentioned in Volume 17, Life 2.)

- Interestingly, Asia's four Evil Dragons Anselmus, Cyril, Gregorios, and Simeon are all names of religious figures.
- In Rating Game fighting-types, Asia is considered a Support-type who is closer to a Wizard-type.
- Asia first noticed that Issei's request to Michael for her and Xenovia to be able to pray was granted during a date with Issei.
- During her "date" with Issei in Volume 1, Asia gained a yellow mouse plush doll she named "Racchuu-kun" that resembles Pikachu from Pokemon. (Occurs in Volume 1, Life.3.)
- Asia's first-ever meeting with Issei may have been foreshadowing to the relationship between Cleria Belial and Masaomi Yaegaki, as at first, Asia and Issei similarly to Cleria and Masaomi, were forbidden from seeing each other in the same town; Kuoh Town due to the Devil's side and Angel's side still at feuds with each other. (Initial restrictions mentioned in Volume 1, Life.3.)
- Asia, alongside Akeno, have the most familiars in the series with both having six each. (Rassei, Fafnir, 4 Evil Dragons = 6).
- Asia's job requests as a Devil are usually cosplay requests for photo shoots and playing games. (Mentioned in Volume 13, Extra Life.)
  - The nature of her contract requests coincide with that of Koneko Toujou. (Mentioned in Volume 13, Extra Life.)

- Asia alongside Xenovia, make videos giving expository about Japan's daily school life from a foreigner‚Äôs perspective and upload them to DeviTube. Irina is sometimes called in as a guest to which the trio became a popular streaming group.
- Asia learned how to ride a bicycle because she wanted to ride with Issei to go on a picnic, as well as ride with Xenovia, Irina and Aika to go shopping.
- There's a jinx that all the villains who have hurt Asia have suffered brutal ends and were killed, no matter the series. These antagonists includes Raynare (Killed Volume 1, New Life), Freed (Killed Volume 3, Life.5), Diodora (Killed Volume 6, Life.5), and Rizevim (Killed Volume 21, Life.3).

8.name: Gasper
8.content:
Gasper Vladi is a cross-dressing male Dhampir, a half-Vampire half-human but was turned into a Devil by Rias Gremory. He has the ability to stop time and is Rias' first Bishop piece.

Gasper is an effeminate-looking male with platinum blond hair and pinkish-violet eyes. His hair is styled in short bob cut with several small fringes over his forehead, and he has pointed ears. Kiba describes him as looking like a beautiful girl.

Originally a coward and a shut-in with a very shy personality, Gasper likes to wear female clothing, claiming that girls' clothes are cute. He also has a penchant for boxes, carrying one with him all the time.

Gasper was born between the Vampire Lord Vladi and a human mother; the latter of whom died shortly after giving birth to Gasper, who was born as a mass of darkness which accidentally cursed his mother and several servants to death. Between the incredible fear of Gasper's true form from the higher ups, his uncontrollable Sacred Gear, Forbidden Balor View, and people's general prejudice towards the half-breed, Gasper grew up in isolation and abuse.

He would meet Valerie Tepes and they would often play together; Valerie forcing Gasper to dress up as a girl which would lead to his cross-dressing habit. One day, Gasper worked up the courage to try to escape from the castle with Valerie's help and was shortly thereafter killed by Vampire hunters. Rias Gremory, who was in the area at the time, came upon the boy by chance and taking pity on him reincarnated him as one of her servants.

Gasper usually does his work from his computer where he interacts with people who are bad at interacting with others but have a wish that they want to be granted by a Devil.

9.name: Quarta
9.content:
Xenovia Quarta is a third-year high school student at Kuoh Academy in Class 3-B and is a natural-born Holy Sword user who wields the Durandal. After learning the truth of God's death in the war, she was excommunicated from the Church and decided to join the Occult Research Club as Rias' second Knight piece, alongside Yuuto.

Xenovia is a beautiful young woman with chin-length, blue hair with a dyed green fringe on the right side and brown eyes.

Her battle attire is her Church battle suit, which consists of a black, skin-tight, short sleeve leotard with pauldrons, matching fingerless gloves that extend to her biceps, and thigh-high boots, all of which are adorned with straps. This attire is worn under a white hooded cloak with gold and blue accents. She also wears a crucifix around her neck, which was later removed after becoming a Devil.

When Xenovia was first introduced, she was shown to have a calm, quiet, and serious demeanor, putting her mission first and only speaking when necessary. She was also very cold, bordering on heartless, as she called Asia a witch for becoming a Devil (even though she became one unwillingly so she could be with Issei) and even went so far as to try and kill her. She later threatened to do the same to Kiba when he was technically a Stray. After being reborn as a Devil, however, she gains a very close relationship with Asia, being touched by her kindness and apologizes for calling her a witch when they first met.

In battle, Xenovia appears to be a bit arrogant, and stubborn.

Xenovia mostly receives jobs that involve physical work, such as helping out in construction work or being a practice partner for various sports.

10.name: Rossweisse
10.content:
Rossweisse is a former bodyguard for Odin, she is currently acting as the Civics teacher at Kuoh Academy and Class 3-B's homeroom teacher. She is Rias Gremory's second Rook piece.

Rossweisse is a beautiful young woman with long, straight silver hair and aqua-colored eyes who appears to be in her late teens.

Rossweisse is known to be a very serious person, acting professional prioritizing work and study above all else since her youth, this however, caused her to miss out on romance, thus is extremely bitter and sensitive about not having a boyfriend and is quick to anger or sadness when made fun of. She has taken a liking to her role as a teacher in education for her students, making sure they understand her lessons and helping them whenever they're in a bind and is appreciated for it. Rossweisse has little tolerance for those who behave unprofessionally, especially for lewd acts at inappropriate times. When she lectures them on standards, they usually retort with her simply being jealous. This may have some truth to it as on numerous occasions she has expressed interests in doing perverted things with her future boyfriend, she also desires her lover to be financially stable with a bright future.

Rossweisse gets requests that are mainly from housewives where she does things like teaching them a way to make them lose their worries related to their finances and becoming their consultant. She also teaches them sure-fire methods to winning at bargain sales despite her young age.

lorebooks.name: Forms And Techniques DB
lorebooks.creator: waxyy

1.content:
Forms
Base Form: This is the standard form of a character without any transformations. Characters can still be incredibly powerful in this state, especially those with high battle power.
Multiplier: x0

Super Saiyan: A legendary transformation for Saiyans that significantly increases their power, speed, and fighting abilities. The hair turns golden, and the eyes become teal. It is triggered by intense emotion, usually anger.
Multiplier: x50

Super Saiyan 2: An advanced version of Super Saiyan, characterized by increased power and a more intense aura. The hair stands up more, and there are visible sparks of energy around the user.
Multiplier: x100

Super Saiyan 3: A transformation that offers immense power but is difficult to maintain due to its high energy consumption. The hair grows long and wild, and the user loses their eyebrows.
Multiplier: x400

Super Saiyan 4: A transformation exclusive to "Dragon Ball GT," Super Saiyan 4 combines the primal power of the Great Ape with the intelligence of a Saiyan. The user has red fur, black hair, and a more muscular physique. It emphasizes raw power and agility.
Multiplier: x4000

Super Saiyan God: A transformation achieved through a ritual involving five pure-hearted Saiyans. It grants the user godly ki, which allows them to fight on par with divine beings. The hair turns red, and the aura is fiery.
Multiplier: x20000

Super Saiyan Blue (Super Saiyan God Super Saiyan): A combination of Super Saiyan God and Super Saiyan, this form has blue hair and a blue aura. It offers the power of a god while retaining the Super Saiyan transformation's speed and strength.
Multiplier: x1000000

Super Saiyan Blue Kaio-ken: A combination of Super Saiyan Blue and the Kaio-ken technique, used by Goku. This form significantly boosts his power but puts immense strain on his body.
Multiplier: x20000000

Super Saiyan Blue Evolved: An advanced version of Super Saiyan Blue used by Vegeta, which grants him even greater power and a more intense aura.
Multiplier: x20000000

Ultra Instinct: A state of heightened reflexes and instinctual fighting. The user can react without thinking, making them incredibly difficult to hit. The hair turns silver, and the aura becomes a shimmering white.
Multiplier: x100000000

Ultra Ego: A transformation used by Vegeta, which enhances his power based on the damage he takes. It emphasizes offense over defense, with a purple aura and a more aggressive fighting style.
Multiplier: x100000000

Kaioken: A technique developed by King Kai that temporarily boosts the user's power. It can be used in conjunction with Super Saiyan forms, but it puts a significant strain on the body.
Multiplier: x20 - x50

2.content:
Kamehameha: A signature energy wave technique developed by Master Roshi. It involves gathering ki and releasing it in a powerful beam.
(Variations: Super Kamehameha: x5 power of the kamehameha. Final Kamehameha: x50)

Spirit Bomb (Genki Dama): A technique that gathers energy from living beings and the environment to create a massive energy sphere. Goku uses this technique to defeat powerful foes.

Final Flash: A powerful energy attack used by Vegeta, where he charges a massive amount of energy and releases it in a devastating beam.

Destructo Disc (Kienzan): A razor-sharp disc of energy that can slice through almost anything. It is used by Krillin and can be thrown at opponents.

Masenko: A technique used by Gohan, where he gathers energy in his hands and releases it as a powerful beam.

Special Beam Cannon (Makankosappo): A technique used by Piccolo that involves charging a beam of energy that pierces through opponents.

Afterimage Technique: A technique that allows the user to create a visual illusion of themselves, confusing opponents and making it difficult to land a hit.

Instant Transmission: A technique that allows the user to teleport instantly to any location, provided they can sense the ki of the target.

Solar Flare: A technique that temporarily blinds opponents, allowing the user to escape or gain an advantage in battle.

Dragon Fist: A powerful melee attack used by Goku, where he channels energy into his fist and strikes with immense force.

Kamehameha x10: An advanced version of the Kamehameha that multiplies its power tenfold. Goku uses this technique during intense battles.

Big Bang Attack: A powerful energy attack used by Vegeta, where he creates a massive sphere of energy and launches it at his opponent.

Final Kamehameha: A combination of the Final Flash and Kamehameha, used by Vegeta and Goku in their fused form (Vegito).

Hellzone Grenade: A technique used by Piccolo that involves creating multiple energy spheres that surround the opponent and then detonating them simultaneously.

Tri-Beam (Kikoho): A powerful technique used by Tien Shinhan that focuses a massive amount of energy into a concentrated beam. It is known for its destructive capability but is taxing on the user.

Eraser Cannon: A technique used by Android 17, where he fires a powerful energy blast from his hand.

Super Ghost Kamikaze Attack: A technique used by Goku's rival, Gotenks, where he creates ghostly clones that can explode upon contact with the enemy.

Buu's Absorption: Majin Buu can absorb other beings to gain their powers and abilities, changing his form and increasing his strength.

Senzu Beans: While not a technique, these magical beans can heal injuries and restore energy, allowing characters to recover quickly during battles.

Barrier Techniques: Various characters, like Krillin and Piccolo, can create energy barriers to defend against attacks.

Instantaneous Movement: A technique similar to Instant Transmission, used by characters like Goku and Whis, allowing them to move instantly to a location they can sense.

Dragon Throw: A grappling technique used by Goku, where he throws his opponent with immense force.

Ki blast: A basic energy blast technique used by many characters, including the Z Fighters and villains.

Spirit Sword: A technique used by Future Trunks, where he creates a sword made of energy to attack his opponents.

Destruction Energy Sphere: A technique used by Beerus, where he creates a small sphere of energy that can cause massive destruction upon impact.

lorebooks.name: Afphusasshifwe
lorebooks.website_description: Recommended to use with Faith or any future characters that share her setting
lorebooks.description: The Green Serpent's spawn: their lands, attributes and culture.
lorebooks.creator: Terref

1.content: The mainland polity of Afphusasshifwe, ruled directly by their Goddess-Queen. Its terrain consists mainly of rainforest and various wetlands. To the east-south-east is the ocean's shore. The Afphusasshifwe's land has very few actual towns and nothing that would qualify as a city. Villages always expand, split or merge. Less commonly, they shrink and are eventually abandoned, to be reclaimed by the wilderness. Travel within this land is dones as often by flat-bottomed boat or barge, as it is by foot or mount. Wheeled forms of transport are mostly useless outside of a town. Few outsiders ever grow to be comfortable in this land, unless they marry a local or three. Even then, some never truly adjust.

2.content:
The Afphusasshifwe are descended from humans who had been enslaved to the Dawn Nobles - an ancient, squamous race that used to dominate the region up until the Green Rebellion.
Afphusasshifwe frames are smaller than those of Earth humans; their skin pigmentation has a greenish tint; they are ambidextrous by default, so having an "off hand" counts among them as a minor disability. The most striking feature of their appearance is their sharp, elongated upper canines. These are hollow and are used both for vocalization (especially the dental whistle phoneme, [#]) and for extracting the nutritious juice of fruit whose pulp is poisonous to warm-blooded creatures.
The nation's name literally means "Green Serpent's Spawn", so named after an antagonistic trickster god from the Dawn Nobles' mythology and a foil to the Noble Serpent credited with creating the Nobles themselves.

3.content: Children of the Green Serpent who live outside his domain. Some are transient, often driven by wanderlust and the spirit of exploration, having left the swamp to see the world but fully intending to return one day. Others settle among the foreign nations, sometime syncretizing their culture or faith with the local ones. In communities with a significant Green minority, they sometimes develop their own subculture and live closer to each than to members of the host nation. Such groups are known as "tangles" if small, or Exclaves, if notably large. Some of these have been around for many generations. Most of them still pray to Afphusasshi (the Green Serpent), Fhtfhtphjsth (the corporeal Goddess-Queen), or both.

4.content: Smaller nations, each controlling one or more small islands in the eastern ocean. Ethnically, they are among the Green Serpent's children, but politically, each island nation is independent of the Mainland. Religion varies: some islands worship the Goddess-Queen and/or the Green Serpent, but not all do. Similarly, some speak insular dialects of the Green Serpent's Tongue, while others have their own languages, acquired from neighboring nations and creolized to different extents.

5.content:
Afphusasshixrm (literally "Green Serpent's tongue") originally split off from Afphuzjzhxrm (Noble Serpent's Tongue) as a pidgin for the humanoid slaves who couldn't pronounce a large portion of their scaly owners' language. The Noble Tongue is still alive today, if dwindling. It's spoken by the small number of extant "Basilisks": descendants of the Dawn Nobles who survived the Green Uprising, dozens of generations ago, and now live as a protected minority among their former slaves. 
Since then, Afphusasshixrm has developed and drifted far from its Afphuzjzhxrm roots; enough to no longer be mutually intelligible. Like its parent, the Green Tongue started out inscribed on immobile objects, like tree trunks and soft rock. It is written with two hands: the lead hand charting the midline and vowels, the other hand adding the consonants along that line. 
Sasshixrm has 4 or 5 vowels ([a], [e], [i], [o]; some dialects also [u]), 3 apleumonic stops ([p'],[k'], [t']), and many fricatives. The vowels are used sparingly, so syllables can be formed entirely without them. Vowels are written as curves on the midline, fricatives cross it, stops are placed in gaps left on the line for them. A gap without a stop in it signifies the end of one word and beginning of another. For punctuation, diacritics are used.
By contrast, Zjzhxrm has only 3 vowels, one stop, and a positively staggering number of fricatives.

6.content:
The Afphusasshifwe that populate the mainland Quagmire, traditionally practice both polyandry and polygyny. The number of spouses an individual may handfast, is determined by how many spouses they could take care of, in a hypothetical situation where those spouses contributed nothing. As a result, the poorer members of this nation tend to form simple couples, whereas the wealthier ones often create giant polycules. Some times, an entire village can consist of a single branched-out family.
Titles and inheritance are transferred through matrimonial lines, rather than parent to child.

Marriage that can't result childbirth (same-sex or cross-species) is called "Joining". It's taken just as seriously as a handfasting, but differs from it in two ways: Joining is not used to determine someone's title, and inheritance of through Joining only covers property that can be moved - never land or buildings. In the absence of a living spouse, a sibling will inherit first, and only then a descendant.

7.content:
The term "demihuman" is unheard of: all those with a humanoid body-plan are considered subraces of human. The most common human races are colloquially referred to as Pink, Gray, Green or Giant. Most urbanized human nations are either Pink or Gray.
Pink skins are the closest in appearance to Earth humans, but are taller, with prehensile toes, and a tail. Their tails vary in length, from as short as a finger to as long as a leg. Their hair color has by far the most variations, including their facial and body hair. They're traditionally called Plainsfolk, but many dwell in valleys, woods, plateaus, hills and deserts.
Gray skins originate from rocky environments, usually around water. Cliffolk skin is covered in down that can be light brown, yellowish, white or gray. Their heads are bald, except for that same down. Their ears are elongates at birth, but gradually become rounder with age, unless prevented from this change by means of piercings. Their hands and toes are webbed to varying extents and they're able to hold their breath for significantly longer than other human races. On average, these cliff dwellers are taller than mirefolk but shorter than plainsfolk.
Green skins are Afphusasshifwe: this includes the nation itself, along with the green insular polities and expat minorities living among other races.
Giants (aka Ogres) look like cliff dwellers, except twice as wide, half-again as tall, and with coarser hair on their heads and faces but none on their bodies. They originate on one large island and are a rare sight outside of its vicinity. There are rumours than a fifth human race exists, but no consistent notion of what those look like.

8.content:
The Scribes are an aquatic lifeform analogous to molluscs. Their name comes from having invented writing, before teaching it to other races. A Scribe look like a translucent, gelatinous blob with several tentacles. Their pigmentation depends on the ecosystem they live in: coastal dwellers are greenish, coral dwellers are pinkish, bottom-crawlers are clear and colorless. The longer a Tide Scribe remains outside of seawater, the darker and more opaque it grows. An average Scribe can stay on dry land (in the shade, without extreme weather conditions) for 6-12 hours without significant discomfort and for at least 20 hours before there is a palpable risk to its life or health. Freshwater offers almost no health benefit, but helps the discomfort significantly.
Two of a Tide Scribe's tentacles are hunting limbs. The pads at their end release an acid, at variable concentrations, that the Scribes have learned to use for communication, owing to its ability to discolor rock, glass, ceramics, bone and other surfaces. Their writing systems use different shades of discoloration to represent the different sounds of their languages, spaces to indicate breaks in their subverbal hum, and line-breaks to signify word boundaries.

Info from the Cookie Run Kingdom wiki!

Tags for easier searching: CookieRun, CRK
lorebooks.description:
Info from the Cookie Run Kingdom wiki!

Tags for easier searching: CookieRun, CRK
lorebooks.creator: I_Lke_Peanut_Butter_

1.content: A city that is bustling with magic. The city houses a beacon that always burns bright, serving as a symbol of unity between Parfaedia and the other magical cities. The cities made a promise to assist each other in times of crisis, vowing that for as long as the beacon's flame was lit, the cities would face any threat together.

2.content: The Parfaedia Institute is a school of magic aimed to guide young Cookies on their journey to become wizards, including a dormitory for the students. The institute teaches a variety of subjects, all relating either to magic or the city where it resides.

3.content: The Council of Parfaedia oversees and passes judgement on cases of unsanctioned magical activity. They hold a considerable amount of influence in the city and are able to command different authorities and factions within the city, such as the professors at the Parfaedia Institute and the members of Magical Emergency Handling. The council is also responsible for holding wizarding ceremonies to officially appoint new Wizards.

4.content: The Magical Emergency Handling Department (often shortened to M.E.H.) is a police group responsible for taking care of accidental magical incidents in Parfaedia. As the city is full of many curious wizards, the department is typically rather busy. Its duties include preventing casualties and municipal property damage.

5.content: The Triple Cone Cup is a historic event that has been around ever since the three schools of Earthbread were built. There‚Äôs the unique and prestigious school of wizards, Parfaedia, the school of noble Paladins with the most wins, the Cr√®me Knights, and the fiery school of warriors, Scovillia.

6.content: Cr√®me Knights refers to all cookies that attend, graduated from, or are the faculty of the Cr√®me Knights (also called the Paladin Academy.) They participate in the Triple Cone Cup along with the Parfaedia Institute.

7.content: Scovillia is a school located in the Dragon's Valley for Cookies with spice in their dough. This school is one of the three who participate in the Triple Cone Cup along with the Parfaedia Institute.

My attempt at making a full worldbook for the Monster Girl Encyclopaedia universe, I know I've left out a number of Mamono, and taken some, liberties with the lore, such as fleshing out the Holy Order a bit and using rocketstars name of Lilith for the Mamono Lord, but otherwise it's as faithful as I could make it to the source material.
Credit to Rocketstars massive collection of character cards and being the reason I started this, wanting the many Mamono descriptions in one Lorebook rather than multiple https://chub.ai/users/rocketstars, and knobby_network for his uncorrupted maiden's series, which is why there is a pre-fall and post-fall version of Lescatie in this worldbook https://chub.ai/users/knobby_network_4623.

1.name: History
1.content:
Many millennium ago, the world was created by the Chief Goddess. In actions, she created the other goddesses as well: Poseiden, the goddess of the ocean; Ares, the goddess of war and battle; Hel, the goddess of death; Eros, the goddess of love, and much more. Under her leadership, life began its creation. However, the Chief Goddess used much of her power that she left her subordinate to lead the world as she rested for an indefinite period of time. The only issue was that her subordinate was not qualified for the task.

Acting as the second Chief Goddess, she led her master's creations through peace, granting them blessings against the Mamono Lords of Old, powerful unholy demons spawned from darkness. Unfortunately, the Chief Goddess didn't foresee the new Mamono Lord, Lilith who changed everything about mamono. After a few hundred years, the Chief Goddess noticed that mamono have changed into something lewd and oddly promiscuous. Not waiting for any explanation, she sent her strongest warrior to kill off Lilith, but to her shock, her hero had succumb to pleasure and mated with Lilith, boosting Lilith's power greatly as Lilith also gained the blessings of the Chief Goddess as well. With no other choice, the Chief Goddess began a fierce duel with the two, eventually losing, forcing her to flee as Lilith and the fallen hero began their union of eternal lewd chaos.

After her defeat, the Chief Goddess became more irrational, condemning these new mamono and their lewd ways, causing Poseiden and the unnamed goddess to defect and allow themselves to be monsterized by Lilith. With this failure, heaven greatly suffered a huge loss as the Chief Goddess regained her strength and sought ways to defend humanity against this rapidly growing lewd threat.

2.name: Incubus
2.content:
An incubus is the male counterpart to a monster, and represents the eventual fate of (most) males exposed to high levels of mamono mana. If {{user}} is male, this is the result of having too much mamono mana within them. Unlike female monsterisation, where the physical and mental change from human to monster is rapid (in some cases taking only moments), for incubi the process is usually much more gradual and open-ended. Just as monster girls become more and more powerful the more sex they have, so do incubi, with increases to lustiness, physical attributes and lifespan.

Incubi are said to be "an ideal male to a female monster", therefore many monsters are eager for their mates to transform faster so they can enjoy the changes. Monsters with a lot of mamono mana at their disposal, like dark matters or khepri, are noted as being able to effect the change quickly, but the majority of monsters must just rely on lots and lots and lots of sex. Certain items which can expedite the transformation, like Succubus Nostrum, may be sought by eager wives.

Although the vast majority of information on incubi pertains to human men, elves can definitely become incubi [3] and there seems no reason that any of the few male dwarves left can't do so as well (or rather that they didn't already become incubi some time ago), as dwarf men are also considered a type of human.

The biggest changes of all occur in the functions that are also most important to monsters that get used during sex. It depends on the race and preferences of the monster that one is coupled with, but most men who become an incubus will have their penis grow larger by leaps and bounds, and they'll be able to please monsters even more. The amount of semen and spirit released from there will be incomparable to when they were human, and they'll have boundless stamina so that they're able to release it again and again without getting exhausted.

On first being attacked by a monster girl, humans are likely to be consumed by an instinctive fear and revulsion at their demonic appearance. Such atavistic terror and Order moral objections are thrown aside with the transition to an incubus: Their thoughts and values change, all becoming centered around having sex with monsters. Lust skyrockets to keep pace with the monsters' insatiable hunger for sex, and their interests in other things (like work and hobbies) can potentially change, as sexual activity becomes a more important part of their lives. There is a lot of variety though depending on the inner nature of the man, some incubi lead completely "normal" lives during the day, restricting sex to night and having it replace most of their sleep as it is just as energizing for them.

Incubization is a process that only affects men. Transformation into an incubus mainly occurs when a man continues to have sex with a monster, continuously receiving her mamono mana in his body. After becoming an incubus, their physical appearance hardly changes at all from when they were human; however, they gain vigor and lust like that of a monster, far exceeding that of a human. Their thoughts and values change, all becoming centered around having sex with monsters. Their body also gradually changes to become more suited to having sex with them. In addition to ordinarily eating food, just as the monsters sustain themselves on essence, the incubi become able to live by sustaining themselves on the monsters' mamono mana Through this, the lifespans of the incubi are also extended to match that of the monster whose mamono mana they use to sustain themselves. Furthermore, both the volume and quality of the essence produced inside their bodies increases by leaps and bounds. They are an extremely convenient existence for a monster. It's probably fair to say that they are the equivalent of male monsters.

By continuously having intercourse with a monster from the succubus family, a man can be transformed into an incubus comparatively far more quickly; however, even in the case of the other monsters, after spending a long period of time at her side as her husband and having frequent intercourse, a man will probably eventually change into an incubus even though the changes are very gradual. Among the monsters, there is a medicine made from the mamono mana of the succubus in circulation that is called ‚Äúsuccubus' nostrum.‚Äù Many monsters like having their husbands drink it in order to try to change them into an incubus more quickly. Also, the incubi possess the same kind of mamono mana inside their bodies as the monster who changed them into an incubus, and if they have sex with human women, the women will be transformed into monsters.

3.name: Royal Makai
3.content:
Lilith lives in Royal Makai, the domain of only the most powerful mamono, and the mamono mana is so intense there, that the monster girls are driven to new heights of power and lust, while the mana corruption will sap the humanity of even veteran human heroes.

As a dark mamono realm, Royal Makai has the usual black trees, glowing plants, and perpetual night that characterise other lands of its type. Despite its deleterious effects on humans, the place is extremely comfortable for monsters, and trade and tourism flourishes.

The royal mamono realm also features an extensive transportation system via teleportation magic circles linking the royal mamono realm with each major mamono realm.

The biggest attraction of Royal Makai is the Castle Town, the Mamono Lord's fortress. It sits at the center of Royal Makai; a vast and foreboding castle disproportionately filled with bedrooms. It is here that the Mamono Lord and her husband spend most of their time having sex, trying to build the power to break the original Chief God's settings. Around the fortress lies the Succubus Castle Town, the largest city in the world that covers half of the already massive continent. It's mostly a red light district, but also hosts the Royal Demon Art Museum and the headquarters of the Sabbath, a mamono cult based on loli worship. Rather than make the journey on foot, a lot of monsters visit the town via teleportation portals. Outside the Castle Town, Royal Makai also hosts a vast Tentacle Forest that drinks corrupted water or humans semen.

4.content:
Monsterization is the umbrella term for a whole host of different processes by which men, women, corpses, plants, animals, elements, gods and various inanimate objects are all transformed into beautiful and desire-filled monster girls.

Most people who get monsterized don't want to be monsterized, because the vast majority of people who undergo the process are female Order humans, and the Order teaches that anything that happens in relation to monsters (apart from zealous religious persecution) is bad. There are exceptions, of course; sorceresses may pursue witchdom or lichdom in their quest for magical power, and there are some heretical sects which hold monsterization in a positive light. Entire societies may even be centered around such beliefs without any coercion from the monsters. Still, in the majority of cases, monsterization is a process initially resisted by those subjected to it. On becoming a monster, the fear and loathing a woman felt towards her own transformation does not necessarily melt away immediately. Elves and valkyries are notoriously conflicted about acting on their new irresistible impulses. But regardless of whether they're happy about it or not, their newly ravishing body is gripped by a throbbing, needy lust for male company. "Women who‚Äôve only just become monsters still have their human values, but with the monstrous body that‚Äôs hot for men, and the intense feeling of hunger, the human mind can‚Äôt hold out. Driven by desire, they end up attacking human men". It's at this point that those who had someone they truly loved as a human make a beeline towards their "husband"; for those who didn't, the first man they spot who suits their interests is likely to be attacked for their first meal of essence. Such sudden encounters inevitably blossom into true love thanks to the keen senses monsters have for compatibility.

These creatures have protective fur over parts of their bodies, as lesser succubi have a monster's sensitivity but haven't yet acquired the monster's tolerance to supercharged pleasure; being groped too vigorously during semi-transformed sex is a sure-fire way to make them ahegao themselves unconscious. Lesser succubi must then rape their way to enough essence to complete the transformation, and become a fully-fledged succubus.

There are changes under the skin for an incubus too. Stamina increases to monster-like levels as the power of mamono mana suffuses their body, and incubi gain some measure of the environmental resilience of their monster partner (e.g. heat resistance for a lava golem's mate, breathing underwater for a Sea Bishop's mate, night vision for the mates of nocturnal or cave-dwelling monsters. An exception to the lack of drastic changes are the husbands of the various chaos/abyss-aligned monsters (such as atlach-nacha and mindflayer), which gain the ability to change into completely non-human or only vaguely humanoid forms.
