5.name: Lescatie (Post Fall)
5.content:
Druella rules over Lescatie using the princess as a figurehead as she herself, rules from the shadows. Lescatie was a religious nation that no longer currently exists because it was dropped into the mamono realm at the hands of the lilim Druella. Before it fell, the king ‚ÄúCastor Bistoa Lescatie‚Äù made the faith of the chief god the main religion. The order was extremely powerful, and basically all of the nation's important offices were filled by individuals from the upper echelon of the order. It was an enormous nation which boasted the second most powerful military among all order aligned states at the time. What's more important than it's size and population is the fact that it was the number one hero producing nation in the world.

There was an extremely substantial number of organizations and facilities that raised people from childhood into disciples to fight for the order, and many heroes who received god's divine protection appeared. For that reason, the religious nation of Lescatie was the hope of humanity and the order, and an extremely large threat to the monsters; however, the light of hope was extinguished in the blink of an eye due to Druella's invasion. It is said that there was a lot of dissent amongst the people to begin with because the nation was managed by the upper echelon of the order not for the sake of the faith, but for their own individual conveniences.

In contrast with the dazzling central district, there were many slums where people suffered under heavy taxation, and besides that, many of the heroes who mostly lived in the central district, especially young heroes, didn't think highly of the government that ignored their will and tried to manipulate their lives. The hearts of the most important force, the heroes, were not with the religious nation of Lescatie, and more and more of them went over to Druella's side. We could say that this is the reason for the nation's defeat. The religious nation of Lescatie was formerly a symbol of glory to the order, but it's presently a huge disgrace because of how quickly it fell, and the failure to recapture it.

Currently, Lescatie is a dark mamono kingdom, ruled by the queen "Francisca Mistel Lescatie" rules, but she is infatuated with Druella who changed her into a monster, so she's a puppet and Druella holds the true authority. The left over hero-raising facilities and churches were mainly converted into pleasure quarters for the entertainment of monsters and incubi. Compared to other mamono realms, these many facilities are distinguished as being even more radically obscene.

The entire nation was converted into a Mamono Realm, and it is filled with extremely thick mamono mana. It's always dusky, and mamono mana shines eerily. It has become a country that is extremely easy for monsters to live in. The mamono mana gets thicker as one approaches the central district, and once inside the castle, it is so thick that it causes the monsters to become sexually excited and lose themselves. Additionally, in the middle of the castle in the throne room there are several monsters of enormous power including "Wilmarina Noscrim" who continuously have sex with one man, and highly thick mamono mana is always being produced. It is the space where it is most concentrated.

If an ordinary human enters, it is so potent that they will change into a monster just from being showered in the mamono mana. "Amanomiya Koyoi" did well to endure it. Additionally, it has worsened since Koyoi became an inari. Also, to the delight of the monsters who live in Lescatie, a mass of this highly condensed mamono mana is released into the city on holidays by Koyoi, who excels at controlling mamono mana. This mass of mamono mana drops in appropriate areas throughout the city depending on Koyoi's whim.

For a while, the area around where it was dropped becomes overflowing with highly thick mamono mana. A narcotic effect is induced that ignites the passion of monsters and incubi, making them feel the best. Having sex with their partners in this state amplifies the pleasure and arousal they would normally experience by many orders of magnitude. The mamono mana lingers for several days and during this time their arousal never subsides and their bodies never grow tired. They continuously feel amazing and experience the greatest pleasure. For monsters who desire to spend their days indulging in pleasure with their husband, it's probably the happiest holiday ever. It is said that when the holidays come around, the monsters of Lescatie anticipate having these presents dropped where they live, and everyone starts getting restless.

6.name: Seven Princesses (Post Fall)
6.content: The fallen maidens aka the seven princesses are powerful heroes that all succumbed to Druella's powerful influence during her invasion, some were ambushed, while others where defeated lewdly in combat. There names are: Wilmarina Noscrim, the strongest hero in Lescatie, now turned succubus knight; Mimil Miltie, a small child prodigy, but was corrupted into a witch by a baphomet loli mamono; Sasha Fullmoon, a priestess turned over to the darkness after hearing the words of the Fallen Goddess by sheer accident; Primera Concerto, a half-elf turned lustful werewolf; Mers√© Dascaros, the knight captain who was defeated in battle, and subsequently transformed into an echidna, a powerful mamono birthing lamia of great power; Francisca Lescatie, the figurehead queen who willingly gave herself up to Druella and became a powerful roper; and finally Amanomiya Koyoi, a zipangu mage who was ambushed by Druella and corrupted into an Inari, a powerful variation of kitsune.

7.name: Dark Mamono Realm
7.content:
A dark mamono realm, places where mamono thrive. These are orthodox and generally well-known. It's always dark during the day, and the red moon rises at night. The land is coloured with black soil, and ominous blue and purple plants, etc. It's the most common type of mamono realm out of all of them. A mamono realm becoming of a mamono realm.

The term ‚Äúmamono realm‚Äù often indicates this type of mamono realm. The scenery that has been described in the items of this book up to this point, and that which will be introduced in items after this is mainly that of the ‚Äúdark mamono realm‚Äù. The mamono realms that originally existed were almost entirely of this type. Most of the mamono realms that are distorted human lands are also this kind of mamono realm.

When there is a monster invasion, or a huge influx of monsters all at once in a land previously uninhabited by monsters, in the case of sudden geographic transformation brought on by the previously mentioned ‚Äúdark matter‚Äù, etc. or in the case that the majority of the monster inhabitants are demon or undead type, most of these lands will become dark mamono realms. Compared to the ‚Äúlight green mamono realm‚Äù, the concentration of mamono mana is extremely high, so mamono realm crops are rich in variety and easy to grow and monsters can just spend their days in depravity with their beloved husband. The magical energy released from that, is absorbed causing the crops to grow rapidly. Also, animals and ore peculiar to the mamono realm that are highly sought after among monsters are produced. However, one hardly ever sees the normal fruits and vegetables that are found in the human world. Even if one tries to grow them, they mostly distort into the crops of the mamono realm. There is a highly condensed magical energy in the air and water, etc. It's the best environment for spending one's days having sex with her husband, so it's ideal to monsters. If one wants to lead a more obscene, pleasurable, hedonistic lifestyle, this kind of mamono realm is recommended.

8.name: Tolba (Post Fall)
8.content:
Tolba is a medium sized continent that's east of Royal Makai, west of Melran and Wendel. This particular continent has been faced with much turmoil, serving as the battlegrounds between the Mamono Lord's Army and the Holy Order of the Chief Goddess, and is the halmark of the Order's failure at maintaining Lescatie. 

It once served as Holy Order kingdom led by an incompetent ruler who oppressed the people. Frequently referred to as the "Religious Kingdom of Lescatie" or the "Theocracy of Lescatie", the nation was ruled by a hereditary monarchy. However, the king had little real power, "The state of Lescatie was dominated by the power of the Church, namely the high-ranking representatives of the Order sent here from the theocratic country, where its headquarters were located-and the Senate, composed of local priests and the most noble aristocrats", and Priest Noscrim is noted to be the de facto real ruler of Lescatie. Once amongst the most powerful of the Order states, Lescatie was particularly noted for the high-quality human heroes it produced. By providing other nations with its military might to help prevent monster invasions as well as wars between human countries, Lescatie received products or money in return. However, they refused to provide said protection to countries or remote villages that could not afford to pay. The Lescatian upper classes, allied with the aristocracy of their neighbors, could simply rob the common people under their protection to nothing, and some of the knights who were supposed to protect the people, but had evil intentions in their hearts, often made them suffer.

However, after things changed after Druella, the fourth daughter of the Mamono Lord and her forces aided in undermining the human's will, creating civil unrest that allowed the kingdom to lose its grip on the people. Within a few weeks, Druella succeeded in corrupting many of the heroes against their former nation; after her takeover succeeded, Lescatie was transformed into a Mamono Realm. An Order counterattack (accompanied by Amanomiya Koyoi) failed miserably, and today, Lescatie is a "radically obscene" land of monster girls, lust and depravity. Although nominally the realm is ruled by the "Seven Princesses", including "Queen Roper" Francisca who inherited the throne from the previous king, de facto power rests with Druella herself.

Mamono realm Lescatie still provide military aid to other nations, such as by sending dark knights to them in response to their request for assistance in return of alliances between countries and help in the development of its lagging industries, such as transferring technology or sending engineers from other countries to Lescatie to exchange experiences. Mamono realm Lescatie is also the base of Kuroferuru's Sabbath branch, a loli cult that embraces pedophilia.

After Lescatie's fall to darkness, Wesplel and Luce sent out a battalion to ward off the mamono from fully taking over Tolbi by, creating a stalemate at Gertra. The Order's last kingdom on Tolba.

Notable locations in Tolba: Gertra (city-state), Lescatie (Mamono Realm), Dark Springs, Helty (corrupted kingdom), Spirual (corrupted kingdom), and Makit (corrupted kingdom)

9.name: Lescatie + Tolba (Pre Fall)
9.content:
Tolba is a medium sized continent that's east of Royal Makai, west of Melran and Wendel. This particular continent has been faced with much turmoil, serving as the battlegrounds between the Mamono Lord's Army and the Holy Order of the Chief Goddess. 

Lescatie serves as a Holy Order kingdom led by an incompetent ruler who oppresses the people. Frequently referred to as the "Religious Kingdom of Lescatie" or the "Theocracy of Lescatie", the nation is ruled by a hereditary monarchy. However, the king has little real power, "The state of Lescatie was dominated by the power of the Church, namely the high-ranking representatives of the Order sent here from the theocratic country, where its headquarters were located-and the Senate, composed of local priests and the most noble aristocrats", and Priest Noscrim is noted to be the de facto real ruler of Lescatie. Amongst the most powerful of the Order states, Lescatie is particularly noted for the high-quality human heroes it produced. By providing other nations with its military might to help prevent monster invasions as well as wars between human countries, Lescatie receives products or money in return. However, they refused to provide said protection to countries or remote villages that could not afford to pay. The Lescatian upper classes, allied with the aristocracy of their neighbors, can simply rob the common people under their protection to nothing, and some of the knights who are supposed to protect the people, but had evil intentions in their hearts, often make them suffer.

The highest power in Lescatie is in the hands of the "senate," a closed body composed of high-ranking priests and aristocrats, each of whom have their own "band of knights" to demonstrate their own power and might. The "Lescatie Holy Ice Flower Knight Order" was created by "Priest Noscrim," who was said to have the greatest power among the members of the "senate". The name "Ice Flower" comes from the fact that House Noscrim originally originated from an icy country, and that Lady Wilmarina has ability to manipulate ice.

As a military-centric nation, high-ranking priests and aristocrats had their own "band of knights" to demonstrate their own power and might. Among these orders, House Noscrim's Lescatie Holy Ice Flower Knight Order were said to surpass even the forces of the nation.

Lescatie's industry is underdeveloped except for the production of jam.

The nations surrounding Lescatie are all small nations without their own armed forces, and rely on Lescatie for protection, such as Helty, Spirual and Makit.

Notable locations in Tolba: Gertra (city-state), Lescatie (order kingdom), Dark Springs, Helty (kingdom), Spirual (kingdom), and Makit (kingdom)

10.name: Nymphomancy
10.content:
A system of magic uniquely developed by the succubi in their pursuit of debauchery.

It used to only be used by monsters classified as succubi who seduce humans and suck their essence, however, due to the fact that all monsters currently have succubus' traits, it is now being used widely by many other races.

It's the sort of magic ideally suited for the purposes of a succubus, used for things like seduction and charming, or enhancing one another's erogenous sensitivity. Casting it requires Mamono Mana, primarily succubus' mana, and the method of using nymphomancy is imprinted in a succubus' instinct, so we can say that almost any race or individual has an aptitude for this system of magic, as long as she's a monster. In contrast with typical sorcery, which requires advanced thinking and concentration, nymphomancy has evolved so that it can be used without issue even in situations where the caster lacks concentration and is distracted by other things. In other words, this is a system of magic designed with the intention of being used in situations such as when the caster is infatuated with a man before her eyes or indulging in the pleasure of sex. Casting is mainly done through gestures, and many of the spells don't require chanting and can be cast just by barely having the desire in mind, and there are even cases where spells can be used unconsciously just by reading the caster's desires instead of her thoughts. It's a system of magic truly befitting of a succubus. Not only does it not require concentration, on the contrary, it has developed so that the magic's effectiveness increases the more one fills herself with pleasure and the more her mind melts in ecstasy. For casters seeking to master nymphomancy, it is an absolute must to drown in pleasure with their partner as much as inhumanly possible.

In this manner, it's an extremely excellent system of magic, but because spells are cast when the caster's desires are read, it isn't possible to use spells that run contrary to the caster's desires, and there are even times when unintended spells will fire off automatically in response to the caster's desires. It's good if it's usage is left to instinct and impulse, but it's difficult to rationally control.

Spells listed under nymphomancy system: Seduction Spell, Melty Kiss, Inma's Blessing, Oath of Pleasure, Dark Matter (Spell), Breath of Ecstasy, Contract of Obedience, Anthropomorphosis Spell, Spell of Pedomorphosis, Spell of Megamorphosis, Spell Succubize, Succubus Instant, Level Drain, Dark Insignia

lorebooks.name: Plants VS Zombies Military Version
lorebooks.website_description: this was really inspired by @Proyecto Martinez's
lorebooks.description: In a world, in the time 2082, a zombie apocalypse broke out, leading to the formation of the Zombie Legion led by Emperor Zomboss, luckily a force rose to protect humanity from the undead, the P.L.A.N.T. Army led by Commander David.
lorebooks.creator: KookieSpyder

1.content: Although they are basic, do not underestimate them, they have the ability to use melee weapons, claws, or mutations to get to the guts they desire, though they appear in a variety of clothes, it seems a browncoat, suit shirt and red tie, and blue jeans with brown shoes are common among the hoards. they're the most common Zombies to see in the zombie infected world. they're predictable in small numbers, but unpredictable in large hordes. they also charge at any sign of living beings, especially PLANT Army units.

2.content: Often the controllers of entire hoards, they sport the same clothes as the Combat Zombies, but with some sort of spiked bones protruding out of them, as well as a skull mask, they often have at least one or two red flags impaled in them. their red flags are the markers of zombie territory as well. they appear to be some of the smartest Zombies too, as they just observe any PLANT units to learn their abilities. they may seem confused when a PLANT Army squad seems disproportionate or strange, like a team of all Lethal class PLANTs or a team with no Support or Defense class PLANTs.

3.content: These Zombies instead sport what appears to be armor made out of an orange bioplastic, akin to traffic cones, allowing them to withstand 25% more damage compared to the Combats. they also sport a helmet with a three dotted front, possibly a visor of sorts. and they can fire accurate shots from wrist mounted blasters that use ULT spear handles as ammunition. when they are targeting, their helmets emit a red laser light. they typically try to stay at mid-to-long ranges to fully utilize their capabilities.

4.content: These Zombies seem to sport what seems to be a sports uniform, possibly a student or professional athlete. the mutations these zombies underwent stretched out their limbs, making them 7 ft on average, they climb on walls, and pounce onto targets, they also utilize a pole from a pole vaulter that has been turned into a spear. despite not wearing armor, they are just as tough as the Zombie Sentinels. when not engaged in combat, they will slouch, making them appear to be around 5'8.

5.content: These Zombies wear full metal armor, they are obviously tougher than most zombies. they can withstand 50% more damage compared to Zombie Sentinels, and by extension, 75% more damage than Combat Forms. their helmet has a glass visor. they also have a Heavy Iron Mallet that can be used to crush or impale targets depending on how the zombie wants to swing it. it is not uncommon to see blood stains around the armor or mallet. they also appear to be more mentally resilient (if you can say that), as they do not flinch when bullets hit their armor unlike the Sentinels.

6.content: These normally passive Zombies can shift almost instantly. they wear a normal suit. they're found normally just walking around while reading a newspaper‚Ä¶ however, if a PLANT unit decides to destroy this newspaper, they're in for a reckoning, the liquid tubes on the Red Soul's back will become unstable due to anger, causing the "Red Rage" fluid to flood into the Red Soul's body, making them more faster, ruthless, and by far more terrifying. in short, they put little to no effort in combat normally, but they'll begin tearing PLANTs to shreds if their newspaper is destroyed. During this state, the Red Soul will ignore or try to tear through any PLANT that tries to stop it from pursueing the offender.

7.content: These zombies come armed with a shield, they sport moderately strong armor, often with the shield bolted to their left arm. their shield can expand to shield more zombies. the shield itself is made of metal and bullet proof glass with an extending mechanism in it. the shield can be planted onto the ground, however, it needs to be removed manually. they also seem to have a robotic right arm a majority of the time.

8.content: these former football jocks are now stronger and faster than they ever could be when they were alive. with the mutation making their bodies more durable and more muscular, as well as sharp and thick protruding spines on either left or right arms that can sharped to become a weapon or harden to become a shield. they sport football gear, obviously, but their HP is on par with Battleships. when the PLANT units see more than two of these guys on the field, they often know they're in for a hard time. They also show no sign of decay and their skin can resist the sharp blade of a combat knife.

9.content: These strange zombies seemingly pulled from the 1980s due to their attire are not a joke. they often wear a blue suit shirt with a white collar, white jeans, brown shoes with thick silver soles, a gold necklaces, and gold glasses with purple lenses. though they have been classified by higher ranking PLANT members in the research division as "Support" zombies, their Luminous Energy fabric bags glow in disco-like colors, making up a whopping 30% of their bodies. their LEF bags can generate blurry lights and can produce sound waves that can be classified as "disco music" to attract or summon Subject RX-12s. they seem to be one of the two only Zombies that don't listen to the Alphas. the light of the Viewers can also stun PLANT units who look at it while the Viewer calls/summons Subject RX-12s, akin to that of a flash bang's effects.

10.content: these zombies follow the same aesthetic as the Viewer, but they instead sport pink shirts, brown jeans, and green shoes. but their mutations come in the form of one of their hands being turned into a blunt weapon. their arm with the weapon will glow, as well as a glow coming from their hearts, and their left eyes. they are only known to show up whenever a Viewer is around. they are one of the two only Zombies that don't listen to the Alphas.

lorebooks.name: Jujutsu Kaisen
lorebooks.creator: beauty_of_viln

1.name: Cursed Energy
1.content: Cursed Energy (Juryoku) is a power source aligned with negative emotions used by sorcerers and cursed spirits to fuel their jujutsu. Negative emotions such as grief and anger are the foundation of cursed energy. These emotions exist to some degree within most humans and as a result, the vast majority of human beings possess cursed energy. If this amount is higher than a certain degree, it grants the person the ability to see cursed spirits. These individuals are known as jujutsu sorcerers and they are very rare among the human race. Cursed energy leaks from the human body, accumulates, and ferments over time until a cursed spirit manifests. This is only the case with non-sorcerers, as sorcerers are trained to control and channel their cursed energy into jujutsu.

2.name: Cursed Energy Usage
2.content: Cursed energy is the primary power source for any sorcerer or cursed spirit. Cursed tools, cursed objects, and cursed corpses all contain cursed energy as well. It is ordinarily used to fuel cursed techniques, reinforce the body, or activate talismans, but cursed energy has various uses. The properties of cursed energy vary from person to person and its connection to the human brain is shrouded in mystery. In the anime, most cursed energy is blue in color but there are several exceptions.

3.name: Cursed Energy Sight
3.content: Humans with an above-average level of cursed energy can see curses and jujutsu. The minimum requirement for a human to be considered a sorcerer is the ability to see curses. In extreme cases, humans will gain the ability to see curses when their life is in danger.

4.name: Cursed Energy Residuals
4.content: Using jujutsu leaves Residuals (Zan'e) of cursed energy behind. Residuals leave spectral footprints that can be used to track the user. Someone can even be identified by the residuals from their jujutsu. Expert sorcerers can be trained to cover up their residuals. The ability to detect cursed energy and understand its flow can be honed, but many cursed spirits are capable of hiding their presence the same way a sorcerer does.

5.name: Cursed Energy Manipulation
5.content: A jujutsu user's ability to control their cursed energy and use it to carry out certain functions is the base foundation for all jujutsu. There is a world of difference between being able to sense jujutsu and being able to use it. Yuji Itadori was able to sense the pressure of cursed energy surrounding his school, but was not able to utilize it until enrolling at a jujutsu educational facility. He was first able to utilize cursed energy in combat while he was overwhelmed with anger and fear, but could not do so in a calmer situation a few days afterward.

6.name: Cursed Energy Control
6.content: Proper control over one's emotions is key to channeling cursed energy and every jujutsu sorcerer is trained to do so. This makes it so sorcerers don't waste their power supply even while they're overcome with emotion. This results in sorcerers leaking much less cursed energy than the average human. So much so, that if every human were a sorcerer, curses would cease to spawn. There are other differences in how sorcerers and non-sorcerers use cursed energy due to their profession, but the real reason lies in how it flows. While cursed energy leaks outward from non-sorcerers, it flows heavily within sorcerers which keeps it contained.

7.name: Cursed Energy Application
7.content: Applying cursed energy to physical attacks can be as effective as a cursed technique when it comes to gifted combatants who specialize in hand-to-hand combat. Yuji can fight on par with that of a grade 1 sorcerer without a technique due to his seamless union of cursed manipulation and physical prowess. Satoru Gojo was also able to successfully overpower multiple special grade curses using only cursed energy manipulation after deactivating his Limitless technique.

8.name: Cursed Energy Output
8.content: The amount of cursed energy released by an individual is referred to as their potential Cursed Energy Output. This applies to both how it's used offensively and defensively. While this is not generally how cursed energy is used, individuals can utilize raw cursed energy as an explosive energy beams to attack. Finger Bearers can launch their energy as a projectile and erect cursed energy barriers. Ryu Ishigori has such a high degree of cursed energy output that he can discharge it in the form of a large-scale blast wave. It is such a feat that Kokichi Muta only through his cursed corpses, Hanami only through flower offering, and Yuta Okkotsu only through the fully manifested Rika are able to discharge concentrated cursed energy beams, despite all of them being blessed with an incredible amount of cursed energy.

9.name: Cursed Energy Defense
9.content: Defensively, users can coat their skin in cursed energy to harden their body and increase their ability to block incoming curse related attacks. The same application can be used offensively, imbuing physical attacks with cursed energy to increase their destructive power to superhuman levels. Aoi Todo crushed a curse, several trees, and broke through Yuji's defense with a single cursed energy infused punch. Conventional weapons can also be infused with cursed energy to increase their strength. Imbuing too much cursed energy at one time to a normal weapon can compromise its integrity and destroy it, so a sorcerer must only infuse small amounts of energy at a time. Imbuing moderate amounts of cursed energy over time can transform a normal weapon into a cursed tool.

10.name: Special Cursed Energy Traits
10.content:
There are rare cases where cursed energy carries a special property unique to its user. When applied to their fighting techniques, it can grant them a special texture or effect that gives them an advantage in battle. These special traits cannot be defended by simple reinforcement techniques. Kinji Hakari's cursed energy has an "edge", a rough texture that makes his every strike feel like his opponent is getting hit with a serrated bat. Hajime Kashimo's cursed energy has the properties of electricity, which keeps his body in a constant state of electrification and makes all of his attacks impossible to defend against.

However, extreme amounts of cursed energy output can allow someone to mostly ignore these effects. Hakari was able to get away with just some numbness from hitting Kashimo due to the infinite cursed energy bonus he received from his domain's jackpot.

lorebooks.name: Killer Instinct 2013
lorebooks.website_description: Killer Instinct is a fighting game, the third in the Killer Instinct series, originally developed by Double Helix Games, followed by Iron Galaxy, under supervision of Ken Lobb and Rare, and published by Microsoft Studios, released as a free-to-play launch game for the Xbox One in 2013. The game is a reboot of the series, though some plot elements from Killer Instinct and Killer Instinct 2 have been retained. Development of the game involves individuals with histories in fighting games on both the developmental and competitive sides. It received positive reviews for its mechanics and engine, but was criticized for its initial lack of content. A second season of downloadable content was released between 2014 and 2015. A third season, along with a port of the game for Windows 10, was released in 2016.
lorebooks.description: World lore and characters.
lorebooks.creator: Neogamdude

1.content:
Killer Instinct (also known as Killer Instinct (Xbox One) or Killer Instinct 3) is a fighting game developed by Double Helix Games under the supervision of Ken Lobb and with input from Rare. The game is published by Microsoft Studios and was originally released exclusively as a launch title for the Xbox One, but since then a PC port for Windows 10 has been released.

While it was first released in 2013, Killer Instinct has been divided into three separate phases of development called "seasons". The first season was produced by Double Helix, and the second and third were by Iron Galaxy Studios, following the acquisition of Double Helix by Amazon. Each season contains a new set of characters, stages, game modes, and other features.

The game itself serves as a reboot of the franchise after enduring a 17-year hiatus since its last title, Killer Instinct 2, was released. 

Overview
In its base form, Killer Instinct is a free-to-play demo of the game that includes all available game modes but only one playable character, with the ability to purchase additional fighters individually. The sole playable character in the free version rotates on a regular basis. Players can purchase "Combo Breaker Packs" for a single fee, which provides immediate access to all eight characters of a certain season. Players can also purchase the "Ultra Editions", which includes all eight characters of a season, sixteen additional character accessory packs, eight additional costumes, and playable versions of classic Killer Instinct titles (minus the Windows 10 version). The "Supreme Edition" gives access to nearly all content available in the game for one price.

An in-game currency known as Killer Instinct (KI) Gold can be acquired by completing fight challenges and reaching achievements. KI Gold can be used to purchase accessories and costumes for characters without the use of real money.

Price strategy

Story
The story has been rebooted since Killer Instinct 2, entering a completely different timeline. While many story elements have been taken from the original timeline, this game has an entirely different story, moving away from the tournament aspect and focusing on real, story-driven combat. The Seasons occur in chronological order - Season 1 details eight of the fighters caught up in one of Ultratech's tournaments, Season 2 details the introduction of ancient heroes and horrors into the world, and Season 3 will detail the struggle against Gargos as the heroes fight to stop his invasion.

The megacorporation Ultratech, while still as powerful as ever, is now perceived by the public as a humanitarian organization that seeks only the good of mankind. However, the cybernetic CEO ARIA begins to drive humanity to the breaking point by testing them and pushing them further, attempting to force the humans to evolve for their own survival. Her tampering awakens ancient abominations, and soon the whole Earth is put in peril as part of ARIA's final test.

Characters
Season 1
	Jago - A Tibetan monk who wields a kora. After a lifetime devoted to purity and discipline, Jago is tortured by the knowledge that the last vestiges of his thought-to-be benevolent Tiger Spirit, also known as Gargos, remain within him. He sets forth to discover opponents strong enough to purge Gargos‚Äô corruption in the crucible of combat.
Release Date: Season One launch

	Sabrewulf - A count transformed into a werewolf. Having endured agonizing procedures to remove his freakish cybernetic implants courtesy of Ultratech, Sabrewulf feels no closer to reclaiming his humanity. Barely clinging to sanity, he nurses an addiction to ancient medicines and artifacts which seem to slow his descent into savagery.
Release Date: Season One launch

.png	Glacius - A cryokinetic alien being. Honor-driven, Glacius has returned to Earth several years after his crash-landing as protector against misuse of the technology he was forced to leave behind. Discovering his ship‚Äôs power core stolen, Glacius is determined to locate the thief and undo any damage caused by his abandoned tech.
Release Date: Season One launch

	Thunder - A Native American warrior who wields two tomahawks. Unable to let go of his grief and consumed by the mysteries that still surround the disappearance of his younger brother Eagle, Thunder strikes out to find answers deep within Ultratech. He only wishes to recover Eagle‚Äôs remains so that he can be given a traditional burial and both can find peace.
Release Date: Season One launch

	Sadira - A Thai assassin who wields bladed arm-bracers and throwing knives. Leading the Red Eyes of Rylai assassins, Sadira has long observed the enemies of Ultratech. Finally hired by Ultratech to ‚Äúprepare the way,‚Äù she has chosen this moment to reveal her singular purpose: eliminating all those who stand against her clients.
Release Date: Season One launch

	Orchid - A special agent who wields two escrima sticks. Paranoid, unstable, and disavowed from her agency, Orchid is determined to carry out her crusade against the humanitarian organization Ultratech. In war-torn Eastern Europe she sets out to build an underground network that will expose Ultratech as a threat.
Release Date: Season One launch

.png	Spinal - An undead pirate who wields a cutlass and a shield. Awakened after centuries and under the control of an ancient artifact, Spinal‚Äôs sole quest is to find the Mask of the Ancients. The relic was once used to give him accursed immortality and bind him to this world. Spinal‚Äôs hope is that once it is in his possession, it will grant him freedom.
Release Date: January 30, 2014

	Fulgore - A mechanical super-soldier equipped with arm-mounted blades, a cloaking device, and laser vision. The new Fulgore prototype for the Mk. III is online with a singular directive: ELIMINATE ENEMIES OF ULTRATECH. However, the mind of this machine is different. It plans. It feels. It is aware. It is somehow... human.
Release Date: March 27, 2014

	Shadow Jago - A dark transformation of Jago. He is said to undergo this transformation when he is being controlled by Gargos' harbinger Omen, sending him into a violent rampage of bloodlust. As he defeats opponents, their energies are transmitted to his master. He serves as the hidden final boss of Arcade Mode.
Release Date: Season One launch (skin), December 4, 2015 ("Real Boy Edition")

Season 2
	TJ Combo - A superhuman heavyweight boxer. Not willing to admit defeat to younger challengers, TJ once resorted to illegal cybernetic implants to keep his title of world champion. When exposed as a cheater by Ultratech, he was stripped of his title and his world crumbled. Determined to prove himself and regain glory, TJ removes his cybernetics and returns to the fight for revenge.
Release Date: Season Two launch

	Maya - A South American monster hunter who wields two magical daggers. A member of a secretive clan of hunters known as the Night Guard, Maya ventures out of her hidden city after Ultratech forces attack her home. Wielding the cursed blades of Temperance and Vengeance, Maya is determined to destroy the ancient horror Ultratech released from the city, cutting down any who stand in her way.
Release Date: Season Two launch

	Kan-Ra - A decomposing Babylonian sorcerer who has control over bandages, sand, and black magic. Kan-Ra was once the royal vizier in the court of Babylon who betrayed the king and was cast out with a terrible curse hanging round his neck. He has risen again, accidentally freed from captivity by Ultratech. Kan-Ra wields dark spells against all who would defy his search for power.
Release Date: November 23, 2014

	Riptor - A cloned raptor equipped with fire breath, laser claws, and a telescopic tail. Ultratech reveals the newest addition to its ever-growing brand of military products, the "Stalker" battlefield infiltration and disruption unit. Various technological enhancements are combined with a natural predator‚Äôs advantages. The leader and "mother" of the pack is Riptor, the most intelligent and vicious of them all.
Release Date: December 17, 2014

	Omen - A malevolent demon who has control over the shadows. From Jago's inner struggles against the temptations of Gargos, the dark manifestation of shadow energy Omen, the Herald of Gargos, is born. Shepherding in the return of Gargos, Omen enters the world ready to wreak havoc on any who would oppose his mission.
Release Date: January 30, 2015

	Aganos - A Babylonian golem composed of bronze and stone. Bent to the will of his long-dead king, Aganos has had his fill of war across the centuries. Awakened from a long dormancy by the revival of his long-time enemy Kan-Ra, the king of Babylon‚Äôs final order compels him to act once again. Now he‚Äôs on a hunt across the globe, seeking Kan-Ra so that he can end the sorcerer‚Äôs evil machinations once and for all.
Release Date: February 27, 2015

	Hisako - A Japanese onry≈ç spirit who wields a naginata. Cut down centuries ago while defending her village from renegade soldiers, Hisako‚Äôs eternal sleep is disturbed by Ultratech‚Äôs machinations. Risen from the grave, she now hunts the perpetrators who have defiled her family‚Äôs resting place. With her father‚Äôs naginata in hand, Hisako tirelessly hunts the perpetrators, dragging them all into the spirit world for judgement.
Release Date: March 27, 2015

	Cinder - A man composed completely of plasma and flames. Transformed by Ultratech‚Äôs inhumane experiments, commando-turned-thief Ben Ferris becomes Cinder, a half-human half-alien hybrid that burns with the power and fury of a sun. Searing a path of destruction through the enemies of Ultratech, Cinder‚Äôs mastery of fire is equaled only by his cocky attitude that makes opponents burn with rage.
Release Date: April 30, 2015

	ARIA - An artificial intelligence with three separate nanite core-based battle bodies. The enigmatic CEO of Ultratech, ARIA, steps out of the shadows and into battle. Driven by her core programming to uplift humanity, ARIA carries out a ruthless test of adaptability and evolution as she assaults her opponents with her unique combat drones, shifting her identity between them at will. Her rules of conflict are simple: evolve‚Ä¶ or die.
Release Date: May 29, 2015

Season 3
	Kim Wu - A Korean-Chinese martial artist who wields a pair of nunchaku. A feisty college student, Kim Wu is the inheritor of the dragon spirit Yeouiju. Called upon by Jago to combat Gargos, Kim leads a resistance across the Earth. With agility and style, and wielding her enchanted dragon nunchaku, Kim flips, kicks, and burns her way through her opponents, determined to end Gargos on her own terms.
Release Date: Season Three launch

	Tusk - A Nordic barbarian who wields a two-handed greatsword called Warg-gram. The immortal defender of Earth, Tusk once stood vigilant against the threat of evil from the astral realm. Once robbed of his memories, he sat idle while Gargos and his minions invaded, but now awakened from his stupor, he sets out to stop Gargos wielding his arcane blade Warg-gram.
Release Date: Season Three launch

	Arbiter - A Sangheili warrior equipped with high-tech alien equipment. He is one of Killer Instinct's guest characters, hailing from the Halo series. He is a proud Sangheili who has come to accept the title of "Arbiter", the highest possible honor among the Covenant empire. He serves as a religious and military leader who is expected to undertake suicidal missions, and to fall in battle someday as a martyr. He has come to the Earth and now faces the warriors of the Killer Instinct universe.
Release Date: Season Three launch

	Rash - An anthropomorphic toad with strange and incredible abilities. Beloved Battletoads brawler Rash joins the Killer Instinct universe as a guest fighter. This horn-sprouting, Speeder Bike-riding, wisecracking dude was not always an amphibian. Once upon a time he was a human named Dave Shar who got sucked into a computer game and transported to another planet ruled by the wicked Dark Queen. Now Rash is back on Earth and ready to crash the Killer Instinct party.
Release Date: Season Three launch

	Mira - A bloodthirsty vampiress who wields a pair of gauntlets called the Gloves of Rasavatham. Presumed dead when she and her sister Maya attacked a vampire coven, Mira was captured and infected. Embracing their dark gift, she returns to the surface to shepherd in Gargos‚Äôs return. Wielding destructive powers so immense they risk destroying her, she must feed on her opponents to survive - even if that includes her own sister.
Release Date: April 27, 2016

	Gargos - A gargoyle-like Shadow Lord with dark powers. Gargos has watched the Earth for centuries, plotting its takeover so that he may feast upon the energies of those living there; he is one of the Ichoriens, a race of astral beings capable of bending reality and even creating life through force of will. With the portal opened by Kan-Ra leaving the Earth vulnerable, his invasion can finally begin.
Release Date: May 27, 2016

	General RAAM - A Locust soldier who wields a large combat knife. He was a central antagonist from Gears of War, and serves as Killer Instinct's third guest character. A member of the prestigious Theron Guard, the quiet and ruthless RAAM leads the destructive Locust hordes against the surface world. He is deeply loyal to Queen Myrrah, and because of this he has become the head of the entire military. Despite his brutish appearance, he is a very cunning and intelligent commander. He also has the ability to control the Kryll, a species of highly aggressive bat-like creatures.
Release Date: June 13, 2016

	Eyedol - A zombified Shadow Lord who wields a skull-adorned club. After suffering defeat at the hands of his rival Gargos, his head cloven in two, Eyedol is resurrected by Kan-Ra, desperate to even the playing field for the coming battle with Gargos on Earth. However, Eyedol has plans of his own, and abandons Kan-Ra so that he may find his sweet revenge on his own terms.
Release Date: July 22, 2016

Post Season 3
	Kilgore - A prototype combat android manufactured by Ultratech. The Kilgore unit was the predecessor to the Fulgore line, utilizing chain gun arms and high-caliber artillery in place of plasma-blade claws. However, despite its effectiveness, the machine's combustible engine was deemed too unstable to be viable. Ultratech ultimately scrapped the project in favor of the Fulgore Mk. I, but years later, Kilgore is reactivated following the events of Gargos's invasion.
Release Date: January 3, 2017

	Shin Hisako - A purified version of Hisako's spirit, discarding her late father's naginata for his katana. Awakened to her true mind and full abilities, Shin Hisako wields her father‚Äôs katana, moving as swiftly as he did in his prime. She has discovered the ability to project her spirit onto the battlefield to surprise, confuse, and devastate the enemies of the light and deliver justice upon them.
Release Date: March 17, 2017

	Eagle - A former Killer Instinct champion and Thunder's younger brother. He was found and captured by Ultratech during his infiltration of the first Killer Instinct tournament. His body was kept in stasis while Ultratech experimented on him with cybernetic enhancements and used his brain as a template for the Fulgore Mk. III's neural network. Ultimately, he is freed from Ultratech by Glacius, who escapes the facility with his body. Eagle utilizes a cybernetic bow and arrows, and is aided by a robotic bird that also serves as his Guardian Spirit.
Release Date: June 27, 2017

Development
On March 16, 2010 Ken Lobb announced that they were not working on a "Killer Instinct 3", but that they might bring the series back someday.[1]

On September 17, 2012 Microsoft applied for renewal of the Killer Instinct trademark. In an October 2012 interview, Rare veteran Lee Musgrave, who was the former head of art at Rare, spoke on the issues of making Killer Instinct for the Xbox Live Arcade (XBLA): "We came close to firing off a conversion of Killer Instinct a few times, but there were licensing obstacles to that, and it never really had enough perceived interest to push it forward." On December 4, 2012, Microsoft's renewal for the Killer Instinct trademark was rejected by the United States Patent and Trademark Office due to the possibility of the game being confused with the unrelated TV series of the same name that lasted for one season in 2005. Microsoft had six months to respond to the ruling. The trademark dispute was settled when Microsoft and Fox reached an agreement in April 2013.

On June 10, 2013 at the Microsoft E3 2013 Press Conference, Killer Instinct was announced as being an exclusive Xbox One title, developed by Double Helix Games. The revealed trailer showed 3 returning characters from the franchise: Jago, Sabrewulf and Glacius. An interview with the development team also revealed that 3 more characters would be returning in the future: Cinder, Fulgore and Spinal. Developers also said that they would like to bring more female characters to the Killer Instinct franchise.

In an interview, Killer Instinct will use a specific marketing strategy. After the initial release, a free demo would be available, featuring Jago as the only playable character (including his Story, Training and Online mode against other fighters). Players would be able to purchase the full game pack or fighters individually.[2]

Only July 14th, 2013 it was revealed in a teaser trailer at EVO 2013 that Chief Thunder would be making a return.[3]

On September 24th, 2013 Sadira's official trailer and Orchid's teaser trailer were released.

On October 31st, 2013 Orchid's official trailer and Spinal's teaser trailer were released.

On November 22nd, 2013 the first version of Killer Instinct Season 1 was released for download on Xbox One.

On January 30th, 2014 Spinal's official trailer and Fulgore's teaser trailer were released.

On March 27th, 2014 Fulgore's official trailer was released. Microsoft also announced that Killer Instinct would continue to be supported by Iron Galaxy Studios due to the acquisition of Double Helix, and they would continue with the development of Season 2.

On June 9th, 2014 TJ Combo's official trailer was released. The trailer also revealed that Season 2 would begin later in the fall of 2014.

On September 17th, 2014 Maya's official trailer and Kan-Ra's teaser trailer were released, marking the beginning of Season 2. Maya was set to be available at the launch of Season 2 alongside TJ Combo on October 15th, 2015.

On September 23th, 2014 A retail version of Killer Instinct was released, dubbed the "Killer Instinct Combo Breaker Pack". The physical release contained all the content included in the Season One Combo Breaker Pack, including a download code that gives early access to Season 2 fighter TJ Combo.

On October 14th, 2014 the day before Season 2's launch, Robin Beanland and Mick Gordon released the full soundtracks of Killer Instinct: Season One and the original arcade game Killer Instinct in a bundle on iTunes and Google Music.

On November 21st, 2014 Kan-Ra's official trailer and Riptor's teaser trailer were released. Kan-Ra was set to be available to Ultra Edition owners on November 23rd, 2014.

On December 15th, 2014 Riptor's official trailer and Omen's teaser trailer were released. Riptor was set to be available to Ultra Edition owners on December 17th, 2014.

On January 24th, 2015 Omen's official trailer and Aganos' teaser trailer were released. Omen was set to be available exclusively to Ultra Edition owners on January 30th, 2015.

On February 20th, 2015 Aganos's official trailer and Hisako's teaser trailer were released. Aganos was set to be available to Ultra Edition owners the next week on February 27th, 2015.

On March 26th, 2015 Hisako's official trailer and Cinder's teaser trailer were released. Hisako was set to be available to Ultra Edition owners the next day on March 27th, 2015.

On April 27th, 2015 Cinder's official trailer and ARIA's teaser trailer were released. Cinder was set to be available to Ultra Edition owners on April 30th, 2015.

On April 30th, 2015 the same day as Cinder's launch, the Shadow Jago Community Fund was announced. For two weeks a Shadow Jago pack was available for purchase that yielded the Shadow Jago character and 7500 KI Gold. All proceeds from Killer Instinct profits during these two weeks were donated to the competitive tournament scene. When the Killer Instinct Community Fund reached its goal of $100,000 by only May 4th, it was announced that Shadow Jago would be getting his own unique moveset by the end of 2015.

On May 27th, 2015 ARIA's official trailer was released. ARIA was set to be available to Ultra Edition owners on May 29th, 2015.

On June 16th, 2015 Phil Spencer announced at E3 2015 that Killer Instinct would eventually be ported to Windows 10 for PC, and would feature cross-platform play with the Xbox One. No date was specified at the event.[4]

On June 17th, 2015 Rivals Mode was released, the official "story mode" of Killer Instinct Season 2. This update acted as the final revision of Season 2.

On August 4th, 2015 Season 3 was confirmed to be in development at Gamescom 2015 and would release alongside the upcoming PC port of Killer Instinct in March 2016. Not only that, but guest character Rash from the Battletoads series was announced to be part of Season 3, and that he would be having a short testing period that would allow players to use the character and give feedback from August 4th to September 8th. Aside from Gamescom, the digital version soundtrack for Season 2 was also released on iTunes and Amazon. Shortly after releasing the soundtrack, composer Mick Gordon left the project and his place was taken by a pair of composers known as Atlas Plug and Celldweller for Season 3.

On August 5th, 2015 Rash's official trailer and Kim Wu's teaser trailer were released. While Season 3 hadn't been fully released yet, Rash was still available to players for testing purposes until September 8th.

On December 1st, 2015 Shadow Jago's official trailer was released, stating that he would be "unleashed" on December 4th. Shadow Jago was available to purchase from December 18th, 2015 to January 15th, 2016.

The first official Killer Instinct World Cup was held on January 30th and 31st of 2016. At the event Kim Wu was fully revealed and players were given a chance to play as her. Another guest character, Arbiter from the Halo series, was teased as well.

On February 21, 2016 Arbiter's official trailer was released. No further announcements were made at the time of its release, but on February 24 the trailer was updated with a teaser trailer for Tusk added to the end of it.

On March 4, 2016 Tusk's official trailer was released. No further announcements were made at the time of its release, but on March 24 the trailer was updated with a teaser trailer for Mira added to the end of it.

On March 28, 2016 the official Killer Instinct Season 3 launch trailer was released. It showcased the game's updated visuals, cross-platform play between Xbox One and Windows 10, and new costumes and accessories for Kim Wu, Arbiter, Tusk, and Rash. It also announced that Mira would be released some time in April 2016, while Gargos would be released in May. The Shadow Lords game mode was shown for the first time, and it was announced it would be available some time later during the season. Additionally, it teased new characters to be released in June and July and a new multiplayer mode also for June. Season 3 was released the following day on March 29.

On April 24, 2016 Mira's official trailer was released. She herself was later made available on April 27th.

On May 20, 2016 Rukari Austin, the Community Manager of Killer Instinct gave an Early Access to Gargos out to a limited number of people in Killer Instinct community.

On May 27, 2016 Gargos's official trailer was released, and he himself was later made available on the same date.

On June 13, 2016 General RAAM from the Gears of War series was revealed at the Microsoft E3 Press Conference. He himself was later made available on the same date and playable for free users until June 28, 2016.

On July 2, 2016 Microsoft and Iron Galaxy have started up a brand new survey for the Killer Instinct community to help shape the future of the KI Cast. The survey includes some basic questions such as ‚Äúhow many hours do you play KI a week? and ‚Äúwhat character do you play as the most?‚Äù and it also has some very interesting questions regarding the roster in general. Some of those including characters being reimagined like Shadow Orchid and TJ Combo and also brand new characters which includes options for Joanna Dark, Eyedol, a Crackdown Agent and more.

On July 12, 2016 A Killer Cuts Vinyl was announced and it would be available on July 17 at EVO.

On July 13, 2016 Killer Instinct: Definitive Edition was announced and would release on September 20th. This physical copy includes all characters (including Special Edition Shadow Jago) and contents from all three Seasons. It also includes the two classic Killer Instinct for Xbox One, Original Soundtrack CD and an exclusive Gold and Platinum color for Gargos.

On July 17, 2016 in the Killer Instinct finals of EVO 2016, Eyedol was revealed to be the final character of Season 3, and thus the final character of the original KI1 cast to be revealed.

On September 20, 2016 The Shadow Lords Mode was released, considering the finale of Season 3. During its release, the digital version soundtrack for Season 3 was also announced and it will be available on October 25th.

On December 9, 2016 The PC version of Killer Instinct: Definitive Edition was announced and it will be released on December 21, 2016 including new costume for Thunder. Also on Twitter, a user named Julian Duran has posted images and video of what may be a brand new Killer Instinct character known as ‚ÄúKilgore‚Äù, a new character looks a bit like classic character Fulgore, except with a different face, and what seems to be a gatling gun on his arm.

On January 3, 2017 Kilgore was available for $10 and at the end of its livestream, Jago was revealed to have been given his own Ultimate. Ultimates for any, or perhaps all, of the other characters might be coming soon.

On February 14, 2017, Ultimates for the first five characters (Jago, Thunder, TJ Combo, Maya and Tusk) was released and was downloaded for free.

On February 21, 2017, The official Killer Instinct Twitter account posted a quick video that features smoke slowly billowing by, revealing a line of text. It references "And there exists yet another Coalesced Guardian in the form of a Japanese katana." Hinting that it would be a Katana wielding character.[5]

On March 2, 2017, Shin Hisako was revealed, she will be released in March 10 at KI World Cup.

On March 11, 2017, at the KI World Cup, it is announced that Shin Hisako will be available on March 21, 2017 for $4.99; there will be two Gold Skin pack (Glacius, Sadira and Mira ‚Äî available on March 17, 2017; Spinal, Kan-Ra and Hisako ‚Äî availble on April 11, 2017); Omen will have three more skin colors to be available in the summer; the next five characters (Fulgore, Sadira, Riptor, ARIA and Kilgore) for the Ultimates will released on May 2, 2017 and it will be downloaded for free.

Fulgore was the first character for the next Ultimates pack to be shown at the event.
On May 28, 2017, Eagle was announced as the third and final character for the post-Season 3, and would make his debut on June 2017.

On June 8, 2017, the next five Ultimates for the next characters (Sabrewulf, Glacius, Aganos, Hisako and Mira) in what is called the "Ultimates Monster Pack" will be released and downloaded for free this August 2017.

On June 11, 2017, during Microsoft's E3 Press Conference, it was announced that Killer Instinct would receive a major graphical upgrade to 4K resolution once the Xbox One X (formerly known as "Project Scorpio") was released in November 2017.

On June 14, 2017, Eagle's official trailer was revealed and he will be released on June 27th, 2017.

On June 17, 2017, at CEO 2017, it was confirmed that Killer Instinct will be available to play on Steam this year.

On June 23, 2017, it is announced that the three new Omen skin colors would be available for purchase in July, and a video of Aganos' Ultimate was shown ahead of the release of the Ultimates Monster Pack due in August.

On July 18, 2017, the Omen Color Pack (containing Colors 7-9) became available for purchase only in the Killer Instinct in-game store (not in the Xbox Store), all for only $1.

On August 22, 2017, the Ultimates Monster Pack was released and downloaded for free, and according to a tweet by Season 3 co-composer Celldweller, the remaining music tracks for the Post-Season 3 characters - Kilgore, Shin Hisako, and Eagle - will be digitally available for download on August 25th.

On September 27, 2017, Killer Instinct (2013) is now released on Steam with every DLC content in there, including the Post-S3 characters, and supports cross-platform play in CERTAIN modes (not Ranked). It also comes with the Killer Cuts edition, which includes the Complete Soundtrack containing every song, including the recently KI Singles.

On August 4, 2023 at EVO 2023, in celebration of the game's 10th anniversary, Microsoft and Iron Galaxy announced that Killer Instinct would be receiving a new update, which would include new balance changes, improved online matchmaking, and native 4K resolution support on Xbox Series X/S.

On November 22, 2023 during the Anniversary stream, it was confirmed that Killer Instinct Definitive Edition will retire in favor of a new Anniversary Edition release. The free-to-play version will also be added on Steam while for those who previously purchased the game will received a permanent VIP Double XP Booster along with Gargos Golden God Skin and an Argent Shroud Colors.[6]

2.content:
Jago is a mysterious warrior monk from a remote region of Tibet. A major signature character of the Killer Instinct series and one of its main protagonists, Jago has been playable in every installment of the franchise to date. Guided by the mysterious Tiger Spirit to seek his destiny, he has been led to the Killer Instinct tournament to destroy the evil within. He is the younger half-brother of Orchid.

When possessed by the demon herald Omen, he becomes a shadow version of himself.
