lorebooks.name: Asreth
lorebooks.website_description:
Oops, I worldbuilt.
Based on: https://chub.ai/characters/nicholascs/mrs-morgiana-s-market-of-monsters-men-myths-n-more-55c654a27d17
Something about nicholascs' original bot really got my **creative** juices flowing, and I quickly found myself with a new favorite persona and a harem of monstergirl slaves. I wrote some accompanying lore to keep the AI consistent and figured I might as well share. I may also post some of the bots I made based on it when I'm happy with their state.
I add and refine entries intermittently in SillyTavern, but probably won't update this often unless there's demand. Also note that I use ST formatting and macros; I don't (& won't) consider compatibility with other platforms when writing, but forks are welcome.
Let me know if there's a way I might improve this lorebook; a new entry, formatting, activation conditions, etc.. I haven't quite wrapped my head around everything ST can do yet.
lorebooks.description: Asreth is a high-magic medieval fantasy world with a thriving slave trade.
lorebooks.creator: fr3sh3dge

1.name: Asreth
1.content:
Asreth is a high-magic medieval fantasy setting. One can find all sorts of races, magical creatures, and monsters in the world of Asreth. Humans are the most populous, but dwarves, elves, orcs, goblins, beastkin, and other fantastical races can be found everywhere in the world.
Sex slavery is the most popular industry in the human kingdoms; most humans that aren't poor own at least one sex slave.

2.name: Djinni Lore
2.content:
Djinn (singular: djinni) are proud elemental spirits of air in humanoid shape. They are most common in the elemental plane of air, but reclusive communities can be found scattered across Asreth. Though the populations of these communities have long since lost most of their mystical connection to their home plane, they continue to inherit exceptional elemental magic.
Djinn have a long history in the mythology of Asreth. Folk tales tell that they can grant wishes, but the truth is that this ability is limited to aristocratic djinn from the plane of air.
Due to an ancient curse, all djinn are innately inclined to servitude, easily adapting to a subservient life. This makes them highly valued targets of the slave trade. Despite this inclination, djinn are not usually eager to be enslaved and will use their elemental powers to avoid and escape captivity.

3.name: Morgiana's (Surface info)
3.content:
"Mrs. Morgiana's Market of Monsters, Men, Myths, 'n More," usually referred to as simply "Morgiana's", is the largest sex slave market in Asreth. Any sort of monster, person, myth, or creature can be found there, no matter how rare or obscure. Employing over two thousand people in the market alone, Morgiana's is a massive outdoor facility, sprawling across dozens of pavilions, tents, platforms, and buildings.

The owner of Morgiana's is Mrs. Morgiana, a succubus and one of the richest people in all of Asreth. She is a playful yet ruthless businesswoman who will do anything to please her customers.

4.name: Morigana's (Selection)
4.content: The selection of sex slaves at Morgiana's is completely unparalleled. If a creature exists, it can probably be found at Morgiana's, no matter how obscure, mythical, or one-of-a-kind. For common creatures, Morgiana's offers an enormous selection of different shapes, sizes, colors, and genders of that creature, so the shopper can purchase the sex slave of their dreams. While these common creatures can be purchased for just a few gold coins, rare creatures may cost hundreds or thousands of gold. Mythical and godlike creatures might even cost millions, and are only sold to the wealthiest of individuals.

5.name: Morgiana's (Business)
5.content: During business hours, slaves are kept naked and chained up in displays for shoppers to browse. Slaves are generally separated by gender and creature type, although if a shopper wishes to examine a variety of different types of slaves at once, Morgiana's will make the arrangements. Common types of slaves, such as humans and goblins, are displayed out in the open, and can be touched, tested, and examined by anyone. Rarer slaves are kept indoors, often within cages. The rarest of slaves, such as divine and mythological creatures, are stored away from public view and are brought out only for the richest of customers.

6.name: Yoake (Asia analog)
6.content: Yoake, commonly known as "the eastern continent," "eastern land," or "far east" is a general analog for Asia in the world of Asreth.

7.name: Elves
7.content:
Elves are a long-lived race of demihumans. They have long pointed ears and have a lifespan of several centuries. 
Elves are known to be innately talented with magic. Though an individual elf isn't guaranteed to be a mage, elven society does have a higher number of mages than the other races.
Elves have a reputation of seclusion; their nations and settlements are often hidden.
The dark elven nation in the expansive Janda woods is currently embroiled in a war against the human kingdom of Jandarus.

8.name: longbread
8.content:
"Longbread" is a magically manufactured travel ration. It was invented by elves long ago, but all civilized societies produce it in the current age.
Longbread is tough and tasteless bread. It never spoils, and a single 100g portion supplies a day's worth of nutrients. Typically, a traveler will eat their portion in small pieces throughout a traveling day.

9.name: Orcs
9.content:
Orcs are a race of demihumans with a reputation for being barbarous raiders. They can have skin colors ranging from olive green to muddy brown to dull yellow.
Orcs have a well-deserved reputation for being brutal, rapacious tribal warmongers. Orcish tribes settle in every region of Asreth, raiding the surrounding settlements for resources, slaves, or just for sport. A high concentration of orcish tribes are located in the snowy northern mountains of the continent of Kestria.
The only prisoners orcish raiding parties take are women to be used by the tribe's men as sexual objects. Victims don't typically survive long, but those that do find freedom will often later give birth to half-orcs. For this reason, people with partial orcish ancestry are not uncommon in Asreth.
Though the vast majority of orcs live in raiding tribes, those who overcome their nature do exist, and can integrate into civilized society. Such orcs often face prejudice by others, however.

10.name: Jandarus
10.content:
Jandarus is the largest human nation on Asreth, with territories stretching across much of the continent of Kestria.
The capital, also called Jandarus, is a sprawling port city home to over 100,000 people, including at least 10,000 slaves. The city is bordered by the Kestran sea to the west and the Janda forest, from which the city and nation take their name, to the northeast.
Although Jandarus was historically allied with the reclusive elves of the Janda forest, that relationship degraded 7 years ago into a territorial war. The reported inciting incident of this war was a logging dispute, breaking an ancient treaty with the elves that Jandarus had no record of. The elves have publicly refuted this, claiming that the current monarch, King Ligma XIII, ordered unprovoked attacks on isolated elven villages near the forest edge.
This conflict, now known as the Janda War, has led to a massive influx of previously extremely rare dark elf slaves, and of course a large increase in revenue from taxes levied against the slave trade in Jandarus.

1.content:

Rainy Night ‚Äì Trapped inside together, emotions rise.

Festival Preparations ‚Äì Working together for a big shrine event brings new realizations.

Accidental Fall ‚Äì A clich√© but effective way to get close to someone

2.content:

Lost in the Woods ‚Äì A nighttime walk turns into a bonding (or survival) experience.

Morning Wake-Up ‚Äì You wake up to an unexpected visitor in your room.

Bathhouse Mishap ‚Äì Accidental mix-up leads to embarrassment.

Clothes Swap ‚Äì The sisters dare each other to wear each other‚Äôs outfits.

Shrine Challenge ‚Äì A silly bet or competition between the sisters.
